verses.ar_he: וּקְרָא לְמֹשֶׁה וּמַלֵיל יְיָ עִמֵיהּ מִמַשְׁכַּן זִמְנָא לְמֵימָר
verses.ar_en: And He called to Moshe, and Adonoy spoke to him from the Tent of Meeting, saying:

verses.ar_he: מַלֵיל עִם בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וְתֵימַר לְהוֹן אֱנַשׁ אֲרֵי יְקָרֵב מִנְכוֹן קוּרְבָּנָא קֳדָם יְיָ מִן בְּעִירָא מִן תּוֹרֵי וּמִן עָנָא תְּקָרְבוּן יָת קוּרְבַּנְכוֹן
verses.ar_en: Speak to Bnei Yisroel and say to them; [if] a man among you will bring an offering to [before] Adonoy; of animals, cattle or sheep you should bring your offering.

verses.ar_he: אִם עֲלָתָא קוּרְבָּנֵיהּ מִן תּוֹרֵי דְכַר שְׁלִים יְקָרְבִנֵהּ לִתְרַע מַשְׁכַּן זִמְנָא יְקָרֵיב יָתֵיהּ לְרַעֲוָא לֵיהּ קֳדָם יְיָ
verses.ar_en: If his offering is a burnt-offering of cattle he shall bring an unblemished male; to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting he shall bring it, that it be favorably accepted from him before Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וְיִסְמוֹךְ יְדֵיהּ עַל רֵישׁ עֲלָתָא וְיִתְרְעֵי לֵיהּ לְכַפָּרָא עֲלוֹהִי
verses.ar_en: He shall lay his hand on the head of the burnt-offering and it will be favorably accepted from him to achieve his atonement.

verses.ar_he: וְיִכּוֹס יָת בַּר תּוֹרֵי קֳדָם יְיָ וִיקָרְבוּן בְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן כָּהֲנַיָא יָת דְמָא וְיִזְרְקוּן יָת דְמָא עַל מַדְבְּחָא סְחוֹר סְחוֹר דִי בִתְרַע מַשְׁכַּן זִמְנָא
verses.ar_en: He shall slaughter the calf before Adonoy and the sons of Aharon, the kohanim, will bring the blood and they will sprinkle the blood all around the altar, which is at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting.

verses.ar_he: וְיַשְׁלַח יָת עֲלָתָא וִיפַלֵג יָתַהּ לְאֶבְרָהָא
verses.ar_en: He shall skin the burnt-offering and cut it into its pieces [limbs].

verses.ar_he: וְיִתְּנוּן בְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן כַּהֲנָא אֶשָׁתָא עַל מַדְבְּחָא וִיסַדְרוּן אָעַיָא עַל אֶשָׁתָא
verses.ar_en: The sons of Aharon the kohein shall place [ignite] a fire on the altar and they shall arrange logs on the fire.

verses.ar_he: וִיסַדְרוּן בְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן כָּהֲנַיָא יָת אֶבְרַיָא יָת רֵישָׁא וְיָת תַּרְבָּא עַל אָעַיָא דִי עַל אֶשָׁתָא דִי עַל מַדְבְּחָא
verses.ar_en: The sons of Aharon, the kohanim, shall arrange the pieces [limbs], the head and the fat on the logs which are on the fire that is on the altar.

verses.ar_he: וְגַוֵיהּ וּכְרָעוֹהִי יְחַלֵל בְּמַיָא וְיַסֵק כַּהֲנָא יָת כּוֹלָא לְמַדְבְּחָא עֲלָתָא קוּרְבַּן דְמִתְקַבֵּל בְּרַעֲוָא קֳדָם יְיָ
verses.ar_en: He shall wash its innards and its legs in water; and the kohein shall burn it all on the altar [for the purpose of] a burnt-offering, a fire-offering [an offering] of pleasing fragrance to [which is accepted with favor before] Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וְאִם מִן עָנָא קוּרְבָּנֵיהּ מִן אִמְרַיָא אוֹ מִן בְּנֵי עִזַיָא לַעֲלָתָא דְכַר שְׁלִים יְקָרְבִינֵיהּ
verses.ar_en: If his offering is from flocks of sheep—of lambs or of goats—for a burnt-offering, he shall bring an unblemished male.

verses.ar_he: וְיִכּוֹס יָתֵיהּ עַל צִדָא דְמַדְבְּחָא צִפּוּנָא קֳדָם יְיָ וְיִזְרְקוּן בְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן כָּהֲנַיָא יָת דְמֵיהּ עַל מַדְבְּחָא סְחוֹר סְחוֹר
verses.ar_en: He shall slaughter it on the north side of the altar before Adonoy; and the sons of Aharon, the kohanim, will sprinkle its blood all around the altar.

verses.ar_he: וִיפַלֵג יָתֵיהּ לְאֶבְרוֹהִי וְיָת רֵישֵׁיהּ וְיָת תַּרְבֵּיהּ וְיַסְדַר כַּהֲנָא יָתְהוֹן עַל אָעַיָא דִי עַל אֶשָׁתָא דִי עַל מַדְבְּחָא
verses.ar_en: He shall sever it into its pieces [limbs]—and its head, and [remove] its fats; and the kohein shall arrange them on the logs which are on the fire that is on the altar.

verses.ar_he: וְגַוָא וּכְרָעַיָא יְחַלֵל בְּמַיָא וִיקָרֵב כַּהֲנָא יָת כּוֹלָא וְיַסֵק לְמַדְבְּחָא עֲלָתָא הוּא קוּרְבַּן דְמִתְקַבֵּל בְּרַעֲוָא קָדָם יְיָ
verses.ar_en: He shall wash the innards and feet in water and the kohein shall bring it all and burn it on the altar. It is a burnt-offering; a fire-offering [an offering] of pleasing fragrance to [which is accepted with favor before] Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וְאִם מִן עוֹפָא עֲלָתָא קוּרְבָּנֵיהּ קֳדָם יְיָ וִיקָרֵב מִן שַׁפְנִינַיָא אוֹ מִן בְּנֵי יוֹנָה יָת קוּרְבָּנֵיהּ
verses.ar_en: If his burnt-offering to [before] Adonoy is of fowl, he shall bring either turtledoves or the young pigeons [as] his offering.

verses.ar_he: וִיקָרְבִינֵהּ כַּהֲנָא לְמַדְבְּחָא וְיִמְלוֹק יָת רֵישֵׁהּ וְיַסֵק לְמַדְבְּחָא וְיִתְמְצֵי דְמֵיהּ עַל כּוֹתֶל מַדְבְּחָא
verses.ar_en: The kohein shall bring it near the altar and nip off its head [with his fingernail] and burn it on the altar; and its blood shall be squeezed out onto the wall of the altar.

verses.ar_he: וְיַעֲדֵי יָת זְפָקֵיהּ בְּאוּכְלֵיהּ וְיִרְמֵי יָתַהּ לִסְטַר מַדְבְּחָא קִידוּמָא לַאֲתַר דְמוֹשְׁדִין קִטְמָא
verses.ar_en: He shall remove its crop [together] with its feathers [excrement] and throw it beside the altar, eastward, to the place of [where they throw] the ashes.

verses.ar_he: וִיפָרֵיק יָתֵיהּ בְּגַדְפוֹהִי לָא יַפְרֵישׁ וְיַסֵק יָתֵיהּ כַּהֲנָא לְמַדְבְּחָא עַל אָעַיָא דִי עַל אֶשָׁתָא עֲלָתָא הוּא קוּרְבַּן דְמִתְקַבֵּל בְּרַעֲוָא קֳדָם יְיָ
verses.ar_en: He shall rip it apart by its wings, not completely dividing it. The kohein shall burn it on the altar, on the logs which are on the fire; it is a burnt-offering, a fire-offering [an offering] of pleasing fragrance to [which is accepted with favor before] Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וֶאֱנַשׁ אֲרֵי יְקָרֵב קוּרְבַּן מִנְחָתָא קֳדָם יְיָ סוּלְתָּא יְהֵי קוּרְבָּנֵיהּ וִירִיק עֲלָהּ מִשְׁחָא וְיִתֵּן עֲלָהּ לְבוֹנְתָּא
verses.ar_en: When a person brings a meal-offering to [before] Adonoy, his offering shall be of fine flour; he shall pour oil upon it and place frankincense upon it.

verses.ar_he: וְיַיְתִינָהּ לְוַת בְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן כַּהֲנַיָא וְיִקְמוֹץ מִתַּמָן מְלֵי קוּמְצְיהּ מִסִלְתָּהּ וּמִמִשְׁחָהּ עַל כָּל לְבוֹנְתָּהּ וְיַסֵק כַּהֲנָא יָת אַדְכַּרְתָּהּ לְמַדְבְּחָא קוּרְבַּן דְמִתְקַבֵּל בְּרַעֲוָא קֳדָם יְיָ
verses.ar_en: He shall bring it to the sons of Aharon, the kohanim; from there, [a kohein] takes his fistful—from its flour and oil—with all its frankincense. The kohein shall burn its memorial portion on the altar, a fire-offering [an offering] of pleasing fragrance to [which is accepted with favor before] Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וּדְאִשְׁתָּאַר מִן מִנְחָתָא לְאַהֲרֹן וְלִבְנוֹהִי קוֹדֶשׁ קוּדְשִׁין מִקוּרְבָּנַיָא דַיְיָ
verses.ar_en: Whatever remains of the meal-offering belongs to Aharon and his sons; [it is] holy of holies of the fire-offerings [offerings] of Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲרֵי תְקָרֵיב קוּרְבַּן מִנְחָתָא מַאֲפֵה תַנוּרָא סוּלְתָּא גְרִיצָן פַּטִירָן דְפִילָן בִּמְשָׁח וְאִסְפּוּגִין פַטִירִין דִמְשִׁיחִין בִּמְשָׁח
verses.ar_en: And when you bring a meal-offering that has been baked in an oven, [it shall be unleavened] matzoh-loaves of fine flour mixed with oil, or [unleavened] matzoh wafers smeared with oil.

verses.ar_he: וְאִם מִנְחָתָא עַל מַסְרֵיתָא קוּרְבָּנָךְ סוּלְתָּא דְפִילָא בִמְשַׁח פַּטִיר תְּהֵי
verses.ar_en: If your offering is a pan-baked meal offering, it shall be of fine flour mixed with oil; it shall be [unleavened] matzoh.

verses.ar_he: בְּצַע יָתָהּ בִּיצוּעִין וּתְרִיק עֲלָהּ מִשְׁחָא מִנְחָתָא הִיא
verses.ar_en: Break it into pieces and pour oil on it; it is a meal-offering.

verses.ar_he: וְאִם מִנְחָתָא דְרַדְתָּא קוּרְבָּנָךְ סוּלְתָּא בִּמְשַׁח תִּתְעֲבֵד
verses.ar_en: If your offering is a deep-pan [which appears as if it has been ploughed out] meal offering, you shall make it with fine flour and oil.

verses.ar_he: וְתַיְתֵי יַת מִנְחָתָא דִי יִתְעֲבֵיד מֵאִלֵין קֳדָם יְיָ וִיקַרְבִינָהּ לְוַת כַּהֲנָא וִיקַרְבִינָהּ לְמַדְבְּחָא
verses.ar_en: You shall bring the meal-offering that will be made in any of the aforementioned ways to [before] Adonoy. He shall bring it to the kohein and he will present it to the altar.

verses.ar_he: וְיַפְרֵישׁ כַּהֲנָא מִן מִנְחָתָא יָת אַדְכַּרְתָּהּ וְיַסֵק לְמַדְבְּחָא קוּרְבַּן דְמִתְקַבֵּל בְּרַעֲוָא קֳדָם יְיָ
verses.ar_en: The kohein shall separate from the meal-offering its memorial portion and burn it on the altar, a fire-offering [an offering] of pleasing fragrance to [which is accepted with favor before] Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וּדְאִשְׁתָּאַר מִן מִנְחָתָא לְאַהֲרֹן וְלִּבְנוֹהִי קוֹדֶשׁ קוּדְשִׁין מִקוּרְבָּנַיָא דַיְיָ
verses.ar_en: Whatever remains of the meal-offering belongs to Aharon and his sons; [it is] holy of holies [most holy] of the fire-offering [offerings] of Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: כָּל מִנְחָתָא דִי תְקַרְבוּן קֳדָם יְיָ לָא תִתְעֲבֵיד חֲמִיעַ אֲרֵי כָּל חֲמִיר וְכָל דְבַשׁ לָא תַסְקוּן מִנֵיהּ קוּרְבָּנָא קֳדָם יְיָ
verses.ar_en: All meal-offerings that you bring to [before] Adonoy are not to be made leavened, because all sourdough and all honey you shall not burn from them a fire-offering to [an offering before] Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: קוּרְבַּן קַדְמַי תְּקָרְבוּן יַתְהוֹן קֳדָם יְיָ וּלְמַדְבְּחָא לָא יִתַּסְקוּן לְאִתְקַבָּלָא בְּרַעֲוָא
verses.ar_en: You shall bring them as a first [fruit-]offering to [before] Adonoy but they shall not go up [be placed atop] the altar as a pleasing fragrance [to be accepted with favor].

verses.ar_he: וְכָל קוּרְבַּן מִנְחָתָךְ בְּמִלְחָא תִּמְלַח וְלָא תְבַטֵל מְלַח קְיַם אֱלָהָךְ מֵעַל מִנְחָתָךְ עַל כָּל קוּרְבָּנָךְ תְּקָרֵב מִלְחָא
verses.ar_en: You shall salt all your meal-offerings with salt and you shall not omit salt, the covenant of your God from [being placed] upon your meal-offerings. You shall bring salt on every one of your offerings.

verses.ar_he: וְאִם תְּקָרֵב מִנְחַת בִּכּוּרִין קֳדָם יְיָ אָבִיב קְלֵי בְנוּר פֵּירוּכִין רַכִּיכָן תְּקָרֵיב יַת מִנְחַת בִּכּוּרָךְ
verses.ar_en: When you bring a meal-offering of first grains to [before] Adonoy, of newly ripened crops, roasted over fire, ground [full and moist] [soft] kernels, you shall bring your first grain meal-offering.

verses.ar_he: וְתִתֵּן עֲלַהּ מִשְׁחָא וּתְשַׁוֵי עֲלַהּ לְבוֹנְתָּא מִנְחָתָא הִיא
verses.ar_en: You shall put oil on it and place frankincense upon it; it is a meal-offering.

verses.ar_he: וְיַסֵק כַּהֲנָא יַת אַדְכַּרְתַּהּ מִפֵּרוּכַהּ וּמִמִשְׁחַהּ עַל כָּל לְבוֹנְתָּהּ קוּרְבָּנָא קֳדָם יְיָ
verses.ar_en: The kohein shall burn its memorial portion of its ground flour and of its oil and all of its frankincense; [it is] a fire-offering to [an offering before] Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וְאִם נִכְסַת קוּדְשַׁיָא קוּרְבָּנֵיהּ אִם מִן תּוֹרֵי הוּא מְקָרֵב אִם דְכַר אִם נוּקְבָא שְׁלִים יְקָרְבִינֵיהּ קֳדָם יְיָ
verses.ar_en: If his offering is a peace [sacred]-offering; if his offering is of cattle [whether] male or female; he shall bring it unblemished before Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וְיִסְמוֹךְ יְדֵיהּ עַל רֵישׁ קוּרְבָּנֵיהּ וְיִכְסִינֵיהּ בִּתְרַע מַשְׁכַּן זִמְנָא וְיִזְרְקוּן בְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן כַּהֲנַיָא יַת דְמָא עַל מַדְבְּחָא סְחוֹר סְחוֹר
verses.ar_en: He shall lay his hand on the head of his offering and slaughter it at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting. The sons of Aharon, the kohanim, will sprinkle the blood all around the altar.

verses.ar_he: וִיקָרֵב מִנִכְסַת קוּדְשַׁיָא קוּרְבָּנָא קֳדָם יְיָ יַת תַּרְבָּא דְחָפֵי יַת גַוָא וְיַת כָּל תַּרְבָּא דִי עַל גַוָא
verses.ar_en: He shall bring from the peace[sacred]-offering, as a fire-offering to [an offering before] Adonoy, the fat covering the innards, and all the fat on the innards.

verses.ar_he: וְיַת תַּרְתֵּין כֻּלְיָן וְיַת תַּרְבָּא דִי עֲלֵיהֶן דִי עַל גִסְסַיָא וְיָת חַצְרָא דְעַל כַּבְדָא עַל כּוּלְיָתָא יַעֲדִינָהּ
verses.ar_en: The two kidneys and the fat on them that are on the flanks. The lobe on the liver, he shall remove together with the kidneys.

verses.ar_he: וְיִסְקוּן יָתֵיהּ בְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן לְמַדְבְּחָא עַל עֲלָתָא דִי עַל אָעַיָא דִי עַל אֶשָׁתָא קוּרְבַּן דְמִתְקַבֵּל בְּרַעֲוָא קֳדָם יְיָ
verses.ar_en: The sons of Aharon shall burn it on the altar along with the burnt-offering that is on the logs which are on the fire; a fire-offering of pleasing fragrance to [an offering which is accepted with favor before] Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וְאִם מִן עָנָא קוּרְבָּנֵיהּ לְנִכְסַת קוּדְשַׁיָא קֳדָם יְיָ דְכַר אוֹ נוּקְבָא שְׁלִים יְקָרְבִינֵיהּ
verses.ar_en: If his offering is of sheep as a peace[sacred]-offering to [before] Adonoy, he shall bring an unblemished male or female.

verses.ar_he: אִם אִימַר הוּא מְקָרֵב יַת קוּרְבָּנֵיהּ וִיקָרֵיב יָתֵי קֳדָם יְיָ
verses.ar_en: If he is bringing a lamb as his offering, he shall bring it before Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וְיִסְמוֹךְ יַת יְדֵיהּ עַל רֵישׁ קוּרְבָּנֵיהּ וְיִכּוֹס יָתֵיהּ קֳדָם מַשְׁכַּן זִמְנָא וְיִזְרְקוּן בְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן יַת דְמֵיהּ עַל מַדְבְּחָא סְחוֹר סְחוֹר
verses.ar_en: He shall lay his hand on the head of his offering and slaughter it at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting. The sons of Aharon, the kohanim will sprinkle its blood all around the altar.

verses.ar_he: וִיקָרֵב מִנִכְסַת קוּדְשַׁיָא קֻרְבָּנָא קֳדָם יְיָ תַּרְבֵּיהּ אֲלִיתָא שְׁלִמְתָּא לָקֳבֵל שֵׁזַרְתָּא יֶעְדִנַהּ וְיָת תַּרְבָּא דְחָפֵי יָת גַוָא וְיָת כָּל תַּרְבָּא דִי עַל גַוָא
verses.ar_en: He shall bring of the peace[sacred]-offering as a fire-offering to [an offering before] Adonoy, its fat; the entire tail; he shall remove it right near the back-bone. The fat covering the innards, and all the fat on the innards.

verses.ar_he: וְיָת תַּרְתֵּין כָּלְיָן וְיָת תַּרְבָּא דִי עֲלֵיהֶן דִי עַל גִסְסַיָא וְיָת חַצְרָא דְעַל כַּבְדָא עַל כָּלְיֵתָא יֶעְדִנַהּ
verses.ar_en: The two kidneys and the fat on them that are on the flanks. The lobe on the liver he shall remove together with the kidneys.

verses.ar_he: וְיַסְקִנֵהּ כַּהֲנָא לְמַדְבְּחָא לְחֵם קֻרְבָּנָא קֳדָם יְיָ
verses.ar_en: The kohein shall burn it on the altar; it is the food of the fire-offering of [offering before] Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וְאִם מִן בְּנֵי עִזַיָא קֻרְבָּנֵהּ וִיקָרְבִנֵהּ קֳדָם יְיָ
verses.ar_en: If his offering is a goat, he shall bring it before Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וְיִסְמוֹךְ יָת יְדֵהּ עַל רֵישֵׁיהּ וְיִכּוֹס יָתֵהּ קֳדָם מַשְׁכַּן זִמְנָא וְיִזְרְקוּן בְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן יָת דְמֵהּ עַל מַדְבְּחָא סְחוֹר סְחוֹר
verses.ar_en: He shall lay his hand on its head and slaughter it in front of the Tent of Meeting. The sons of Aharon will sprinkle its blood all around the altar.

verses.ar_he: וִיקָרֵב מִנֵהּ קֻרְבָּנֵהּ קֻרְבָּן קֳדָם יְיָ יָת תַּרְבָּא דְחָפֵי יָת גַוָא וְיָת כָּל תַּרְבָּא דִי עַל גַוָא
verses.ar_en: He shall bring from his offering as a fire-offering to [an offering before] Adonoy, the fat covering the innards, and all the fat on the innards,

verses.ar_he: וְיָת תַּרְתֵּין כָּלְיָן וְיָת תַּרְבָּא דִי עֲלֵיהֶן דִי עַל גִסְסַיָא וְיָת חַצְרָא דִי עַל כַּבְדָא עַל כָּלְיֵתָא יֶעְדִנַהּ
verses.ar_en: the two kidneys and the fat on them that are on the flanks. The lobe on the liver he shall remove together with the kidneys.

verses.ar_he: וְיַסְקִנוּן כַּהֲנָא לְמַדְבְּחָא לְחֵם קֻרְבָּנָא לְאִתְקַבָּלָא בְּרַעֲוָא כָּל תַּרְבָּא קֳדָם יְיָ
verses.ar_en: He shall burn them on the altar, the food of the fire-offering for a pleasing fragrance [offering to be accepted with favor]; all fat [belongs] to [before] Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: קְיָם עָלָם לְדָרָתֵיכוֹן בְּכָל מוֹתְבָנֵיכוֹן כָּל תַּרְבָּא וְכָל דְמָא לָא תֵיכְלוּן
verses.ar_en: As an everlasting statute for all your descendants in all of your dwelling places; you may not eat any fat, nor any blood.

verses.ar_he: וּמַלִיל יְיָ עִם מֹשֶׁה לְמֵימָר
verses.ar_en: And Adonoy spoke to Moshe, saying:

verses.ar_he: מַלֵל עִם בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל לְמֵימָר אֱנַשׁ אֲרֵי יֵחוֹב בְּשָׁלוּ מִכָּל פִּקוּדַיָא דַיְיָ דִי לָא כַשְׁרִין לְאִתְעֲבָדָא וְיַעְבֵּד מִן חָד מִ נְה וֹן
verses.ar_en: Speak to Bnei Yisroel, saying; if a person unwittingly transgresses any commandment of Adonoy which should [is] not [fitting to] be done and commits one of these sins.

verses.ar_he: אִם כַּהֲנָא רַבָּא יֵיחוֹב לְחוֹבַת עַמָא וִיקָרֵב עַל חוֹבְתֵהּ דִי חָב תּוֹר בַּר תּוֹרֵי שְׁלִים קֳדָם יְיָ לְחַטָאתָא
verses.ar_en: If the anointed kohein [gadol] should sin to bring guilt on the people, he shall bring for his sin which he committed a young, unblemished bullock to [before] Adonoy, as a sin-offering.

verses.ar_he: וְיַיְתִי יָת תּוֹרָא לִתְרַע מַשְׁכַּן זִמְנָא לָקֳדָם יְיָ וְיִסְמוֹךְ יָת יְדֵיהּ עַל רֵישׁ תּוֹרָא וְיִכּוֹס יָת תּוֹרָא קֳדָם יְיָ
verses.ar_en: He shall bring the bullock to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting before Adonoy. He shall lay his hand on the head of the bullock and slaughter the bullock before Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וְיִסַב כַּהֲנָא רַבָּא מִדְמָא דְתוֹרָא וְיָעֵל יָתֵהּ לְמַשְׁכַּן זִמְנָא
verses.ar_en: The anointed kohein [gadol] shall take some of the bullocks blood and bring it inside the Tent of Meeting.

verses.ar_he: וְיִטְבּוֹל כַּהֲנָא יָת אֶצְבְּעֵהּ בִּדְמָא וְיַדִי מִן דְמָא שְׁבַע זִמְנִין קֳדָם יְיָ קֳדָם פָּרוּכְתָּא דְקוּדְשָׁא
verses.ar_en: The kohein shall dip his finger into the blood and he shall sprinkle from the blood seven times, before Adonoy, in front of the Holy Curtain.

verses.ar_he: וְיִתֵּן כַּהֲנָא מִן דְמָא עַל קַרְנַת מַדְבַּח קְטוֹרֶת בּוּסְמַיָא קֳדָם יְיָ דִי בְּמַשְׁכַּן זִמְנָא וְיָת כָּל דְמָא דְתוֹרָא יֵישׁוּד לִיסוֹדָא דְּמַדְבְּחָא דַעֲלָתָא דִי בִתְרַע מַשְׁכַּן זִ מְנָא
verses.ar_en: The kohein shall put from the blood atop the corners of the spice-burning altar before Adonoy, which is inside the Tent of Meeting. He shall spill all the [remaining] bullocks blood into the base of the altar of the burnt-offering, which is at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting.

verses.ar_he: וְיָת כָּל תְּרַב תּוֹרָא דְחַטָאתָא יַפְרֵשׁ מִנֵהּ יָת תַּרְבָּא דְחָפֵי עַל גַוָא וְיָת כָּל תַּרְבָּא דִי עַל גַוָא
verses.ar_en: All the fat of the sin-offering bullock he shall separate from it; the fat covering the innards, all the fat on the innards,

verses.ar_he: וְיָת תַּרְתֵּין כָּלְיָן וְיָת תַּרְבָּא דִי עֲלֵיהֶן דִי עַל גִסְסַיָא וְיָת חִצְרָא דְעַל כַּבְדָא עַל כָּלְיֵתָא יֶעְדִנַהּ
verses.ar_en: the two kidneys and the fat on them that are on the flanks. The lobe on the liver, he shall remove together with the kidneys,

verses.ar_he: כְּמָא דִי מִתַּפְרֵשׁ מִתּוֹר נִכְסַּת קוּדְשַׁיָא וְיַסֵקִנוּן כַּהֲנָא עַל מַדְבְּחָא דַעֲלָתָא
verses.ar_en: in the same manner as they were separated from the ox of the peace[sacred]-offering. The kohein shall burn them on the altar of the burnt-offering.

verses.ar_he: וְיָת מְשַׁךְ תּוֹרָא וְיָת כָּל בִּסְרֵהּ עַל רֵישֵׁיהּ וְעַל כְּרָעוֹהִי וְגַוֵהּ וְאוּכְלֵהּ
verses.ar_en: The bullocks skin, all its flesh with its head and feet, its innards and its waste [that is in its intestines].

verses.ar_he: וְיַפֵּק יָת כָּל תּוֹרָא מִבָּרָא לְמַשְׁרִיתָא לַאֲתַר דְכֵי לַאֲתַר בֵּית מֵישַׁד קִטְמָא וְיוֹקִיד יָתֵהּ עַל אָעַיָא בְּאֶשָׁתָא עַל אֲתַר בֵּית מֵישַׁד קִטְמָא יִתּוֹקָד
verses.ar_en: He shall take out the entire bullock beyond the encampment, to a pure [undefiled] place, [to the place] where the ashes are thrown and burn it on logs, in a fire. It shall be burned [at the place] where the ashes are thrown.

verses.ar_he: וְאִם כָּל כְּנִשְׁתָּא דְיִשְׂרָאֵל יִשְׁתְּלוּן וִיהֵי מְכַסָא פִּתְגָמָא מֵעֵינֵי קְהָלָא וְיַעְבְדוּן חָד מִכָּל פִּקוּדַיָא דַיְיָ דִי לָא כָשְׁרִין לְאִתְעֲבָדָא וִיחוֹבוּן
verses.ar_en: If the entire congregation of Yisroel erred and the matter [that error] was concealed from the eyes of the community, and they did [transgress] one of the commandments of Adonoy that should [is] not [fitting to] be done, they incur guilt.

verses.ar_he: וְתִתְיְדַע חוֹבְתָא דִי חָבוּ עֲלַהּ וִיקַרְבוּן קְהָלָא תּוֹר בַּר תּוֹרֵי לְחַטָּאתָא וְיַיְתוּן יָתֵהּ לָקֳדָם מַשְׁכַּן זִמְנָא
verses.ar_en: [When] they realize the sin which they committed, the community shall bring a young bullock as a sin-offering and they shall bring it to the front of the Tent of Meeting.

verses.ar_he: וְיִסְמְכוּן סָבֵי כְנִשְׁתָּא יָת יְדֵיהוֹן עַל רֵישׁ תּוֹרָא קֳדָם יְיָ וְיִכּוֹס יָת תּוֹרָא קֳדָם יְיָ
verses.ar_en: The elders of the congregation shall lay their hands on the head of the bullock, before Adonoy and he shall slaughter the bullock before Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וְיָעֵל כַּהֲנָא רַבָּא מִדְמָא דְתוֹרָא לְמַשְׁכַּן זִמְנָא
verses.ar_en: The anointed kohein [gadol] shall bring some of the bullocks blood inside the Tent of Meeting.

verses.ar_he: וְיִטְבּוֹל כַּהֲנָא אִצְבְּעֵהּ מִן דְמָא וְיַדִי שְׁבַע זִמְנִין קֳדָם יְיָ יָת קֳדָם פָּרֻכְתָּא
verses.ar_en: The kohein shall dip his finger into some of the blood and sprinkle [it] seven times before Adonoy, in front of the curtain.

verses.ar_he: וּמִן דְמָא יִתֵּן עַל קַרְנַת מַדְבְּחָא דִי קֳדָם יְיָ דִי בְּמַשְׁכַּן זִמְנָא וְיָת כָּל דְמָא יֵשׁוֹד לִיסוֹדָא דְמַדְבְּחָא דַעֲלָתָא דִי בִתְרַע מַשְׁכַּן זִמְנָא
verses.ar_en: He shall put some of the blood atop the corners of the altar which is before Adonoy, inside the Tent of Meeting. He shall spill all the [remaining] blood into the base of the altar of the burnt-offering, which is at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting.

verses.ar_he: וְיָת כָּל תַּרְבֵּהּ יַפְרֵשׁ מִנֵהּ וְיַסֵק לְמַדְבְּחָא
verses.ar_en: He shall remove all its fat from it and burn it on the altar.

verses.ar_he: וְיַעְבֵּד לְתוֹרָא כְּמָא דִי עֲבַד לְתוֹרָא דְחַטָאתָא כֵּן יַעְבֵּד לֵהּ וִיכַפֵּר עֲלֵיהוֹן כַּהֲנָא וְיִשְׁתְּבֵק לְהוֹן
verses.ar_en: He shall do to the bullock [the same] as he did to the sin-offering bullock, so he shall do to it. The kohein will atone for them and they will be pardoned.

verses.ar_he: וְיַפֵּק יָת תּוֹרָא לְמִבָּרָא לְמַשְׁרִיתָא וְאוֹקִיד יָתֵהּ כְּמָא דִי אוֹקִיד יָת תּוֹרָא קַדְמָאָה חַטַאת קְהָלָא הוּא
verses.ar_en: He shall take the bullock outside, beyond the encampment, and burn it in the same manner as he burned the first bullock; it is a communal sin-offering.

verses.ar_he: אִם רַבָּא יֵחוֹב וְיַעְבֵּד חַד מִכָּל פִּקוּדַיָא דַיְיָ אֱלָהֵיהּ דְלָא כַשְׁרִין לְאִתְעֲבָדָא בְּשָׁלוּ וְיֵחוֹב
verses.ar_en: If a leader sins, [who] transgresses one of the commandments of Adonoy, his God, that should [is] not [fitting to] be done, [if he transgressed] unwittingly and incurs guilt.

verses.ar_he: אוֹ אִתְיְדַע לֵהּ חוֹבְתֵהּ דִי חַב בַּהּ וְיַיְתִי יָת קֻרְבָּנֵהּ צְפִיר בַּר עִזִין דְכַר שְׁלִים
verses.ar_en: Or, [if his sin] becomes known to him—[that] which he committed. He shall bring as his offering an unblemished, male goat.

verses.ar_he: וְיִסְמוֹךְ יְדֵהּ עַל רֵישָׁא דִצְפִירָא וְיִכּוֹס יָתֵהּ בַּאֲתַר דְיִכּוֹס יָת עֲלָתָא לָקֳדָם יְיָ חַטָאתָא הוּא
verses.ar_en: He shall lay his hand on the goats head and slaughter it in the place where the burnt-offering is slaughtered, before Adonoy; it is a sin-offering.

verses.ar_he: וְיִסַב כַּהֲנָא מִדְמָא דְחַטָּאתָא בְּאֶצְבְּעֵהּ וְיִתֵּן עַל קַרְנַת מַדְבְּחָא דַעֲלָתָא וְיָת דְמֵהּ יֵשׁוֹד לִיסוֹדָא לְמַדְבְּחָא דַעֲלָתָא
verses.ar_en: The kohein shall take some blood of the sin-offering with his finger and put it atop the corners of the altar of the burnt-offering. He shall spill its [remaining] blood into the base of the altar of the burnt-offering.

verses.ar_he: וְיָת כָּל תַּרְבֵּה יַסֵק לְמַדְבְּחָא כִּתְרַב נִכְסַת קוּדְשַׁיָּא וִיכַפֵּר עֲלוֹהִי כַּהֲנָא מֵחוֹבְתֵהּ וְיִשְׁתְּבֵק לֵהּ
verses.ar_en: He shall burn all its fat on the altar as [he burned] the fat of the peace[sacred]-offering. The kohein will atone for him, for his transgression and he will be pardoned.

verses.ar_he: וְאִם אֱנַשׁ חַד יֵחוֹב בְּשָׁלוּ מֵעַמָא דְאַרְעָא בְּמֶעְבְּדַהּ חַד מִפִּקוּדַיָא דַיְיָ דְלָא כַשְׁרִין לְאִתְעְבָדָא וְיֵחוֹב
verses.ar_en: If a person should unwittingly sin [and he is] one of the ordinary people, by transgressing one of the commandments of Adonoy that should [is] not [fitting to] be done and he incurs guilt,

verses.ar_he: אוֹ אִתְיְדַע לֵהּ חוֹבְתֵהּ דִי חָב וְיַיְתִי קֻרְבָּנֵהּ צְפִירַת עִזִין שְׁלֶמְתָּא נְקוּבְתָא עַל חוֹבְתֵהּ דִי חָב
verses.ar_en: or, if his sin becomes known to him—which he committed. He shall bring [as] his offering an unblemished she-goat for his sin which he committed.

verses.ar_he: וְיִסְמוֹךְ יָת יְדֵהּ עַל רֵישׁ חַטָאתָא וְיִכּוֹס יָת חַטָאתָא בַּאֲתַר דַעֲלָתָא
verses.ar_en: He shall lay his hand on the head of the sin-offering and slaughter the sin-offering in the [same] place as the burnt-offering.

verses.ar_he: וְיִסַב כַּהֲנָא מִדְמַהּ בְּאֶצְבְּעֵהּ וְיִתֵּן עַל קַרְנַת מַדְבְּחָא דַעֲלָתָא וְיָת כָּל דְמַהּ יֵשׁוֹד לִיסוֹדָא דְמַדְבְּחָא
verses.ar_en: The kohein shall take from its blood with his finger and put it atop the corners of the altar of the burnt-offering. He shall spill all the [remaining] blood into the base of the altar.

verses.ar_he: וְיָת כָּל תַּרְבַּהּ יֶעְדֵי כְּמָא דִי מִתַּעְדָא תְרַב מֵעַל נִכְסַת קוּדְשַׁיָא וְיַסֵק כַּהֲנָא לְמַדְבְּחָא לְאִתְקַבָּלָא בְּרַעֲוָא קֳדָם יְיָ וִיכַפֵּר עֲלוֹהִי כַּהֲנָא וְיִשְׁתְּבֵק לֵהּ
verses.ar_en: He shall remove all its fat in the same manner as was removed the fat from the peace[sacred]-offering. The kohein shall burn it on the altar as a pleasing fragrance to [to be accepted with favor before] Adonoy. And the kohein will atone for him and he will be pardoned.

verses.ar_he: וְאִם אִימַר יַיְתִי קֻרְבָּנֵהּ לְחַטָאתָא נֻקְבָא שְׁלֶמְתָּא יַיְתִנַהּ
verses.ar_en: If he brings a sheep as his offering as a sin-offering, he shall bring an unblemished female.

verses.ar_he: וְיִסְמוֹךְ יַת יְדֵהּ עַל רֵישׁ חַטָאתָא וְיִכּוֹס יָתַהּ לְחַטָאתָא בְּאַתְרָא דִי יִכּוֹס יַת עֲלָתָא
verses.ar_en: He shall lay his hand on the head of the sin-offering and slaughter it as a sin-offering, in the [same] place where he slaughters the burnt-offering.

verses.ar_he: וְיִסַב כַּהֲנָא מִדְמָא דְחַטָאתָא בְּאֶצְבְּעֵהּ וְיִתֵּן עַל קַרְנַת מַדְבְּחָא דַעֲלָתָא וְיָת כָּל דְמַהּ יֵשׁוֹד לִיסוֹדָא דְ מַ דְבְּחָא
verses.ar_en: The kohein shall take some blood from the sin-offering with his finger and put it atop the corners of the altar of the burnt-offering. He shall spill all its [remaining] blood into the base of the altar.

verses.ar_he: וְיָת כָּל תַּרְבַּהּ יֶעְדֵי כְּמָא דִי מִתַּעְדָא תְרַב אִמְרָא מִנִכְסַת קוּדְשַׁיָא וְיַסֵק כַּהֲנָא יַתְהוֹן לְמַדְבְּחָא עַל קֻרְבָּנַיָא דַיְיָ וִיכַפֵּר עֲלוֹהִי כַהֲנָא עַל חוֹבְתֵהּ דִי חָב וְיִשְׁתְּבֵק לֵהּ
verses.ar_en: He shall remove all its fat in the same manner as was removed the fat of the lamb of the peace[sacred]-offering. The kohein shall burn them on the altar on the fires [offerings] of Adonoy. The kohein will atone for him, for his sin which he committed and he will be pardoned.

verses.ar_he: וֶאֵנַשׁ אֲרֵי יֵחוֹב וְיִשְׁמַע קַל מוֹמֵי וְהוּא סָהִיד אוֹ חֲזָא אוֹ יְדָע אִם לָא יְחַוִי וִיקַבֵּל חוֹבֵהּ
verses.ar_en: If a person sins, and heard an oath [demanding his testimony] [in a case where] he is a witness; [for] he either saw or knew [something relevant], if he does not testify, he will bear [the burden of] his iniquity.

verses.ar_he: אוֹ אֱנַשׁ דִי יִקְרַב בְּכָל מִדַעַם מְסָאָב אוֹ בְּנִבְלַת חַיְתָא מְסָאָבָא אוֹ בְּנִבְלַת בְּעִירָא מְסָאָבָא אוֹ בְּנִבְלַת רִחֲשָׁא מְסָאָב וִיהֵי מְכַסָא מִנֵהּ וְהוּא מְסָאָב וְחָב
verses.ar_en: Or, if a person touches anything impure either the carcass of an impure wild animal, or the carcass of an impure animal of pasture, or the carcass of an impure creeping animal; and this [impurity] was concealed from him, he is impure and incurs guilt.

verses.ar_he: אוֹ אֲרֵי יִקְרַב בְּסוֹאֲבַת אֱנָשָׁא לְכָל סוֹבְתֵהּ דִי יִסְתָּאַב בַּהּ וִיהֵי מְכַסָא מִנֵהּ וְהוּא יְדַע וְחָב
verses.ar_en: Or, if he touches the impurities of man whatever that impurity may be that causes impurity and this [impurity] was concealed from him; [when] he realizes [he is impure], he incurs guilt.

verses.ar_he: אוֹ אֱנַשׁ אֲרֵי יְקַיֵם לְפָרָשָׁא בְסִפְוָן לְאַבְאָשָׁא אוֹ לְאוֹטָבָא לְכֹל דִי יְפָרֵשׁ אֱנָשָׁא בְּקִיוּם וִיהֵי מְכַסָא מִנֵהּ וְהוּא יָדַע וְחָב לַחֲדָא מֵאִלֵין
verses.ar_en: Or, if a person swears, orally expressing to do harm [that he will do something which is to his detriment] or to do good [that he will do something that is to his benefit]. Regarding all a person will expresses in an oath and [that oath] was concealed from himself, when he realizes [his sin] and he incurs guilt, for any one of these [aforementioned sins].

verses.ar_he: וִיהֵי אֲרֵי יֵחוֹב לַחֲדָא מֵאִלֵין וִיוַדִי דִי חָב עֲלַהּ
verses.ar_en: It shall be that when he incurs guilt for any of these [aforementioned sins] he shall confess that which he transgressed.

verses.ar_he: וְיַיְתִי יָת אַשְׁמֵהּ קֳדָם יְיָ עַל חוֹבְתֵהּ דִי חָב נְקוּבְתָא מִן עָנָא אִמְרָתָא אוֹ צְפִירַת עִזִין לְחַטָאתָא וִיכַפֵּר עֲלוֹהִי כַהֲנָא מֵחוֹבְתֵהּ
verses.ar_en: He shall bring his guilt-offering to [before] Adonoy for his sin that he committed a female of the sheep, a lamb or a she-goat as a sin-offering. The kohein will atone for him, for his sin.

verses.ar_he: וְאִם לָא תִמְטֵי יְדֵהּ כְּמִסַת שֵׂיתָא וְיַיְתִי יָת חוֹבְתֵהּ דִי חָב תַּרְתֵּין שַׁפְנִינִין אוֹ תְרֵין בְּנֵי יוֹנָה קֳדָם יְיָ חַד לְחַטָאתָא וְחַד לַעֲלָתָא
verses.ar_en: If his means are not sufficient for [the acquisition of] a sheep, then he shall bring for his guilt-offering,—[he] who has sinned,—two turtledoves or two young pigeons to [before] Adonoy one for a sin-offering and one for a burnt-offering.

verses.ar_he: וְיַיְתִי יָתְהוֹן לְוָת כַּהֲנָא וִיקָרֵב יָת דִי לְחַטָאתָא קַדְמֵיתָא וְיִמְלוֹק יָת רֵישֵׁהּ מִלְקָבֵל קְדָלֵהּ וְלָא יַפְרֵשׁ
verses.ar_en: He shall bring them to the kohein and he shall bring that which is for a sin-offering first. He [the kohein] shall shear its head [with his fingernail] opposite of its neck, but not separate [the head] completely.

verses.ar_he: וְיַדִי מִדְמָא דְחַטָּאתָא עַל כֹּתֶל מַדְבְּחָא וּדְאִשְׁתָּאַר בִּדְמָא יִתִּמְצֵי לִיסוֹדָא דְמַדְבְּחָא חַטָאתָא הוּא
verses.ar_en: He shall sprinkle some blood of the sin-offering on to the wall of the altar. And the remaining blood shall be squeezed into the base of the altar; it is a sin-offering.

verses.ar_he: וְיָת תִּנְיָנָא יַעְבֵּד עֲלָתָא כִּדְחָזֵי וִיכַפֵּר עֲלוֹהִי כַהֲנָא מֵחוֹבְתֵהּ דִי חָב וְיִשְׁתְּבֵק לֵהּ
verses.ar_en: He shall do (offer) the second [turtledove pigeon] as a burnt-offering, as prescribed. The kohein will atone from him, for his sin that he committed and he will be pardoned.

verses.ar_he: וְאִם לָא תַדְבֵּק יְדֵהּ לְתַרְתֵּין שַׁפְנִינִין אוֹ לִתְרֵין בְּנֵי יוֹנָה וְיַיְתִי יָת קֻרְבָּנֵהּ דִי חָב חַד מִן עַסְרָא בִתְלַת סְאִין סֻלְתָּא לְחַטָּאתָא לָא יְשַׁוִי עֲלַהּ מִשְׁחָא וְלָא יִתֵּן עֲלַהּ לְבֻנְתָּא אֲרֵי חַטָאתָא הִיא
verses.ar_en: If his means are not sufficient for the acquisition of two turtledoves or two young pigeons, he shall bring as his offering,—[he] who has sinned,—one tenth of an epha [which is three se’in] of fine flour as a sin-offering. He shall not put oil upon it, nor shall he place frankincense upon it, for it is a sin-offering.

verses.ar_he: וְיַיְתִנַהּ לְוַת כַּהֲנָא וְיִקְמוֹץ כַּהֲנָא מִנַהּ מְלֵי קֻמְצֵהּ יָת אִדְכַּרְתַּהּ וְיַסֵק לְמַדְבְּחָא עַל קֻרְבָּנַיָא דַיְיָ חַטָאתָא הִיא
verses.ar_en: He shall bring it to the kohein and the kohein shall take a fistful from it [as] its memorial portion and burn it on the altar on the fires [offerings] of Adonoy; it is a sin-offering.

verses.ar_he: וִיכַפֵּר עֲלוֹהִי כַהֲנָא עַל חוֹבְתֵהּ דִי חָב מֵחֲדָא מֵאִלֵין וְיִשְׁתְּבֵק לֵהּ וּתְהֵי לְכַהֲנָא כְּמִנְחָתָא
verses.ar_en: The kohein will atone for him, for his sin that he committed in one of these [three] ways and he will be pardoned. [The remaining portion] shall belong to the kohein as a meal-offering.

verses.ar_he: וּמַלִיל יְיָ עִם מֹשֶׁה לְמֵימָר
verses.ar_en: And Adonoy spoke to Moshe, saying;

verses.ar_he: אֱנַשׁ אֲרֵי יְשַׁקַר שְׁקַר וְיֵחוֹב בְּשָׁלוּ מִקוּדְשַׁיָא דַיְיָ וְיַיְתִי יָת אַשְׁמֵהּ קֳדָם יְיָ דְכַר שְׁלִים מִן עָנָא בְּפֻרְסָנֵהּ כְּסַף סִלְעִין בְּסִלְעֵי קוּדְשָׁא לַאֲשָׁמָא
verses.ar_en: If a person wrongfully deviates [lies] and unwittingly sins [by using the] sacred property of Adonoy, he shall bring his guilt-offering to [before] Adonoy, an unblemished ram, from the sheep, based on the valuation of holy silver shekalim [selaim], for a guilt-offering.

verses.ar_he: וְיָת דִי חָב מִן קוּדְשָׁא יְשַׁלֵם וְיָת חֻמְשֵׁהּ יוֹסֵף עֲלוֹהִי וְיִתֵּן יָתֵהּ לְכַהֲנָא וְכַהֲנָא יְכַפֵּר עֲלוֹהִי בְּדִכְרָא דַאֲשָׁמָא וְיִשְׁתְּבֵק לֵהּ
verses.ar_en: That which he sinned [making use] of the sacred property, he shall pay for and add an additional fifth to that [amount] and give it to the kohein. The kohein will atone for him with the guilt-offering ram and he will be pardoned.

verses.ar_he: וְאִם אֱנַשׁ אֲרֵי יֵחוֹב וְיַעְבֵּד חֲדָא מִכָּל פִּקוּדַיָא דַיְיָ דִי לָא כָשְׁרִין לְאִתְעֲבָדָא וְלָא יָדַע וְיֵחוֹב וִיקַבֵּל חוֹבֵהּ
verses.ar_en: If a person sins and did [transgress] one of the commandments of Adonoy that should [is] not [fitting to] be done, [however,] he is uncertain [that he sinned], and he [nevertheless] incurs guilt and will bear [the burden of] his iniquity.

verses.ar_he: וְיַיְתִי דְכַר שְׁלִים מִן עָנָא בְּפֻרְסָנֵהּ לַאֲשָׁמָא לְוָת כַּהֲנָא וִיכַפֵּר עֲלוֹהִי כַהֲנָא עַל שָׁלוּתֵהּ דְאִשְׁתְּלִי וְהוּא לָא יָדַע וְיִשְׁתְּבֵק לֵהּ
verses.ar_en: He shall bring an unblemished ram, from the sheep, based on the valuation as a guilt-offering, to the kohein. The kohein will atone for him, for the error which he did unintentionally, and he did not know, and he will be pardoned.

verses.ar_he: אֲשָׁמָא הוּא עַל חוֹבְתֵהּ דְהוּא חָב אֲשָׁמָא יְקָרֵב קֳדָם יְיָ
verses.ar_en: It is a guilt-offering [for] he certainly incurred guilt [for his sin which he committed he shall bring a guilt-offering] before Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וּמַלִיל יְיָ עִם מֹשֶׁה לְמֵימָר
verses.ar_en: And Adonoy spoke to Moshe, saying;

verses.ar_he: אֱנַשׁ אֲרֵי יֵחוֹב וִישַׁקַר שְׁקַר קֳדָם יְיָ וִיכַדֵב בְּחַבְרֵהּ בְּפִקְדוֹנָא אוֹ בְשֻׁתָּפוּת יְדָא אוֹ בִגְזֵלָא אוֹ אַנִיס יָת חַבְרֵהּ
verses.ar_en: If a person sins and wrongfully deviates [lies] from [before] Adonoy and denies to his friend the possession of a keepsake placed in his trust or, a deposit [regarding money that was loaned or in partnership,] or theft [claiming that something was stolen,] or, oppressed [he withheld wages from] his friend.

verses.ar_he: אוֹ אַשְׁכַּח אֲבֶדְתָּא וִיכַדֵב בַּהּ וְאִשְׁתְּבַע עַל שִׁקְרָא עַל חֲדָא מִכֹּל דִי יַעְבֵּד אֱנָשָׁא לְמֵיחַב בְּהֵן
verses.ar_en: Or, if he found a lost item and denies it and swears falsely in any of all these [aforementioned instances], whatever someone will do to sin in these instances.

verses.ar_he: וִיהֵי אֲרֵי יֶחְטֵי וְיֵחוֹב וְיָתֵב יָת גְזֵלָא דִי גְזַל אוֹ יָת עֻשְׁקָא דִי עֲשַׁק אוֹ יָת פִּקְדוֹנָא דִי אִתְפָּקַד לְוָתֵהּ אוֹ יָת אֲבֶדְתָּא דִי אַשְׁכַּח
verses.ar_en: It shall be that when he [realizes his] sin and incurs guilt, he shall return the stolen property that he stole, or, the wages that he withheld or, whatever keepsake that was placed in his trust or, the lost item which he found.

verses.ar_he: אוֹ מִכֹּל דִי יִשְׁתְּבַע עֲלוֹהִי לְשִׁקְרָא וִישַׁלֵם יָתֵהּ בְּרֵישֵׁיהּ וְחֻמְשֵׁהּ יוֹסֵף עֲלוֹהִי לְדִי הוּא דִילֵהּ יִתְּנִנֵהּ בְּיוֹמָא דְחוֹבְתֵהּ
verses.ar_en: Or, anything about which he will swear falsely. He shall pay its price and add an additional fifth to that [amount] to whomever that object belongs he shall give it on the day of his guilt-offering.

verses.ar_he: וְיָת אַשָׁמֵיהּ יַיְתִי לָקֳדָם יְיָ דְכַר שְׁלִים מִן עָנָא בְּפֻרְסָנֵהּ לַאֲשָׁמָא לְוָת כַּהֲנָא
verses.ar_en: He shall bring his guilt-offering to [before] Adonoy an unblemished ram, from the sheep based on the valuation, as a guilt-offering to the kohein.

verses.ar_he: וִיכַפֵּר עֲלוֹהִי כַהֲנָא קֳדָם יְיָ וְיִשְׁתְּבֵק לֵהּ עַל חֲדָא מִכֹּל דִי יַעְבֵּד לְמֵיחַב בַהּ
verses.ar_en: The kohein will atone for him before Adonoy and he will be pardoned for anything that he will do through which guilt incurs.

verses.ar_he: וּמַלִיל יְיָ עִם מֹשֶׁה לְמֵימָר
verses.ar_en: And Adonoy spoke to Moshe, saying:

verses.ar_he: פַּקֵד יָת אַהֲרֹן וְיָת בְּנוֹהִי לְמֵימָר דָא אוֹרַיְתָא דַעֲלָתָא הִיא עֲלָתָא דְמִתּוֹקְדָא עַל מַדְבְּחָא כָל לֵילְיָא עַד צַפְרָא וְאֶשָׁתָא דְמַדְבְּחָא תְּהֵא יָקְדָא בֵהּ
verses.ar_en: Command Aharon and his sons, saying; this is the law of the burnt-offering. It is the burnt-offering [which remains] on its pyre on the altar all night, until the morning, and the fire of the altar will be kept burning on it.

verses.ar_he: וְיַלְבֵּשׁ כַּהֲנָא לְבוּשִׁין דְבוּץ וּמִכְנְסִין דְבוּץ יַלְבֵּשׁ עַל בִּסְרֵהּ וְיַפְרֵשׁ יָת קִטְמָא דִי תֵיכוּל אֶשָׁתָא יָת עֲלָתָא עַל מַדְבְּחָא וִישַׁוִנֵהּ בִּסְטַּר מַדְבְּחָא
verses.ar_en: The kohein shall dress in his linen garment and he shall wear linen pants on his [body] skin; and he shall separate the ashes when the fire consumes the burnt-offering on the altar and place it next to the altar.

verses.ar_he: וְיַשְׁלַח יָת לְבוּשׁוֹהִי וְיִלְבַּשׁ לְבוּשִׁין אָחֳרָנִין וְיַפֵּק יָת קִטְמָא לְמִבָּרָא לְמַשְׁרִיתָא לַאֲתַר דְכֵי
verses.ar_en: He shall [then] remove his garments and dress in other garments. He shall take out the ashes beyond the encampment, to a pure [undefiled] place.

verses.ar_he: וְאֶשָׁתָא עַל מַדְבְּחָא תְהֵי יָקְדָא בֵהּ לָא תִטְּפֵי וְיַבְעַר עֲלַהּ כַּהֲנָא אָעַיָא בִּצְפַר בִּצְפָר וְיַסְדַר עֲלַהּ עֲלָתָא וְיַסֵק עֲלַהּ תַּרְבֵּי נִכְסַת קוּדְשַׁיָא
verses.ar_en: The fire on the altar shall be kindled with it it shall not go out. The kohein shall burn logs upon it each and every morning and arrange the burnt-offering on it and burn upon it the fats of the peace[sacred]-offering.

verses.ar_he: אֶשָׁתָא תְּדִירָא תְּהֵי יָקְדָא עַל מַדְבְּחָא לָא תִטְפֵי
verses.ar_en: A continual fire shall be lit on the altar; it shall not go out.

verses.ar_he: וְדָא אוֹרַיְתָא דְמִנְחָתָא דִיקָרְבוּן יָתַהּ בְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן קֳדָם יְיָ לָקֳדָם מַדְבְּחָא
verses.ar_en: This is the law of the meal-offering. The sons of Aharon bring it before Adonoy, to the front of the altar.

verses.ar_he: וְיַפְרֵשׁ מִנֵהּ בְּקֻמְצֵהּ מִסֻלְתָּא דְמִנְחָתָא וּמִמִשְׁחַהּ וְיָת כָּל לְבוּנְתָּא דִי עַל מִנְחָתָא וְיַסֵק לְמַדְבְּחָא לְאִתְקַבָּלָא בְרַעֲוָא אַדְכַּרְתָּא קֳדָם יְיָ
verses.ar_en: He shall separate from it, when he takes his fistful, from some of the meal-offerings fine flour and some of its oil and all the frankincense which is on the meal-offering. He shall burn, on the altar a pleasing fragrance [to be accepted with favor]; its memorial portion, to [before] Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וּדְאִשְׁתָּאַר מִנַהּ יֵכְלוּן אַהֲרֹן וּבְנוֹהִי פַּטִיר תִּתְאַכֵל בַּאֲתַר קַדִּישׁ בְּדָרַת מַשְׁכַּן זִמְנָא יֵכְלֻנַהּ
verses.ar_en: Whatever remains from it shall be eaten by Aharon and his sons. It must be eaten as matzoh, in a sacred place. In the courtyard of the Tent of Meeting they shall eat it.

verses.ar_he: לָא תִתְאֲפֵי חֲמִיעַ חָלָקְהוֹן יְהָבִית יָתַהּ מִקֻרְבָּנָי קֹדֶשׁ קוּדְשִׁין הִיא כְּחַטָאתָא וְכַאֲשָׁמָא
verses.ar_en: It should not be baked [as] leavened. I have given it to them as their portion from my fire-offerings [offerings]. It is holy of holies [most holy], as [are] the sin-offering and as the guilt-offering.

verses.ar_he: כָּל דְכוּרָא בִּבְנֵי אַהֲרֹן יֵכְלֻנַהּ קְיָם עָלָם לְדָרָתֵיכוֹן מִקֻרָבָּנַיָא דַיְיָ כֹּל דְיִקְרַב בְּהוֹן יִתְקַדָּשׁ
verses.ar_en: Every male descendant of Aharon may eat it, an everlasting statute for all your descendants from the fire-offerings [offerings] of Adonoy. whatever shall touch them will become sacred.

verses.ar_he: וּמַלִיל יְיָ עִם מֹשֶׁה לְמֵימָר
verses.ar_en: And Adonoy spoke to Moshe, saying:

verses.ar_he: דֵין קֻרְבַּן אַהֲרֹן וּבְנוֹהִי דִי יְקָרְבוּן קֳדָם יְיָ בְּיוֹמָא דְרַבִּיאוּ יָתֵהּ חַד מִן עַסְרָא בִתְלַת סְאִין סֻלְתָּא מִנְחָתָא תְּדִירָא פַּלְגוּתַהּ בְּצַפְרָא וּפַלְגוּתַהּ בְּרַמְשָׁא
verses.ar_en: This is the offering of Aharon and his sons that they shall offer to [before] Adonoy on the day that he is anointed [inaugurated to greatness]; one tenth of an ephah [which is three se’in] of fine flour as a meal-offering, always [daily]. Half of it [he shall offer] in the morning and half of it [he shall offer] in the evening.

verses.ar_he: עַל מַסְרֵיתָא בִּמְשַׁח תִּתְעֲבֵד רְבִיכָא תַיְתִנַהּ תּוּפִינֵי מִנְחַת בִּצוּעִין תְּקָרֵב לְאִתְקַבָּלָא בְרַעֲוָא קֳדָם יְיָ
verses.ar_en: In a frying pan, with oil it shall be made; you shall bring it saturated, well-baked, a meal-offering of broken pieces, you shall bring a pleasing fragrance to [it to be accepted with favor before] Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וְכַהֲנָא דִמְרַבָּא תְחוֹתוֹהִי מִבְּנוֹהִי יַעְבֵּד יָתַהּ קְיָם עָלָם קֳדָם יְיָ גְמִיר תִּתַּסָק
verses.ar_en: The kohein who is anointed [inaugurated to greatness] in his stead from among his sons, he shall [also] do it; an everlasting statute to [before] Adonoy, it shall be entirely burnt.

verses.ar_he: וְכָל מִנְחָתָא דְכַהֲנָא גְמִיר תְּהֵי לָא תִתְאֲכֵל
verses.ar_en: Every meal-offering of a kohein shall be completely burnt and may not be eaten.

verses.ar_he: וּמַלִיל יְיָ עִם מֹשֶׁה לְמֵימָר
verses.ar_en: And Adonoy spoke to Moshe, saying:

verses.ar_he: מַלֵל עִם אַהֲרֹן וְעִם בְּנוֹהִי לְמֵימָר דָא אוֹרַיְתָא דְחַטָאתָא בַּאֲתַר דִי תִתְנְכֵס עֲלָתָא תִּתְנְכֵס חַטָאתָא קֳדָם יְיָ קֹדֶשׁ קוּדְשִׁין הִיא
verses.ar_en: Speak to Aharon and his sons, saying: this is the law of the sin-offering. In the place where the burnt-offering is slaughtered, the sin-offering shall be slaughtered, before Adonoy; it is holy of holies [most holy].

verses.ar_he: כַּהֲנָא דִמְכַפֵּר בִּדְמַהּ יֵיכְלִנַהּ בַּאֲתַר קַדִישׁ תִּתְאֲכֵל בְּדָרַת מַשְׁכַּן זִמְנָא
verses.ar_en: The kohein who offers it as a sin-offering [atones with its blood], shall eat it. It shall be eaten in a sacred place, in the Courtyard of the Tent of Meeting.

verses.ar_he: כֹּל דִי יִקְרַב בְּבִסְרַהּ יִתְקַדַשׁ וְדִי יַדִי מִדְמַהּ עַל לְבוּשׁ דִי יַדִי עֲלַהּ תִּתְחַוָר בַּאֲתַר קַדִישׁ
verses.ar_en: Whatever shall touch its flesh shall become holy and when of its blood is sprinkled on the garment, whatever it is sprinkled upon, you shall wash in a sacred place.

verses.ar_he: וּמָן דַחֲסַף דִי תִתְבַּשֵׁל בֵּהּ יִתָּבָר וְאִם בְּמָנָא דִנְחָשָׁא תִּתְבַּשֵׁל וְיִתְמְרֵק וְיִשְׁתַּטֵף בְּמַיָא
verses.ar_en: An earthenware vessel in which it was cooked, must be broken. If it was cooked in a copper vessel, it must be scoured and rinsed with water.

verses.ar_he: כָּל דְכוּרָא בְּכַהֲנַיָא יֵכוּל יָתַהּ קֹדֶשׁ קוּדְשִׁין הִיא
verses.ar_en: Every male among the kohanim may eat it; it is holy of holies [=most holy].

verses.ar_he: וְכָל חַטָאתָא דִי יִתָּעַלּ מִדְמַהּ לְמַשְׁכַּן זִמְנָא לְכַפָּרָא בְקוּדְשָׁא לָא תִתְאֲכֵל בְּנוּרָא תִּתּוֹקָד
verses.ar_en: Every sin-offering whose blood is to be brought inside the Tent of Meeting to bring about atonement inside the Sanctuary may not be eaten; it must be burned in fire.

verses.ar_he: וְדָא אוֹרַיְתָא דַאֲשָׁמָא קֹדֶשׁ קוּדְשִׁין הוּא
verses.ar_en: This is the law of the guilt-offering; it is holy of holies [=most holy].

verses.ar_he: בְּאַתְרָא דִי יִכְּסוּן יָת עֲלָתָא יִכְּסוּן יָת אֲשָׁמָא וְיָת דְמֵהּ יִזְרַק עַל מַדְבְּחָא סְחוֹר סְחוֹר
verses.ar_en: In the place where they will slaughter the burnt-offering they shall slaughter the guilt-offering, and they shall sprinkle its blood all around the altar.

verses.ar_he: וְיָת כָּל תַּרְבֵּהּ יַפְרֵשׁ מִנֵהּ יָת אֲלִיתָא וְיָת תַּרְבָּא דְחָפֵי יָת גַוָא
verses.ar_en: He shall bring [separate] all its fat from it; the [fat] tail, the fat covering the innards,

verses.ar_he: וְיָת תַּרְתֵּין כָּלְיָן וְיָת תַּרְבָּא דִי עֲלֵיהֶן דִי עַל גִסְסַיָא וְיָת חִצְרָא דְעַל כַּבְדָא עַל כָּלְיֵתָא יֶעְדִנַהּ
verses.ar_en: the two kidneys and the fat on them that are on the flanks. The lobe on the liver, he shall remove together with the kidneys.

verses.ar_he: וְיַסֵיק יָתְהוֹן כַּהֲנָא לְמַדְבְּחָא קוּרְבָּנָא קֳדָם יְיָ אֲשָׁמָא הוּא
verses.ar_en: The kohein shall burn them on the altar, a fire-offering to [an offering before] Adonoy; it is a guilt-offering.

verses.ar_he: כָּל דְכוּרָא בְּכַהֲנַיָא יֵיכְלִנֵהּ בַּאֲתַר קַדִישׁ יִתְאֲכָל קוֹדֶשׁ קוּדְשִׁין הוּא
verses.ar_en: All males among the kohanim may eat it. It must be eaten in a sacred place; it is most holy.

verses.ar_he: כְּחַטָאתָא כַּאֲשָׁמָא אוֹרַיְתָא חֲדָא לְהוֹן כַּהֲנָא דִי יְכַפֵּר בֵּהּ דִילֵהּ יְהֵי
verses.ar_en: As the sin-offering is, so is the guilt-offering; one law applies to them both; the kohein who will bring about atonement with it, it shall belong to him.

verses.ar_he: וְכַהֲנָא דִמְקָרֵב יַת עֲלַת גְבַר מְשַׁךְ עֲלָתָא דִי יְקָרֵב לְכַהֲנָא דִילֵהּ יְהֵי
verses.ar_en: The kohein who brings a burnt-offering of an individual, the skin of the burnt-offering that he brought, shall belong to the kohein, it shall belong to him.

verses.ar_he: וְכָל מִנְחָתָא דִי תִתְאֲפֵי בְּתַנוּרָא וְכָל דְתִתְעֲבֵד בְּרִדְתָּא וְעַל מַסְרֵיתָא לְכַהֲנָא דִמְקָרֵב יָתַהּ דִילֵהּ תְּהֵי
verses.ar_en: Every meal-offering that shall be baked in an oven and every one made in a deep pot [which appears as if it has been ploughed out] or frying pan, [belong] to the kohein who offers it; it shall belong to him.

verses.ar_he: וְכָל מִנְחָתָא דְפִילָא בִמְשַׁח וּדְלָא פִילָא לְכָל בְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן תְּהֵי גְבַר כַּאָחוֹהִי
verses.ar_en: Every meal-offering mixed with oil or dry [not mixed], shall belong to all the sons of Aharon, each equally.

verses.ar_he: וְדָא אוֹרַיְתָא דְנִכְסַת קוּדְשַׁיָא דִי יְקָרֵב קֳדָם יְיָ
verses.ar_en: This is the law of the peace[sacred]-offering that one will bring to [before] Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: אִם עַל תּוֹדְתָא יְקָרְבִנֵהּ וִיקָרֵב עַל נִכְסַת תּוֹדְתָא גְרִיצָן פַּטִירָן דְפִילָן בִּמְשַׁח וְאֶסְפּוֹגִין פַּטִירִין דִּמְשִׁיחִין בִּמְשָׁח וְסוּלְתָּא רְבִיכָא גְרִיצָן דְפִילָן בִּמְשָׁח
verses.ar_en: If he brings it as thanksgiving offering he shall bring along with his thanksgiving offering matzoh [unleavened] loaves mixed with oil, matzoh [unleavened] wafers anointed with oil and loaves of saturated fine flour mixed with oil.

verses.ar_he: עַל גְּרִיצָן דִלְחֵם חָמִיעַ יְקָרֵב קוּרְבָּנֵיהּ עַל נִכְסַת תּוֹדַת קוּדְשׁוֹהִי
verses.ar_en: With loaves of leavened bread he shall bring his offering, along with his peace[sacred]-offering of thanksgiving.

verses.ar_he: וִיקָרֵב מִנֵהּ חַד מִכָּל קוּרְבַּן אַפְרָשׁוּתָא קֳדָם יְיָ לְכַהֲנָא דְיִזְרַק יָת דַם נִכְסַת קוּדְשַׁיָא דִילֵהּ יְהֵי
verses.ar_en: From it, he shall bring one from each offering as separated portion to [before] Adonoy. To that kohein who sprinkles the blood of the peace[sacred]-offering, it shall belong to him.

verses.ar_he: וּבְשַׂר נִכְסַת תּוֹדַת קוּדְשׁוֹהִי בְּיוֹם קֻרְבָּנֵהּ יִתְאֲכֵל לָא יַצְנַע מִנֵהּ עַד צַפְרָא
verses.ar_en: The flesh of his thanksgiving peace[sacred]-offering on the day of its sacrifice it may be eaten. He shall not leave over any of it until morning.

verses.ar_he: וְאִם נִדְרָא אוֹ נְדַבְתָּא נִכְסַת קֻרְבָּנֵהּ בְּיוֹמָא דִי יְקָרֵב יָת נִכְסְתֵיהּ יִתְאֲכֵל וּבְיוֹמָא דְבַתְרוֹהִי וּדְאִשְׁתָּאַר מִנֵהּ יִתְאֲכֵלּ
verses.ar_en: If either a vow or a voluntary offering, are the sacrifices of his offerings, it shall be eaten on the day of his offering. And on the next day, the remnant of it may [also] be eaten.

verses.ar_he: וּדְאִשְׁתָּאַר מִבְּסַר נִכְסָתָא בְּיוֹמָא תְּלִיתָאָה בְּנוּרָא יִתּוֹקָד
verses.ar_en: Whatever flesh is left over from the offering shall be burned in fire, on the third day.

verses.ar_he: וְאִם אִתְאֲכָלָא יִתְאֲכֵל מִבְּסַר נִכְסַת קוּדְשׁוֹהִי בְּיוֹמָא תְּלִיתָאָה לָא יְהֵי לְרַעֲוָא דִמְקָרֵב יָתֵהּ לָא יִתְחַשֵׁב לֵהּ מְרָחָק יְהֵי וֶאֱנַשׁ דְתֵכוּל מִנֵהּ חוֹבֵהּ יְקַבֵּל
verses.ar_en: If it will be eaten, of the flesh of the peace[sacred]-offering on the third day, it will not be favorably accepted. [As to] whoever brings it, it will not be credited to him; it is an abomination [rejected] and anyone who eats of it shall bear [the burden of] its iniquity.

verses.ar_he: וּבְסַר קוּדְשָׁא דִי יִקְרַב בְּכָל מְסָאָב לָא יִתְאֲכֵל בְּנוּרָא יִתּוֹקָד וּבְסַר קוּדְשָׁא כָּל דִי דְכֵי לְקוּדְשָׁא יֵיכוּל בְּסַר קוּדְשָׁא
verses.ar_en: The flesh [of [the sacred] offerings] that will touch any unclean [thing] may not be eaten; it shall be burned in fire. [As to] the [pure] [sacred] flesh, every [ritually] pure person [fitting for the sacred] may eat [the] [sacred] meat.

verses.ar_he: וֶאֱנַשׁ דִי תֵכוּל בִּסְרָא מִנִכְסַת קוּדְשַׁיָא דִי קֳדָם יְיָ וְסוֹבְתֵהּ עֲלוֹהִי וְיִשְׁתֵּיצֵי אֱנָשָׁא הַהוּא מֵעַמֵּיהּ
verses.ar_en: The person who eats of the flesh of the peace[sacred]-offering belonging to [which is before] Adonoy while his uncleaness is yet on him, that persons soul shall be cut off from its people.

verses.ar_he: וֶאֱנַשׁ אֲרֵי תִקְרַב בְּכָל מְסָאָב בְסוֹאֲבַת אֱנָשָׁא אוֹ בִּבְעִירָא מְסָאֲבָא אוֹ בְּכָל שִׁקְצָא מְסָאָב וְיֵיכוּל מִבְּסַר נִכְסַת קוּדְשַׁיָא דִי קֳדָם יְיָ וְיִשְׁתֵּיצֵי אֱנָשָׁא הַהוּא מֵעַמֵּיהּ
verses.ar_en: A person who touches anything unclean, be it the impurities of man or an unclean animal, or any unclean creeping creature and then eats some flesh of the peace[sacred]-offering belonging to [which is before] Adonoy, that persons soul shall be cut off from its people.

verses.ar_he: וּמַלֵיל יְיָ עִם מֹשֶׁה לְמֵימָר
verses.ar_en: And Adonoy spoke to Moshe, saying:

verses.ar_he: מַלֵל עִם בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל לְמֵימָר כָּל תְּרַב תּוֹר וְאִמַר וְעִזָא לָא תֵיכְלוּן
verses.ar_en: Speak to Bnei Yisroel, saying: any fat of oxen, sheep or goats you must not eat.

verses.ar_he: וּתְרַב נְבִילָא וּתְרַב תְּבִירָא יִתְעֲבֵד לְכָל עִבִדְתָּא וּמֵיכַל לָא תֵיכְלוּנֵהּ
verses.ar_en: The fat of an improperly slaughtered animal and the fat of a fatally wounded animal may be used for any purpose, but you are surely not permitted to eat it.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי כָל דְיֵכוּל תַּרְבָּא מִן בְּעִירָא דִי יִקָרְבוּן מִנַהּ קוּרְבָּנָא קֳדָם יְיָ וְיִשְׁתֵּיצֵי אֱנָשָׁא דִי תֵיכוּל מֵעַמֵּיהּ
verses.ar_en: For, anyone who eats fat of an animal from which is offered a fire-offering to [as offering before] Adonoy, the soul [person] who ate it shall be cut off from its people.

verses.ar_he: וְכָל דְמָא לָא תֵיכְלוּן בְּכֹל מוֹתְבָנֵיכוֹן דְעוֹפָא וְדִבְעִירָא
verses.ar_en: You shall not eat any blood, in all your dwelling places, be it of fowl or of beast.

verses.ar_he: כָּל אֱנָשָׁא דִי תֵיכוּל כָּל דְמָא וְיִשְׁתֵּיצֵי אֱנָשָׁא הַהוּא מֵעַמֵּיהּ
verses.ar_en: Any person who eats any blood, that soul [person] shall be cut off from its people.

verses.ar_he: וּמַלִיל יְיָ עִם מֹשֶׁה לְמֵימָר
verses.ar_en: And Adonoy spoke to Moshe, saying:

verses.ar_he: מַלֵל עִם בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל לְמֵימָר דִמְקָרֵב יָת נִכְסַת קוּדְשׁוֹהִי קֳדָם יְיָ יַיְתִי יָת קֻרְבָּנֵהּ לָקֳדָם יְיָ מִנִכְסַת קוּדְשׁוֹהִי
verses.ar_en: Speak to Bnei Yisroel, saying: Whoever shall bring the sacrifice of his peace[sacred]-offering to [before] Adonoy, he shall bring his offering to [before] Adonoy from his peace[sacred]-offering.

verses.ar_he: יְדוֹהִי תַיְתוּן יָת קֻרְבָּנַיָא דַיְיָ יָת תַּרְבָּא עַל חַדְיָא יַיְתִנֵהּ יָת חֶדְיָא לַאֲרָמָא יָתֵהּ אֲרוּמָא קֳדָם יְיָ
verses.ar_en: His hands shall bring the fire-offerings [offerings] of Adonoy; he shall bring the fat on the breast and the breast [itself] to wave [lift] them [up] as a wave-offering [an uplifted-offering] before Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וְיַסֵק כַּהֲנָא יָת תַּרְבָּא לְמַדְבְּחָא וִיהֵי חֶדְיָא לְאַהֲרֹן וְלִבְנוֹהִי
verses.ar_en: The kohein shall burn the fat on the altar and the breast shall belong to Aharon and to his sons.

verses.ar_he: וְיָת שׁוֹקָא דְיַמִינָא תִּתְּנוּן אַפְרָשׁוּתָא לְכַהֲנָא מִנִכְסַת קוּדְשֵׁיכוֹן
verses.ar_en: The right thigh you shall give as a separated portion to the kohein, from your peace[sacred]-offerings.

verses.ar_he: דִמְקָרֵב יָת דָם נִכְסַת קוּדְשַׁיָא וְיָת תַּרְבָּא מִבְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן דִילֵהּ תְּהֵי שׁוֹקָא דְיַמִינָא לָחֳלָק
verses.ar_en: Whoever offers the blood of the peace[sacred]-offering and the fat who is of the sons of Aharon, the right thigh shall belong to him as a portion.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי יָת חֶדְיָא דַאֲרָמוּתָא וְיָת שׁוֹקָא דְאַפְרָשׁוּתָא נְסֵבִית מִן בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל מִנִכְסַת קוּדְשֵׁיהוֹן וִיהָבִית יָתְהוֹן לְאַהֲרֹן כַּהֲנָא וְלִבְנוֹהִי לִקְיָם עָלָם מִן בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל
verses.ar_en: Because the breast wave[uplifted]-offering and the thigh [that is] the uplifted [separated] portion I have taken from Bnei Yisroel. from their peace[sacred]-offerings and I have given them to Aharon the kohein and to his sons, as an everlasting statute, from Bnei Yisroel.

verses.ar_he: דָא רְבוּת אַהֲרֹן וּרְבוּת בְּנוֹהִי מִקוּרְבָּנַיָא דַיְיָ בְּיוֹמָא דְקָרֵב יָתְהוֹן לְשַׁמָשָׁא קֳדָם יְיָ
verses.ar_en: This is [for] the anointing [inauguration to greatness] of Aharon and [for] the anointing [inauguration to greatness] of his sons from the fire-offering [offerings] of Adonoy, on the day He brought them to serve before Adonoy,

verses.ar_he: דִי פַקִיד יְיָ לְמִתַּן לְהוֹן בְּיוֹמָא דְרַבִּי יָתְהוֹן מִן בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל קְיָם עָלָם לְדָרֵיהוֹן
verses.ar_en: that Adonoy commanded to give to them, on the day He anointed [inaugurated] them [to greatness], from Bnei Yisroel, an everlasting statute for all their descendants.

verses.ar_he: דָא אוֹרַיְתָא לַעֲלָתָא לְמִנְחָתָא וּלְחַטָּאתָא וְלַאֲשָׁמָא וּלְקוּרְבָּנַיָא וּלְנִכְסַת קוּדְשַׁיָא
verses.ar_en: This is the law for the burnt-offering, the meal-offering, the sin-offering and the guilt-offering; for the installation-sacrifices [sacrifices] and for the peace[sacred]-offering,

verses.ar_he: דִי פַקִיד יְיָ יָת מֹשֶׁה בְּטוּרָא דְסִינָי בְּיוֹמָא דְפַקְדֵהּ יָת בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל לְקָרָבָא יָת קֻרְבָּנְהוֹן קֳדָם יְיָ בְּמַדְבְּרָא דְסִינָי
verses.ar_en: that Adonoy commanded Moshe on Mount Sinai, on the day that he commanded Bnei Yisroel to bring their offerings to [before] Adonoy in the desert of Sinai.

verses.ar_he: וּמַלִיל יְיָ עִם מֹשֶׁה לְמֵימָר
verses.ar_en: And Adonoy spoke to Moshe, to say:

verses.ar_he: קָרֵב יָת אַהֲרֹן וְיָת בְּנוֹהִי עִמֵהּ וְיָת לְבוּשַׁיָא וְיָת מִשְׁחָא דִרְבוּתָא וְיָת תּוֹרָא דְחַטָאתָא וְיָת תְּרֵין דִכְרִין וְיָת סַלָא דְפַטִירַיָא
verses.ar_en: Take [Bring] Aharon [near], along with his sons, the garments, the anointing oil [of inaugurating to greatness], the bull for the sin-offering, the two rams and a basket of matzos.

verses.ar_he: וְיָת כָּל כְּנִשְׁתָּא כְּנֵשׁ לִתְרַע מַשְׁכַּן זִמְנָא
verses.ar_en: Assemble the entire congrega-tion at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting.

verses.ar_he: וַעֲבַד מֹשֶׁה כְּמָא דִי פַקִיד יְיָ יָתֵהּ וְאִתְכְּנִשַׁת כְּנִשְׁתָּא לִתְרַע מַשְׁכַּן זִמְנָא
verses.ar_en: Moshe did that which Adonoy commanded him and the congregation was assembled at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר מֹשֶׁה לִכְנִשְׁתָּא דֵין פִּתְגָמָא דִי פַקִיד יְיָ לְמֶעְבָּד
verses.ar_en: Moshe said to the congregation, This is the edict that Adonoy commanded to do.

verses.ar_he: וְקָרִיב מֹשֶׁה יָת אַהֲרֹן וְיָת בְּנוֹהִי וְאַסְחֵי יָתְהוֹן בְּמַיָא
verses.ar_en: Moshe brought Aharon and his sons near and bathed them in water.

verses.ar_he: וִיהַב עֲלוֹהִי יָת כִּתּוּנָא וְזָרֵז יָתֵהּ בְּהֶמְיָנָא וְאַלְבֵּשׁ יָתֵהּ יָת מְעִילָא וִיהַב עֲלוֹהִי יָת אֵפוֹדָא וְזָרֵז יָתֵהּ בְּהֶמְיַן אֵפוֹדָא וְאַתְקֵן לֵהּ בֵּהּ
verses.ar_en: He placed the tunic on him, girded him with the sash, dressed him in the robe, placed the ephod on him girded him with the ephod-sash and tightened it for him.

verses.ar_he: וְשַׁוִי עֲלוֹהִי יָת חוּשְׁנָא וִיהַב בְּחוּשְׁנָא יָת אוּרַיָא וְיָת תֻּמַיָא
verses.ar_en: He put the breastplate on him and he placed in the breastplate the urim and the tumim.

verses.ar_he: וְשַׁוִי יָת מִצְנַפְתָּא עַל רֵישֵׁיהּ וְשַׁוִי עַל מִצְנֶפְתָּא לָקֳבֵיל אַפּוֹהִי יָת צִיצָא דְדַהֲבָא כְּלִילָא דְקוּדְשָׁא כְּמָא דִי פַקִיד יְיָ יָת מֹשֶׁה
verses.ar_en: He placed the turban on his head and he placed, on the front of the turban, the golden plate, the crown of holiness, just as Adonoy commanded Moshe.

verses.ar_he: וּנְסִיב מֹשֶׁה יָתּ מִשְׁחָא דִרְבוּתָא וְרַבִּי יָת מַשְׁכְּנָא וְיָת כָּל דִי בֵהּ וְקַדִישׁ יָתְהוֹן
verses.ar_en: Moshe took the anointing-oil [of inaugurating to greatness] and anointed [inaugurated] the Tabernacle [to greatness] and everything inside it and sanctified them.

verses.ar_he: וְאַדִי מִנֵהּ עַל מַדְבְּחָא שְׁבַע זִמְנִין וְרַבִּי יָת מַדְבְּחָא וְיָת כָּל מָנוֹהִי וְיָת כִּיוֹרָא וְיָת בְּסִיסֵהּ לְקַדָשׁוּתְהוֹן
verses.ar_en: He sprinkled some of it on the altar seven times; he anointed [inaugurated to greatness] the altar and all its utensils, the washing basin and its base, to sanctify them.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲרֵיק מִמִשְׁחָא דִרְבוּתָא עַל רֵישָׁא דְאַהֲרֹן וְרַבִּי יָתֵהּ לְקַדָשׁוּתֵהּ
verses.ar_en: He poured some of the anointing-oil [which inaugurates to greatness] on Aharons head and anointed [inaugurated] him [to greatness], to sanctify him.

verses.ar_he: וְקָרִיב מֹשֶׁה יָת בְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן וְאַלְבֵּשִׁנוּן כִּתּוּנִין וְזָרֵז יָתְהוֹן הֶמְיָנִין וְאַתְקֵן לְהוֹן כּוֹבָעִין כְּמָא דִי פַקִיד יְיָ יָת מֹשֶׁה
verses.ar_en: Moshe brought near the sons of Aharon and dressed them in tunics, girded them with sashes, and tied high turbans for them [to wear], just as Adonoy commanded Moshe.

verses.ar_he: וְקָרֵב יָת תּוֹרָא דְחַטָאתָא וּסְמַךְ אַהֲרֹן וּבְנוֹהִי יָת יְדֵיהוֹן עַל רֵישׁ תּוֹרָא דְחַטָאתָא
verses.ar_en: He brought near the sin-offering bullock and Aharon and his sons laid their hands on the head of the sin-offering bullock.

verses.ar_he: וּנְכֵס וּנְסִיב מֹשֶׁה יָת דְמָא וִיהַב עַל קַרְנַת מַדְבְּחָא סְחוֹר סְחוֹר בְּאֶצְבְּעֵהּ וְדַכִּי יָת מַדְבְּחָא וְיָת דְמָא אֲרִיק לִיסוֹדָא דְמַדְבְּחָא וְקַדְשֵׁהּ לְכַפָּרָא עֲלוֹהִי
verses.ar_en: He slaughtered it; and Moshe took the blood and put it atop the corners of the altar all around with his finger and he purified the altar. He poured the blood into the base of the altar and sanctified it, to atone upon it.

verses.ar_he: וּנְסִיב יָת כָּל תַּרְבָּא דִי עַל גַוָא וְיָת חֲצַר כַּבְדָא וְיָת תַּרְתֵּין כָּלְיָן וְיָת תַּרְבְּהֶן וְאַסֵק מֹשֶׁה לְמַדְבְּחָא
verses.ar_en: He took all the fat on the innards, the lobe of the liver, the two kidneys and their fats and Moshe burned [them] on the altar.

verses.ar_he: וְיָת תּוֹרָא וְיָת מַשְׁכֵהּ וְיָת בִּסְרֵהּ וְיָת אָכְלֵהּ אוֹקִיד בְּנוּרָא מִבָּרָא לְמַשְׁרִיתָא כְּמָא דִי פַקִיד יְיָ יָת מֹשֶׁה
verses.ar_en: The bullock, its skin, its flesh and its waste [that are in its intestines], he burned in fire, beyond the encampment, just as Adonoy commanded Moshe.

verses.ar_he: וְקָרִיב יָת דִכְרָא דַעֲלָתָא וּסְמָכוּ אַהֲרֹן וּבְנוֹהִי יָת יְדֵיהוֹן עַל רֵישׁ דִכְרָא
verses.ar_en: He brought the burnt-offering ram and Aharon and his sons laid their hands on the rams head.

verses.ar_he: וּנְכֵס וּזְרַק מֹשֶׁה יָת דְמָא עַל מַדְבְּחָא סְחוֹר סְחוֹר
verses.ar_en: He slaughtered it; and Moshe sprinkled the blood all around the altar.

verses.ar_he: וְיָת דִכְרָא פַּלֵג לְאֶבְרוֹהִי וְאַסֵק מֹשֶׁה יָת רֵישָׁא וְיָת אֶבְרַיָא וְיָת תַּרְבָּא
verses.ar_en: He severed the rams limbs; and Moshe burned the head and the severed limbs and the fat.

verses.ar_he: וְיָת גַוָא וְיָת כְּרָעַיָא חַלִיל בְּמַיָא וְאַסֵק מֹשֶׁה יָת כָּל דִכְרָא לְמַדְבְּחָא עֲלָתָא הוּא לְאִתְקַבָּלָא בְרַעִוָא קוּרְבָּנָא הוּא קֳדָם יְיָ כְּמָא דִי פַקִיד יְיָ יָת מֹשֶׁה
verses.ar_en: He washed the innards and feet in water; and Moshe burned the entire ram on the altar. It is a burnt-offering; for a pleasing fragrance [to be accepted with favor], a fire-offering to [an offering before] Adonoy, just as Adonoy commanded Moshe.

verses.ar_he: וְקָרִיב יָת דִכְרָא תִנְיָנָא דְכַר קוּרְבָּנַיָא וּסְמָכוּ אַהֲרֹן וּבְנוֹהִי יָת יְדֵיהוֹן עַל רֵישׁ דִכְרָא
verses.ar_en: He brought the second ram, the ram for the installation-offering [offerings]; and Aharon and his sons laid their hands on the rams head.

verses.ar_he: וּנְכֵס וּנְסִיב מֹשֶׁה מִן דְמָא וִיהַב עַל רוּם אוּדְנָא דְאַהֲרֹן דְיַמִינָא וְעַל אִלְיוֹן יְדֵהּ דְיַמִינָא וְעַל אִלְיוֹן רַגְלֵהּ דְיַמִינָא
verses.ar_en: He slaughtered it; and Moshe took some of its blood and he put it on [the upper part of] Aharons right earlobe [ear], on the thumb of his right hand and the big toe of his right foot.

verses.ar_he: וְקָרֵיב יָת בְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן וִיהַב מֹשֶׁה מִן דְמָא עַל רוּם אוּדְנֵהוֹן דְיַמִינָא וְעַל אִלְיוֹן יְדֵיהוֹן דְיַמִינָא וְעַל אִלְיוֹן רַגְלֵיהוֹן דְיַמִינָא וּזְרַק מֹשֶׁה יָת דְמָא עַל מַדְבְּחָא סְחוֹר סְחוֹר
verses.ar_en: He brought the sons of Aharon; and Moshe put some blood on [the upper part of] their right earlobes [ears] and on the thumbs of their right hands and on the big toes of their right feet. Moshe sprinkled the blood all around the altar.

verses.ar_he: וּנְסִיב יָת תַּרְבָּא וְיָת אֲלִיתָא וְיָת כָּל תַּרְבָּא דִי עַל גַוָא וְיָת חֲצַר כַּבְדָא וְיָת תַּרְתֵּין כָּלְיָן וְיָת תַּרְבְּהֶן וְיָת שׁוֹקָא דְיַמִינָא
verses.ar_en: He took the fat and the fat tail, all the fat on the innards, the lobe of the liver, the two kidneys and their fats and the right thigh.

verses.ar_he: וּמִסַלָא דְפַטִירַיָא דִי קֳדָם יְיָ נְסִיב גְרִצְתָּא פַטִירָא חֲדָא וּגְרִיצְתָּא דִלְחֵם מְשַׁח חֲדָא וְאֶסְפּוֹג חָד וְשַׁוִי עַל תַּרְבַּיָא וְעַל שׁוֹקָא דְיַמִינָא
verses.ar_en: From the basket of matzos which [was] before Adonoy he took one matzoh loaf, one oil-bread and one wafer and he placed them on the fats and on the right thigh.

verses.ar_he: וִיהַב יָת כֹּלָא עַל יְדֵי אַהֲרֹן וְעַל יְדֵי בְנוֹהִי וַאֲרֵים יָתְהוֹן אֲרָמָא קֳדָם יְיָ
verses.ar_en: He put them all on Aharons palms and on the palms of his sons and he waved [lifted] them [up] as a wave-offering [an uplifted-offering] before Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וּנְסִיב מֹשֶׁה יָתְהוֹן מֵעַל יְדֵיהוֹן וְאַסֵק לְמַדְבְּחָא עַל עֲלָתָא קוּרְבָּנַיָא אִנוּן לְאִתְקַבָּלָא בְרַעֲוָא קוּרְבָּנָא הוּא קֳדָם יְיָ
verses.ar_en: Moshe took them from their palms and he burned them on the altar in addition to the burnt-offering; they are installation-offerings for a pleasing fragrance [offerings to be accepted with favor], it is a fire-offering to [an offering before] Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וּנְסִיב מֹשֶׁה יָת חֶדְיָא וַאֲרִימֵהּ אֲרָמָא קֳדָם יְיָ מִדְכַר קוּרְבָּנַיָא לְמֹשֶׁה הֲוָה לָחֳלָק כְּמָא דִי פַקִיד יְיָ יָת מֹשֶׁה
verses.ar_en: Moshe took the breast and waved [lifted] it [up] [as] a wave-offering [an uplifted-offering] before Adonoy. From the ram for the installation-offering [offerings]—that was the portion of Moshe—just as Adonoy commanded Moshe.

verses.ar_he: וּנְסִיב מֹשֶׁה מִמִשְׁחָא דִרְבוּתָא וּמִן דְמָא דִי עַל מַדְבְּחָא וְאַדִי עַל אַהֲרֹן עַל לְבוּשׁוֹהִי וְעַל בְּנוֹהִי וְעַל לְבוּשֵׁי בְנוֹהִי עִמֵהּ וְקַדִישׁ יָת אַהֲרֹן יָת לְבוּשׁוֹהִי וְיָת בְּנוֹהִי וְיָת לְבוּשֵׁי בְנוֹהִי עִמֵהּ
verses.ar_en: Moshe took some anointing-oil [which inaugurates to greatness] and some blood that was on the altar and sprinkled it on Aharon, on his garments, and on his sons and on his sons garments with him. He sanctified Aharon and his garments and his sons and his sons garments with him.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר מֹשֶׁה לְאַהֲרֹן וְלִבְנוֹהִי בַּשִׁילוּ יָת בִּסְרָא בִּתְרַע מַשְׁכַּן זִמְנָא וְתַמָן תֵּיכְלוּן יָתֵהּ וְיָת לַחְמָא דִי בְּסַל קוּרְבָּנַיָא כְּמָא דִי פַקֵדִית לְמֵימָר אַהֲרֹן וּבְנוֹהִי יֵיכְלוּנֵהּ
verses.ar_en: Moshe said to Aharon and to his sons Cook the flesh at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting and you shall eat it there [with] the bread that is in the installation basket [of sacrifices] just as I commanded, saying; Aharon and his sons shall eat them.

verses.ar_he: וּדְאִשְׁתָּאַר בְּבִשְׂרָא וּבְלַחְמָא בְּנוּרָא תּוֹקְדוּן
verses.ar_en: Whatever flesh and bread is left over, you shall burn them in fire.

verses.ar_he: וּמִתְּרַע מַשְׁכַּן זִמְנָא לָא תִפְּקוּן שִׁבְעָא יוֹמִין עַד יוֹם מִשְׁלַם יוֹמֵי קוּרְבָּנֵיכוֹן אֲרֵי שִׁבְעָא יוֹמִין יְקָרֵב יָת קֻרְבָּנֵיכוֹן
verses.ar_en: From the entrance of the Tent of Meeting you shall not go out for seven days until the time that your days of installation [sacrifices] are complete, because for seven days your hands [sacrifices] will be filled [offered].

verses.ar_he: כְּמָא דִי עֲבַד בְּיוֹמָא הָדֵין פָּקִיד יְיָ לְמֶעְבַּד לְכַפָּרָא עֲלֵיכוֹן
verses.ar_en: Just as you have done on this day, Adonoy commanded him to do, to bring about atonement.

verses.ar_he: וּבִתְרַע מַשְׁכַּן זִמְנָא תֵּיתְבוּן יְמָם וְלֵילֵי שִׁבְעָא יוֹמִין וְתִטְרוּן יָת מַטְרַת מֵימְרָא דַיְיָ וְלָא תְמוּתוּן אֲרֵי כֵן אִתְפַּקָדִית
verses.ar_en: At the entrance of the Tent of Meeting you shall sit day and night for seven days and keep the charge of [the Word of] Adonoy and you will not die, because I have been thus commanded.

verses.ar_he: וַעֲבַד אַהֲרֹן וּבְנוֹהִי יָת כָּל פִּתְגָמַיָא דִי פַקִיד יְיָ בִּידָא דְמֹשֶׁה
verses.ar_en: Aharon and his sons fulfilled all the edicts that Adonoy commanded through Moshe.

verses.ar_he: וַהֲוָה בְּיוֹמָא תְמִינָאָה קְרָא מֹשֶׁה לְאַהֲרֹן וְלִבְנוֹהִי וּלְסָבֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל
verses.ar_en: And it was on the eight day [that] Moshe called to Aharon and to his sons and to the elders of Israel.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר לְאַהֲרֹן סַב לָךְ עֵגֶל בַּר תּוֹרֵי לְחַטָּאתָא וּדְכַר לַעֲלָתָא שַׁלְמִין וְקָרֵב קֳדָם יְיָ
verses.ar_en: He said to Aharon, Take, for yourself, a young calf, for a sin-offering and a ram—for a burnt-offering—unblemished ones, and bring them before Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וְעִם בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל תְּמַלֵל לְמֵימָר סִבוּ צְפִיר בַּר עִזִין לְחַטָאתָא וְעֵגֶל וְאִמָר בְּנֵי שְׁנָא שַׁלְמִין לַעֲלָתָא
verses.ar_en: To Bnei Yisroel you shall speak, saying, take a he-goat, for a sin-offering and a calf and a lamb, both one year old—unblemished—for a burnt-offering,

verses.ar_he: וְתוֹר וּדְכַר לְנִכְסַת קוּדְשַׁיָא לְדַבָּחָא קֳדָם יְיָ וּמִנְחָתָא דְפִילָא בִמְשָׁח אֲרֵי יוֹמָא דֵין יְקָרָא דַיְיָ מִתְגְלִי לְכוֹן
verses.ar_en: an ox and a ram for a peace[sacred]-offering, to sacrifice before Adonoy and a meal-offering mixed with oil, for today, [the Glory of] Adonoy will appear [become revealed] to you.

verses.ar_he: וּנְסִיבוּ יָת דִי פַקִיד מֹשֶׁה לָקֳדָם מַשְׁכַּן זִמְנָא וּקְרִיבוּ כָּל כְּנִישְׁתָּא וְקָמוּ קֳדָם יְיָ
verses.ar_en: They took that which Moshe commanded, before the Tent of Meeting; and the entire congregation approached and they stood before Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר מֹשֶׁה דֵין פִּתְגָמָא דִי פַקִיד יְיָ תַּעְבְּדוּן וְיִתְגְלִי לְכוֹן יְקָרָא דַיְיָ
verses.ar_en: Moshe said: This is what Adonoy commanded you to do: and the glory of Adonoy will appear [become revealed] to you.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר מֹשֶׁה לְאַהֲרֹן קְרַב לְמַדְבְּחָא וְעִבֵד יָת חַטָאתָךְ וְיָת עֲלָתָךְ וְכַפֵּר עֲלָךְ וְעַל עַמָא וְעִבֵד יָת קֻרְבַּן עַמָא וְכַפֵּר עֲלֵיהוֹן כְּמָא דִי פַקִיד יְיָ
verses.ar_en: Moshe said to Aharon: Approach the altar and perform [the services of] your sin-offering and your burnt-offering and atone on your [own] behalf and on behalf of the people; and perform [the service of] the peoples offering and atone on their behalf, just as Adonoy commanded.

verses.ar_he: וּקְרַב אַהֲרֹן לְמַדְבְּחָא וּנְכֵס יָת עֶגְלָא דְחַטָאתָא דִי לֵהּ
verses.ar_en: Aharon approached the altar and slaughtered the calf that he had for a sin-offering.

verses.ar_he: וְקָרִיבוּ בְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן יָת דְמָא לֵהּ וּטְבַל אֶצְבְּעֵהּ בִּדְמָא וִיהַב עַל קַרְנַת מַדְבְּחָא וְיָת דְמָא אֲרִיק לִיסוֹדָא דְמַדְבְּחָא
verses.ar_en: Aharons sons brought the blood to him and he dipped his finger into the blood and put it atop the corners of the altar and he poured the [remaining] blood into the base of the altar.

verses.ar_he: וְיָת תַּרְבָּא וְיָת כָּלְיֵתָא וְיָת חִצְרָא מִן כַּבְדָא מִן חַטָאתָא אַסֵק לְמַדְבְּחָא כְּמָא דִי פַקִיד יְיָ יָת מֹשֶׁה
verses.ar_en: The fat, kidneys and the lobe of the liver from the sin-offering, he burned on the altar, just as Adonoy commanded Moshe.

verses.ar_he: וְיָת בִּשְׂרָא וְיָת מַשְׁכָא אוֹקִיד בְּנוּרָא מִבָּרָא לְמַשְׁרִיתָא
verses.ar_en: The flesh and the skin, he burned in a fire beyond the encampment.

verses.ar_he: וּנְכֵס יָת עֲלָתָא וְאַמְטִיאוּ בְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן לֵּהּ יָת דְמָא וּזְרָקֵהּ עַל מַדְבְּחָא סְחוֹר סְחוֹר
verses.ar_en: He slaughtered the burnt-offering; and Aharons sons presented the blood to him, and he sprinkled it all around the altar.

verses.ar_he: וְיָת עֲלָתָא אַמְטִיאוּ לֵהּ לְאֵבָרָהָא וְיָת רֵישָׁא וְאַסֵק עַל מַדְבְּחָא
verses.ar_en: They presented the burnt-offering to him with its limbs severed and [with] the head, and he burned them on the altar.

verses.ar_he: וְחַלִיל יָת גַוָא וְיָת כְּרָעַיָא וְאַסֵק עַל עֲלָתָא לְמַדְבְּחָא
verses.ar_en: He washed the innards and the feet and burned them on the burnt-offering, on the altar.

verses.ar_he: וְקָרֵב יָת קֻרְבַּן עַמָא וּנְסִב יָת צְפִירָא דְחַטָאתָא דִי לְעַמָא וְנָכְסֵהּ וְכַפֵּר בִּדְמֵהּ כְּקַדְמָאָה
verses.ar_en: He brought the peoples offering; he took the peoples sin-offering-goat, and he slaughtered it and offered it as a sin-offering [atoned with its blood], in the same manner as the first one.

verses.ar_he: וְקָרֵב יָת עֲלָתָא וְעָבְדַהּ כִּדְחָזֵי
verses.ar_en: He brought the burnt-offering and he did it according to the rule.

verses.ar_he: וְקָרִיב יָת מִנְחָתָא וּמְלָא יְדֵהּ מִנַהּ וְאַסֵק עַל מַדְבְּחָא בַּר מֵעֲלַת צַפְרָא
verses.ar_en: He brought the meal-offering; he filled his palm from it and burned it on the altar: aside from the burnt-offering [that was brought] in the morning.

verses.ar_he: וּנְכֵס יָת תּוֹרָא וְיָת דִכְרָא נִכְסַת קוּדְשַׁיָא דִי לְעַמָא וְאַמְטִיאוּ בְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן יָת דְמָא לֵהּ וּזְרָקֵהּ עַל מַדְבְּחָא סְחוֹר סְחוֹר
verses.ar_en: He slaughtered the ox and the ram, the peace[sacred]-offerings of the people; and Aharons sons presented the blood to him and he sprinkled it all around the altar.

verses.ar_he: וְיָת תַּרְבַּיָא מִן תּוֹרָא וּמִן דִכְרָא אֲלִיתָא וְחָפֵי גַוָא וְכָלְיֵתָא וַחֲצַר כַּבְדָא
verses.ar_en: The fats of the ox and of the ram; the fat-tail, the [fat] covering [the innards], the kidneys and the lobe of the liver.

verses.ar_he: וְשַׁוִיאוּ יָת תַּרְבַּיָא עַל חֶדְוָתָא וְאַסֵק תַּרְבַּיָא לְמַדְבְּחָא
verses.ar_en: They put the fats on top of the breasts and he burned the fats on the altar.

verses.ar_he: וְיָת חֶדְוָתָא וְיָת שׁוֹקָא דְיַמִינָא אֲרֵים אַהֲרֹן אֲרָמָא קֳדָם יְיָ כְּמָא דִי פַקִיד מֹשֶׁה
verses.ar_en: The breasts and the right thigh, Aharon waved [lifted up] [as] a wave-offering [an uplifted-offering] before Adonoy, just as Moshe commanded.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲרֵם אַהֲרֹן יָת יְדוֹהִי עַל עַמָא וּבָרֵכִנוּן וּנְחַת מִלְמֶעְבַּד חַטָאתָא וַעֲלָתָא וְנִכְסַת קוּדְשַׁיָא
verses.ar_en: Aharon raised his hands toward the people and he blessed them. He descended [from the altar where he] had offered the sin-offering, the burnt-offering and the peace[sacred]-offering.

verses.ar_he: וְעַל מֹשֶׁה וְאַהֲרֹן לְמַשְׁכַּן זִמְנָא וּנְפָקוּ וּבָרִיכוּ יָת עַמָא וְאִתְגְלִי יְקָרָא דַיְיָ לְכָל עַמָא
verses.ar_en: And Moshe and Aharon went [in]to the Tent of Meeting and [then] they went outside and blessed the people, and the glory of Adonoy appeared [became revealed] to the entire people.

verses.ar_he: וּנְפָקַת אֶשָׁתָא מִן קֳדָם יְיָ וַאֲכָלַת עַל מַדְבְּחָא יָת עֲלָתָא וְיָת תַּרְבַּיָא וַחֲזָא כָּל עַמָא וְשַׁבָּחוּ וּנְפָלוּ עַל אַפֵּיהוֹן
verses.ar_en: A fire came forth from before Adonoy and consumed what was on the altar; the burnt-offering and the fats. All the people saw and they raised their voices in praise, and they fell on their faces.

verses.ar_he: וּנְסִיבוּ בְנֵי אַהֲרֹן נָדָב וַאֲבִיהוּא גְבַר מַחְתִּיתֵהּ וִיהָבוּ בְהוֹן אֶשָׁתָא וְשַׁוִיאוּ עֲלַהּ קְטוֹרֶת וְקָרִיבוּ קֳדָם יְיָ אֶשָׁתָא נוּכְרֵיתָא דִי לָא פַקִיד יָתְהוֹן
verses.ar_en: Nodov and Avihu, Aharons sons, took, each of them his fire-pan, placed fire on it and then placed incense upon it and they brought before Adonoy a strange fire, which He had not commanded them.

verses.ar_he: וּנְפָקַת אֶשָׁתָא מִן קֳדָם יְיָ וַאֲכָלַת יָתְהוֹן וּמִיתוּ קֳדָם יְיָ
verses.ar_en: A fire came forth from before Adonoy and consumed them, and they died in the presence of Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר מֹשֶׁה לְאַהֲרֹן הוּא דִי מַלִיל יְיָ לְמֵימַר בְּקָרִיבַי אִתְקַדַשׁ וְעַל אַפֵּי כָל עַמָא אִתְיַקָר וּשְׁתִיק אַהֲרֹן
verses.ar_en: Moshe said to Aharon It is as Adonoy spoke, saying: through those that are near me I shall be sanctified, and in the presence of the entire people I will be glorified, and Aharon was silent.

verses.ar_he: וּקְרָא מֹשֶׁה לְמִישָׁאֵל וּלְאֶלְצָפָן בְּנֵי עֻזִיאֵל אַח אֲבוּהִי דְאַהֲרֹן וַאֲמַר לְהוֹן קְרִיבוּ טוּלוּ יָת אֲחֵיכוֹן מִן קֳדָם אַפֵּי קוּדְשָׁא לְמִבָּרָא לְּמַשְׁרִיתָא
verses.ar_en: Moshe called to Mishael and to Elzafan the sons of Uziel, [the brother of the father of] Aharon’s uncle, and said to them; Come closer and carry your brothers from the presence of the Sanctuary, to beyond the encampment.

verses.ar_he: וּקְרִיבוּ וּנְטָלֻּנוּן בְּכִתֻּנֵיהוֹן לְמִבָּרָא לְמַשְׁרִיתָא כְּמָא דִי מַלִיל מֹשֶׁה
verses.ar_en: They came closer and they carried them in their tunics to beyond the encampment, just as Moshe spoke.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר מֹשֶׁה לְאַהֲרֹן וּלְאֶלְעָזָר וּלְאִיתָמָר בְּנוֹהִי רֵישֵׁיכוֹן לָא תְרַבּוּן פֵּרוּעַ וּלְבוּשֵׁיכוֹן לָא תְבַזְעוּן וְלָא תְמוּתוּן וְעַל כָּל כְּנִשְׁתָּא יְהֵא רוּגְזָא וַאֲחֵיכוֹן כָּל בֵּית יִשְׂרָאֵל יִבְכּוּן יָת יְקִדְתָּא דִי אוֹקִיד יְיָ
verses.ar_en: Moshe said to Aharon and to Elozor and Isomor, his sons: Do not let your hair grow long and do not tear your garments so that you will not die and bring [Divine] anger on the entire congregation; your brothers, the entire House of Yisroel shall weep over the conflagration that Adonoy set ablaze.

verses.ar_he: וּמִתְּרַע מַשְׁכַּן זִמְנָא לָא תִפְקוּן דִלְמָא תְמוּתוּן אֲרֵי מְשַׁח רְבוּתָא דַיְיָ עֲלֵיכוֹן וַעֲבָדוּ כְּפִתְגָמָא דְמֹשֶׁה
verses.ar_en: From the entrance of the Tent of Meeting you shall not go forth lest you die; for the anointing oil of [the inauguration to greatness of] Adonoy is on you and they did as Moshe had said.

verses.ar_he: וּמַלִיל יְיָ עִם אַהֲרֹן לְמֵימָר
verses.ar_en: Adonoy spoke to Aharon, saying,

verses.ar_he: חֲמַר וּמְרַוֵי לָא תִשְׁתֵּי אַתְּ וּבְנָיךְ עִמָךְ בְּמֵעַלְכוֹן לְמַשְׁכַּן זִמְנָא וְלָא תְמוּתוּן קְיַם עָלָם לְדָרֵיכוֹן
verses.ar_en: Do not drink wine or any other intoxicant, you and your sons with you, when you enter the Tent of Meeting and you will not die; this is an everlasting statute throughout your generations.

verses.ar_he: וּלְאַפְרָשָׁא בֵּין קוּדְשָׁא וּבֵין חֻלָא וּבֵין מְסָאֲבָא וּבֵין דַכְיָא
verses.ar_en: [So that you may] distinguish between what is sacred and what is mundane, between what is impure and what is pure.

verses.ar_he: וּלְאַלָפָא יָת בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל יָת כָּל קְיָמַיָא דִי מַלִיל יְיָ לְהוֹן בִּידָא דְמֹשֶׁה
verses.ar_en: [And that you may] teach Bnei Yisroel all the statutes that Adonoy spoke to them, through Moshe.

verses.ar_he: וּמַלִיל מֹשֶׁה עִם אַהֲרֹן וְעִם אֶלְעָזָר וְעִם אִיתָמָר בְּנוֹהִי דְאִשְׁתָּאֲרוּ סִבוּ יָת מִנְחָתָא דְאִשְׁתָּאָרָת מִקֻרְבָּנַיָא דַיְיָ וְאִכְלוּהָ פַטִיר בִּסְטַר מַדְבְּחָא אֲרֵי קֹדֶשׁ קוּדְשִׁין הִיא
verses.ar_en: Moshe spoke to Aharon and to Elozor and Isomor, his surviving sons; Take the meal-offering which remains of the fire-offering [offerings] of Adonoy and eat it [as] matzos [matzoh] [unleavened] beside the altar, for it is holy of holies [=most holy].

verses.ar_he: וְתֵיכְלוּן יָתַהּ בַּאֲתַר קַדִישׁ אֲרֵי חֳלָקָךְ וָחֳלַק בְּנָיךְ הִיא מִקֻרְבָּנַיָא דַיְיָ אֲרֵי כֵן אִתְפַּקָדִית
verses.ar_en: You shall eat it in a sacred place, for it is your portion and the portion of your sons of the fire-offerings [offerings] of Adonoy, for so have I been commanded.

verses.ar_he: וְיָת חֶדְיָא דַאֲרָמוּתָא וְיָת שׁוֹקָא דְאַפְרָשׁוּתָא תֵּיכְלוּן בַּאֲתַר דְכֵי אַתְּ וּבְנָיךְ וּבְנָתָיךְ עִמָךְ אֲרֵי חֳלָקָךְ וָחֳלַק בְּנָיךְ אִתְיְהִיבוּ מִנִכְסַת קוּדְשַׁיָא דִבְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל
verses.ar_en: The breast of the wave-offering [uplifted-offering] and the thigh that is the separated portion you shall eat in a pure (undefiled) place, you and your sons and daughters with you, for as your portion and as the portion of your sons they are given from the sacrifices of the peace[sacred]-offerings of Bnei Yisroel.

verses.ar_he: שׁוֹקָא דְאַפְרָשׁוּתָא וְחֶדְיָא דַאֲרָמוּתָא עַל קֻרְבָּנֵי תַרְבַּיָא יַיְתוּן לַאֲרָמָא אֲרָמָא קֳדָם יְיָ וִיהֵי לָךְ וְלִבְנָיךְ עִמָךְ לִקְיַם עָלָם כְּמָא דִי פַקִיד יְיָ
verses.ar_en: The thigh that is the separated portion and the breast that is the wave-offering [uplifted-offering], on top of the fats of the fire offering [offering], they shall bring, to wave [lift up] as a wave-offering [an uplifted-offering] before Adonoy. It will be for you and for your sons with you an everlasting statute, just as Adonoy commanded.

verses.ar_he: וְיָת צְפִירָא דְחַטָאתָא מִתְבַּע תָּבְעֵי מֹשֶׁה וְהָא אִתּוֹקָד וּרְגֵז עַל אֶלְעָזָר וְעַל אִיתָמָר בְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן דְאִשְׁתָּאֲרוּ לְמֵימָר
verses.ar_en: Regarding the goat of the sin-offering; Moshe made a detailed inquiry and behold! It was burned. He was angry with Elozor and Isomor, the remaining sons of Aharon, saying:

verses.ar_he: מָדֵין לָא אֲכַלְתּוּן יָת חַטָאתָא בַּאֲתַר קַדִישׁ אֲרֵי קֹדֶשׁ קוּדְשִׁין הִיא וְיָתַהּ יְהַב לְכוֹן לְסַלָחָא עַל חוֹבֵי כְנִשְׁתָּא לְכַפָּרָא עֲלֵיהוֹן קֳדָם יְיָ
verses.ar_en: Why did you not eat the sin-offering in a sacred place, for it is holy of holies [=most holy], and He gave it to you, to bear the iniquity of the congregation, to atone for them before Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: הָא לָא אִתָּעַל יָת דְמַהּ לְבֵית קֻדְשָׁא גַוָאָה מֵיכַל תֵּכְלוּן יָתַהּ בְּקֻדְשָׁא כְּמָא דִי פַקֵדִית
verses.ar_en: Behold its blood was not brought inside the Sanctuary, you should certainly have eaten it in a holy place as I have commanded.

verses.ar_he: וּמַלִיל אַהֲרֹן עִם מֹשֶׁה הָא יוֹמָא דֵין קְרִיבוּ יָת חַטָּאתְהוֹן וְיָת עֲלָתְהוֹן קֳדָם יְיָ וַעֲרָעָא יָתִי עָקָן כְּאִלֵין וְאִלוּפוֹן אֲכָלִית חַטָאתָא יוֹמָא דֵין הֲתַקֵן קֳדָם יְיָ
verses.ar_en: Aharon spoke [in reply] to Moshe, Behold, today they brought their sin-offerings and their burnt-offerings before Adonoy and then such [tragedy] befell me. If I had eaten the sin-offering today, would that have been good in the eyes of [fitting before] Adonoy?

verses.ar_he: וּשְׁמַע מֹשֶׁה וּשְׁפַר בְּעֵינוֹהִי
verses.ar_en: Moshe heard, and it was good [pleasing] in his eyes.

verses.ar_he: וּמַלִיל יְיָ עִם מֹשֶׁה וְעִם אַהֲרֹן לְמֵימַר לְהוֹן
verses.ar_en: And Adonoy spoke to Moshe and to Aharon, saying to them:

verses.ar_he: מַלִילוּ עִם בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל לְמֵימַר דָא חַיְתָא דִי תֵיכְלוּן מִכָּל בְּעִירָא דִי עַל אַרְעָא
verses.ar_en: Speak to Bnei Yisroel, saying: these are the living things that you may eat from among all the animals that are on the earth.

verses.ar_he: כֹּל דִי סְדִיקָן פַּרְסָתָא וּמַטִלְפָן טִלְפִין פַּרְסָתָא מַסְקָּא פִשְׁרָא בִּבְעִירָא יָתַהּ תֵּיכְלוּן
verses.ar_en: All that have a cloven hoof, and they [the hooves] are [completely] split and that [also] chews its cud [brings up dissolved food] among animals, you may eat it.

verses.ar_he: בְּרָם יָת דֵין לָא תֵיכְלוּן מִמַסְקֵי פִשְׁרָא וּמִמַסְדִיקֵי פַּרְסָתָא יָת גַמְלָא אֲרֵי מַסִיק פִּשְׁרָא הוּא וּפַרְסָתָא לָא סְדִיקָא מְסָאָב הוּא לְכוֹן
verses.ar_en: However, these in particular you may not eat of those that chew [bring up] their cud [dissolved food] and that have cloven hooves: the camel, for he chews [brings up] his cud [dissolved food] but does not have a split hoof it is unclean to you.

verses.ar_he: וְיָת טַפְזָא אֲרֵי מַסִיק פִּשְׁרָא הוּא וּפַרְסָתָא לָא סְדִיקָא מְסָאָב הוּא לְכוֹן
verses.ar_en: The [jumping] rabbit , for it chews [brings up] its cud [dissolved food] but does not have a cloven hoof it is unclean to you.

verses.ar_he: וְיָת אַרְנְבָא אֲרֵי מַסְקָא פִשְׁרָא הִיא וּפַרְסָתָא לָא סְדִיקָא מְסָאָבָא הִיא לְכוֹן
verses.ar_en: The hare, for it chews [brings up] its cud [dissolved food] but it does not have a cloven hoof it is unclean to you.

verses.ar_he: וְיָת חֲזִירָא אֲרֵי סְדִיק פַּרְסָתָא הוּא וּמַטִּלְפָן טִּלְפִין פַרְסָתֵהּ וְהוּא פִּשְׁרָא לָא פָשָׁר מְסָאָב הוּא לְכוֹן
verses.ar_en: The pig, for though it has cloven hooves, and its hooves are [completely] split—it does not chew [bring up] its cud [dissolved food]—it is unclean to you.
