verses.ar_he: עֶרְיַת כַּלָתָךְ לָא תְגַלֵי אִתַּת בְּרָךְ הִיא לָא תְגַלֵי עֶרְיָתָהּ
verses.ar_en: The nakedness of your daughter-in-law you shall not uncover; she is your sons wife, you shall not uncover her nakedness.

verses.ar_he: עֶרְיַת אִתַּת אֲחוּךְ לָא תְגַלֵי עֶרְיַת אֲחוּךְ הִיא
verses.ar_en: The nakedness of your brothers wife you shall not uncover; it is your brothers nakedness.

verses.ar_he: עֶרְיַת אִתְּתָא וּבְרַתָּהּ לָא תְגַלֵי יָת בַּת בְּרָהּ וְיָת בַּת בְּרַתָּהּ לָא תִסַב לְגַלָאָה עֶרְיָתָהּ קָרִיבָן אִנוּן עֵצַת חִטְאִין הִיא
verses.ar_en: The nakedness of a woman and her daughter you shall not uncover. The daughter of her son and the daughter of her daughter you shall not take to uncover her nakedness, they are kin; it is lewdness [a sinful plan].

verses.ar_he: וְאִתְּתָא עִם אֲחָתָהּ לָא תִסָב לְעָקָאָה לְגַלָאָה עֶרְיְתָהּ עֲלָהּ בְּחַיָיהָא
verses.ar_en: You shall not take a woman and her sister to vex [her] to uncover her nakedness with the other, in her lifetime.

verses.ar_he: וּלְאִתְּתָא בְּרִחוּק סוֹבְתַהּ לָא תִקְרַב לְגַלָאָה עֶרְיְתָהּ
verses.ar_en: To a woman while in her menstrual impurity [the state of her impure ‘separation’], you shall not approach to uncover her nakedness.

verses.ar_he: וּבְאִתַּת חַבְרָךְ לָא תִתֵּן שְׁכֻבְתָּךְ לְזַרְעָא לְאִסְתָּאָבָא בָהּ
verses.ar_en: With your friends wife you shall not lie carnally, to defile yourself through her.

verses.ar_he: וּמִבְּנָיִךְ לָא תִתֵּן לְאַעְבָּרָא לְמוֹלֶךְ וְלָא תַחֵל יָת שְׁמָא דֶאֱלָהָךְ אֲנָא יְיָ
verses.ar_en: You shall not hand over any of your children to be passed through [the worship of] Molech and you shall not defile the Name of your God, I am Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וְעִם דְכוּרָא לָא תִשְׁכּוּב מִשְׁכְּבֵי אִתְּתָא תּוֹעֶבְתָּא הִיא
verses.ar_en: You shall not lie with a male [conjugally] as one lies with a woman; it is an abomination.

verses.ar_he: וּבְכָל בְּעִירָא לָא תִתֵּן שְׁכֻבְתָּךְ לְאִסְתָּאָבָא בָהּ וְאִתְּתָא לָא תְקוּם קֳדָם בְּעִירָא לְמִשְׁלַט בָּהּ תִּבְלָא הוּא
verses.ar_en: Together with any animal you shall not lie [conjugally] to defile yourself with it. A woman shall not stand before an animal to copulate with it [control her]; it is defilement.

verses.ar_he: לָא תִסְתַּאֲבוּן בְּכָל אִלֵין אֲרֵי בְּכָל אִלֵין אִסְתַּאָבוּ עַמְמַיָא דִי אֲנָא מַגְלֵי מִן קֳדָמֵיכוֹן
verses.ar_en: Do not defile yourselves in any one of these [ways], for in all of these [ways] the nations have become defiled [those] that I am driving away [exiling] from before you.

verses.ar_he: וְאִסְתָּאָבַת אַרְעָא וְאַסְעָרִית חוֹבָהּ עֲלָהּ וְרוֹקֵינַת אַרְעָא יָת יָתְבָהָא
verses.ar_en: The land became defiled and I judged its iniquities upon it and the land expelled its inhabitants.

verses.ar_he: וְתִטְרוּן אַתּוּן יָת קְיָמַי וְיָת דִינַי וְלָא תַעְבְּדוּן מִכֹּל תּוֹעֶבְתָּא הָאִלֵין יַצִיבָא וְגִיוֹרָא דְיִתְגַיְרוּן בֵּינֵיכוֹן
verses.ar_en: You shall adhere to My statutes and to My laws and not do any of these abominations [both] the native born [settled one] and the proselyte who resides [converts] among you.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי יָת כָּל תּוֹעֶבְתָּא הָאִלֵין עֲבָדוּ אֱנָשֵׁי אַרְעָא דִי קֳדָמֵיכוֹן וְאִסְתָּאָבַת אַרְעָא
verses.ar_en: For all of these abominations were done by the people of the land who came before you and the land became defiled.

verses.ar_he: וְלָא תְרוֹקֵן אַרְעָא יָתְכוֹן בְּסָאֳבֵיכוֹן יָתָהּ כְּמָא דְרוֹקֵינַת יָת עַמְמַיָא דִי קֳדָמֵיכוֹן
verses.ar_en: [So that] the land not expel you when you defile it as it expelled the nation [nations] before you.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי כָּל דִי יַעְבֵּד מִכֹּל תּוֹעֶבְתָּא הָאִלֵין וְיִשְׁתֵּיצוּן נַפְשָׁתָא דְיַעְבְּדוּן מִגוֹ עַמְהוֹן
verses.ar_en: For anyone who will do any of these abominations, their souls shall be cut off, those who do these things, from among their people.

verses.ar_he: וְתִטְרוּן יָת מַטְרַת מֵימְרִי בְּדִיל דְלָא לְמֶעְבַּד מִנִימוֹסֵי תוֹעֶבְתָּא דְאִתְעֲבָדָא קֳדָמֵיכוֹן וְלָא תִסְתַּאֲבוּן בְּהוֹן אֲנָא יְיָ אֱלָהָכוֹן
verses.ar_en: You shall keep my watch [the watch of My Word] that you shall not do any of the abominable customs that were done before you and you will not defile yourselves through them. I am Adonoy, your God.

verses.ar_he: וּמַלִיל יְיָ עִם מֹשֶׁה לְמֵימָר
verses.ar_en: Adonoy spoke to Moshe, saying:

verses.ar_he: מַלֵל עִם כָּל כְּנִשְׁתָּא דִבְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וְתֵימַר לְהוֹן קַדִישִׁין תְּהוֹן אֲרֵי קַדִישׁ אֲנָא יְיָ אֱלָהָכוֹן
verses.ar_en: Speak to the entire congregation [of] Bnei Yisroel and say to them: You shall be holy, for I, Adonoy, your God, am holy.

verses.ar_he: גְבַר מִן אִמֵהּ וּמִן אֲבוּהִי תְּהוֹן דָחֲלִין וְיָת יוֹמֵי שַׁבַּיָא דִילִי תִּטְרוּן אֲנָא יְיָ אֱלָהָכוֹן
verses.ar_en: A man—you shall fear his mother and father and keep [the days of] My Sabbaths, I am Adonoy, your God.

verses.ar_he: לָא תִתְפְּנוּן בָּתַר טַעֲוָן וְדַחֲלָן דְמַתְּכָא לָא תַעְבְּדוּן לְכוֹן אֲנָא יְיָ אֱלָהָכוֹן
verses.ar_en: Do not turn to the [false] idols and do not make molten gods for yourselves, I am Adonoy, your God.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲרֵי תִכְסוּן נִכְסַת קוּדְשַׁיָא קֳדָם יְיָ לְרַעֲוָא לְכוֹן תִּכְסֻנֵהּ
verses.ar_en: When you slaughter a peace[sacred]-offering to [before] Adonoy, you shall slaughter it to be acceptable for you.

verses.ar_he: בְּיוֹמָא דְיִתְנְכֵס יִתְאֲכֵל וּבְיוֹמָא דְבַתְרוֹהִי וּדְאִשְׁתָּאַר עַד יוֹמָא תְלִיתָאָה בְּנוּרָא יִתּוֹקָד
verses.ar_en: On the day that it is slaughtered it may be eaten and on the next day. Whatever is left over by the third day shall be burned in fire.

verses.ar_he: וְאִם אִתְאֲכָלָא יִתְאֲכֵל בְּיוֹמָא תְלִיתָאָה מְרָחַק הוּא לָא יְהֵי לְרַעַוָא
verses.ar_en: And if it should be eaten at all on the third day it is an abomination [a rejection], it will not be favorably accepted.

verses.ar_he: וּדְיֵיכְלִנֵהּ חוֹבֵהּ יְקַבֵּל אֲרֵי יָת קוּדְשָׁא דַיְיָ אַחֵל וְיִשְׁתֵּיצֵי אֲנָשָׁא הַהוּא מֵעַמֵהּ
verses.ar_en: Whoever eats from it shall bear his iniquity, for the sacred [things] of Adonoy he has defiled. That [persons] soul shall be cut off from its people.

verses.ar_he: וּבְמֶחְצָדְכוֹן יָת חֲצָדָא דְאַרְעֲכוֹן לָא תְשֵׁיצֵי פָּאתָא דְחַקְלָךְ לְמֶחְצָד וּלְקָטָא דַחֲצָדָךְ לָא תְלַקֵט
verses.ar_en: When you will reap the harvest of your land, you shall not completely reap a corner of your field, and the gleanings of your harvest you shall not gather.

verses.ar_he: וְכַרְמָךְ לָא תְעַלֵל וְנִתְרָא דְכַרְמָךְ לָא תְלַקֵט לְעַנְיֵי וּלְגִיוֹרֵי תִּשְׁבּוֹק יָתְהוֹן אֲנָא יְיָ אֱלָהָכוֹן
verses.ar_en: You shall not glean your vineyard, and the fallen grapes of your vineyard, you shall not gather. For the poor and the proselyte you shall leave them, I am Adonoy, your God.

verses.ar_he: לָא תִּגְנְבוּן וְלָא תְכַדְבוּן וְלָא תְשַׁקְרוּן אֱנַשׁ בְּחַבְרֵהּ
verses.ar_en: You shall not steal. You shall not deny [a rightful claim] and each one of you shall not lie to each other.

verses.ar_he: וְלָא תִשָׁבְעוּן בִּשְׁמִי לְשִׁקְרָא וְתַחֵל יָת שְׁמָא דֶאֱלָהָךְ אֲנָא יְיָ
verses.ar_en: You shall not swear falsely by My Name profaning the Name of your God, I am Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: לָא תַעֲשׁוֹק יָת חַבְרָךְ וְלָא תְאַנֵס לָא תְבִית אַגְרָא דַאֲגִירָא לְוָתָךְ עַד צַפְרָא
verses.ar_en: You shall not withhold the wages of your fellow [Jew] and you shall not rob [oppress]. It shall not remain overnight, [You shall not withhold] the wages of a day-laborer, keeping it in your possession until morning.

verses.ar_he: לָא תְלוּטּ דְלָא שָׁמַע וְקֳדָם דְלָא חָזֵי לָא תְשִׂים תַּקְלָא וְתִדְחַל מֵאֱלָהָךְ אֲנָא יְיָ
verses.ar_en: You shall not curse a deaf person [who can not hear] and before a blind person [who can not see] you shall not place a stumbling-block; you shall fear your God, I am Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: לָא תַעְבְּדוּן שְׁקַר בְּדִינָא לָא תִסַב אַפֵּי מַסְכֵּנָא וְלָא תֶהְדַר אַפֵּי רַבָּא בְּקוּשְׁטָא תְּדִינֵהּ לְחַבְרָךְ
verses.ar_en: You shall not commit injustice [lie] in judgement, you shall not favor a poor man and you shall not show honor to a powerful man. With righteousness [truth] shall you judge your fellow [Jew].

verses.ar_he: לָא תֵיכוּל קוּרְצִין בְּעַמָךְ לָא תְקוּם עַל דְמָא דְחַבְרָךְ אֲנָא יְיָ
verses.ar_en: Do not be a tale-bearer [’eat and wink’] among your people. You shall not stand idly by [when] the blood (life) of your fellow [is in danger]. I am Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: לָא תִשְׂנֵי יָת אֲחוּךְ בְּלִבָּךְ אוֹכָחָא תוֹכַח יָת חַבְרָךְ וְלָא תְקַבֵּל עַל דִי לֵהּ חוֹבָא
verses.ar_en: You shall not hate your brother in your heart; You shall certainly rebuke your friend; [but] you shall not bear a sin on his account.

verses.ar_he: לָא תִקוֹם וְלָא תִטַר דְבָבוּ לִבְנֵי עַמָךְ וּתְרַחֵם לְחַבְרָךְ כְּוָתָךְ אֲנָא יְיָ
verses.ar_en: You shall not take revenge or bear a grudge against the children of your people. You shall love your fellow [Jew] as yourself, I am Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: יָת קְיָמַי תִּטְרוּן בְּעִירָךְ לָא תַרְכֵּב עֵרוּבִין חַקְלָךְ לָא תִזְרַע עֵרוּבִין וּלְבוּשׁ עֵרוּבִין שַׁעַטְנֵזָא לָא יִסַק עֲלָךְ
verses.ar_en: Keep My statutes; Do not cross-breed your animals with different species. Do not sow your field with a mixture of different seeds. A garment that contains shatnez [a forbidden mixture of linen and wool] you shall not wear.

verses.ar_he: וּגְבַר אֲרֵי יִשְׁכּוּב עִם אִתְּתָא שִׁכְבַת זַרְעָא וְהִיא אַמְתָא אֲחִידָא לִגְבַר וְאִתְפְּרָקָא לָא אִתְפְּרִיקַת בְּכַסְפָּא אוֹ חֵרוּתָא לָא אִתְיְהִיבַת לַהּ בִּשְׁטָר בִּקֻּרְתָּא תְהֵי לָא יוּמְתוּן אֲרֵי לָא אִתְחָרָרַת
verses.ar_en: If a man lies with a woman in a conjugal manner, and she is a maid-servant designated for a [specific] man and she has certainly not been redeemed [with money], or her freedom was not given to her [through a document]; there shall be an investigation they shall not be put to death, for her freedom was not given to her.

verses.ar_he: וְיַיְתִי יָת אַשְׁמֵהּ קֳדָם יְיָ לִתְרַע מַשְׁכַּן זִמְנָא דְכַר לַאֲשָׁמָא
verses.ar_en: He shall bring his guilt-offering to [before] Adonoy, to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, a guilt-offering-ram.

verses.ar_he: וִיכַפֵּר עֲלוֹהִי כַּהֲנָא בְּדִכְרָא דַאֲשָׁמָא קֳדָם יְיָ עַל חוֹבְתֵהּ דִי חָב וְיִשְׁתְּבֵק לֵהּ מְחוֹבְתֵהּ דִי חַב
verses.ar_en: The kohein shall atone for him with the guilt-offering-ram before Adonoy for the sin which he committed and he will be forgiven for the sin which he committed.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲרֵי תֵעֲלוּן לְאַרְעָא וְתִצְבוּן כָּל אִלָן דְמֵיכַל וּתְרַחֲקוּן רָחָקָא יַת אִבֵּהּ תְּלַת שְׁנִין יְהֵי לְכוֹן מְרָחָק לַאֲבָדָא לָא יִתְאֲכֵל
verses.ar_en: When you will enter the land and you will plant any food-bearing tree, you shall regard its fruit as closed off [separated]. [For] three years it shall be closed off [separated] to you [to be destroyed], it shall not be eaten.

verses.ar_he: וּבְשַׁתָּא רְבִיעֵתָא יְהֵי כָּל אִבֵּהּ קֹדֶשׁ תּוּשְׁבְּחָן קֳדָם יְיָ
verses.ar_en: On the fourth year, all of its fruit shall be holy [upon which to say] praise[s to] [before] Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וּבְשַׁתָּא חֲמִישֵׁתָא תֵּיכְלוּן יָת אִבֵּהּ לְאוֹסָפָא לְכוֹן עֲלַלְתֵּהּ אֲנָא יְיָ אֱלָהָכוֹן
verses.ar_en: On the fifth year, you may eat its fruit, so that it will increase its produce for you, I am Adonoy, your God.

verses.ar_he: לָא תֵיכְלוּן עַל דְמָא לָא תְנַחֲשׁוּן וְלָא תְעוֹנוּן
verses.ar_en: You shall not eat [sacred offerings] [before] the blood [is sprinkled on the altar]. You shall not act on the basis of omens nor act on the basis of auspicious times.

verses.ar_he: לָא תַקְפוּן פָּאתָא דְרֵישְׁכוֹן וְלָא תְחַבֵּל יָת פָּאתָא דְדִקְנָךְ
verses.ar_en: Do not round the corners of [the hair on] your heads and you shall not destroy [by shaving] the edges of your beard.

verses.ar_he: וְחִבּוּל עַל מִית לָא תִתְּנוּן בְּבִסְרְכוֹן וְרוּשְׁמִין חֲרִיתִין לָא תִתְּנוּן בְכוֹן אֲנָא יְיָ
verses.ar_en: Gashes for the dead do not make in your skin. Do not put tattoo marks on yourselves, I am Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: לָא תַחֵל יָת בְּרַתָּךְ לְאַטְעֲיוּתַהּ וְלָא תִטְעֵי אַרְעָא וְתִתְמְלֵי אַרְעָא עֵצַת חִטְאִין
verses.ar_en: You shall not defile your daughter by causing her to engage in harlotry [err] lest the land be turned astray, and the land be filled with lewdness [a sinful plan].

verses.ar_he: יָת יוֹמֵי שַׁבַּיָא דִילִי תִּטְרוּן וּלְבֵית מַקְדְשִׁי תְּהוֹן דָחֲלִין אֲנָא יְיָ
verses.ar_en: You shall keep [the days of] My Shabbosos and you shall fear [the House of] My Sanctuary, I am Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: לָא תִתְפְּנוּן בָּתַר בִּדִין וּדְכוּרוּ לָא תִתְבְּעוּן לְאִסְתָּאָבָא בְהוֹן אֲנָא יְיָ אֱלָהָכוֹן
verses.ar_en: You shall not turn to mediums nor seek out oracles; do not seek [them] out, so as to defile yourselves through them. I am Adonoy, your God.

verses.ar_he: מִן קֳדָם דְסַבַּר בְּאוֹרַיְתָא תְּקוּם וּתְהַדַר אַפֵּי סָבָא וְתִדְחַל מֵאֳלָהָךְ אֲנָא יְיָ
verses.ar_en: In the presence of the elderly [one who understands the Torah] you shall rise and you shall respect an elder; you shall have fear of your God, I am Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲרֵי יִתְגַיַר עִמָךְ גִיוֹרָא בְּאַרְעֲכוֹן לָא תוֹנוּן יָתֵהּ
verses.ar_en: If a proselyte comes to live [converts] with you, in your land, do not cause him anguish.

verses.ar_he: כְּיַצִיבָא מִנְכוֹן יְהֵי לְכוֹן גִיוֹרָא דְיִתְגַיַר בֵּינֵיכוֹן וּתְרַחֵם לֵהּ כְּוָתָךְ אֲרֵי דַיָרִין הֲוֵיתוּן בְּאַרְעָא דְמִצְרָיִם אֲנָא יְיָ אֱלָהָכוֹן
verses.ar_en: As one of your native born [settled ones] he shall be considered by you, the proselyte who lives with [converts among] you, and you shall love him as yourself, for you were strangers [foreign resident] in the land of Egypt, I am Adonoy, your God.

verses.ar_he: לָא תַעְבְּדוּן שְׁקַר בְּדִין בִּמְשַׁחְתָּא בְּמַתְקְלָא וּבִמְכִלְתָּא
verses.ar_en: You shall not commit injustice [lie] in judgement; in [land] measure, in weight or in volume measure.

verses.ar_he: מֹאזְנָוָן דִקְשׁוֹט מַתְקְלָן דִקְשׁוֹט מְכִילָן דִקְשׁוֹט וְהִינִין דִקְשׁוֹט יְהוֹן לְכוֹן אֲנָא יְיָ אֱלָהָכוֹן דִי אֲפֵּקִית יָתְכוֹן מֵאַרְעָא דְמִצְרָיִם
verses.ar_en: Just scales and just weights a just dry measure (ephah) [just volume measures] and a just liquid measure (hin) [just hinin] you shall have for yourselves, I am Adonoy, your God who has taken you out of the land of Egypt.

verses.ar_he: וְתִטְרוּן יָת כָּל קְיָמַי וְיָת כָּל דִינַי וְתַעְבְּדוּן יָתְהוֹן אֲנָא יְיָ
verses.ar_en: You must keep all my statutes and all of my laws, and do [observe] them. I am Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וּמַלִיל יְיָ עִם מֹשֶׁה לְמֵימָר
verses.ar_en: Adonoy spoke to Moshe, saying:

verses.ar_he: וְלִבְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל תֵּימַר גְבַר גְבַר מִבְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וּמִן גִיוֹרָא דְיִתְגַיְרוּן בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל דִי יִתֵּן מִזַרְעֵהּ לְמוֹלֶךְ אִתְקְטָלָא יִתְקְטֵל עַמָא בֵית יִשְׂרָאֵל יִרְגְמֻנֵהּ בְּאַבְנָא
verses.ar_en: And to Bnei Yisrael you shall say: that each and every man of Bnei Yisroel and from the proselytes that reside [convert] in Israel, who will give any of his children to Molech, [that] he shall surely be put to death; the people of the land [House of Israel] shall stone him to death.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲנָא אֶתֵּן יָת רוּגְזִי בְגַבְרָא הַּהוּא וְאֱשֵׁיצֵי יָתֵהּ מִגוֹ עַמֵהּ אֲרֵי מִזַרְעֵהּ יְהַב לְמוֹלֶךְ בְּדִיל לְסָאָבָא יָת מַקְדְשִׁי וּלְאַחַלָא יָת שְׁמָא דְקוּדְשִׁי
verses.ar_en: I shall direct My wrath on that man and I shall cut him off from among his people, for he gave of his children to Molech, in order to defile My Sanctuary and profane My Holy Name.

verses.ar_he: וְאִם מִכְבַּשׁ יִכְבְּשׁוּן עַמָא בֵית יִשְׂרָאֵל יָת עֵינֵיהוֹן מִן גַבְרָא הַהוּא בִּדְיָהֵב מִזַרְעֵהּ לְמוֹלֶךְ בְּדִיל דְלָא לְקַטָלָא יָתֵהּ
verses.ar_en: If the people of the land [House of Israel] will hide their eyes from that person, when he gives of his children to Molech, and they do not put him to death.

verses.ar_he: וֶאֱשַׁוֵי אֲנָא יָת רוּגְזִי בְגַבְרָא הַהוּא וּבִסְעָדוֹהִי וֶאֱשֵׁיצֵי יָתֵהּ וְיָת כָּל דְטָעָן בַּתְרוֹהִי לְמִטְעֵי בָּתַר מוֹלֶךְ מִגוֹ עַמְהוֹן
verses.ar_en: I shall set My wrath against that man and his family [supporters]; I shall cut him off, along with all those who go astray after him to go astray after Molech, [they will be cut off] from among their people.

verses.ar_he: וֶאֱנַשׁ דִי יִתְפְּנֵי בָּתַר בִּדִין וּדְכוּרוּ לְמִטְעֵי בַתְרֵיהוֹן וְאֶתֵּן יָת רוּגְזִי בַּאֲנָשָׁא הַהִיא וֶאֱשֵׁיצֵי יָתֵהּ מִגוֹ עַמֵהּ
verses.ar_en: The person who turns to mediums and oracles to stray after them; I shall direct My wrath against that person and cut him off from among his people.

verses.ar_he: וְתִתְקַדְשׁוּן וּתְהוֹן קַדִישִׁין אֲרֵי אֲנָא יְיָ אֱלָהָכוֹן
verses.ar_en: You shall sanctify yourselves and be holy for I am Adonoy, your God.

verses.ar_he: וְתִטְּרוּן יָת קְיָמַי וְתַעְבְּדוּן יָתְהוֹן אֲנָא יְיָ מַקְדִשְׁכוֹן
verses.ar_en: You must keep My statutes and do [observe] them. I am Adonoy who sanctifies you.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי גְבַר גְבַר דִי יְלוּט יָת אֲבוּהִי וְיָת אִמֵהּ אִתְקְטָּלָא יִתְקְטֵל אֲבוּהִי וְאִמֵהּ לַטּ קְטָלָא חַיָב
verses.ar_en: Any man that curses his father or his mother shall surely be put to death. [Since] he has cursed his father or mother, his blood is on him [he is liable to the death penalty].

verses.ar_he: וּגְבַר דִי יְגוּף יָת אִתַּת גְבַר דִי יְגוּף יָת אִתַּת חַבְרֵהּ אִתְקְטָלָא יִתְקְטֵל גַיָפָא וְגַיַפְתָּא
verses.ar_en: A man who commits adultery with another mans wife who commits adultery with the wife of his fellow man—they shall surely be put to death—the adulterer and the adulteress.

verses.ar_he: וּגְבַר דִי יִשְׁכּוּב עִם אִתַּת אֲבוּהִי עֶרְיְתָא דַאֲבוּהִי גַלִי אִתְקַטָלָא יִתְקַטְלוּן תַּרְוֵיהוֹן קְטָלָא חַיָבִין
verses.ar_en: A man who will lie [conjugally] with his fathers wife has uncovered his fathers nakedness; they both shall surely be put to death, their blood is on them [they are liable to the death penalty].

verses.ar_he: וּגְבַר דִי יִשְׁכּוּב יָת כַּלָתֵהּ אִתְקְטָלָא יִתְקַטְלוּן תַּרְוֵיהוֹן תִּבְלָא עֲבָדוּ קְטָלָא חַיָבִין
verses.ar_en: A man who will lie [conjugally] with his daughter-in-law; they both shall surely be put to death they have committed an act of perversion, their blood is on them [they are liable to the death penalty].

verses.ar_he: וּגְבַר דִי יִשְׁכּוּב יָת דְכוּרָא מִשְׁכְּבֵי אִתְּתָא תּוֹעֶבְתָּא עֲבָדוּ תַּרְוֵיהוֹן אִתְקְטָלָא יִתְקַטְלוּן קְטָלָא חַיָבִין
verses.ar_en: A man who will lie [conjugally] with [another] man, in the same manner as with a woman; they both have committed an abominable act, they shall surely be put to death, their blood is on them [they are liable to the death penalty].

verses.ar_he: וּגְבַר דִי יִסַב יָת אִתְּתָא וְיָת אִמַהּ עֵצַת חִטְאִין הִיא בְּנוּרָא יוֹקְדוּן יָתֵהּ וְיָתְהֶן וְלָא תְהֵי עֵצַת חִטְאִין בֵּינֵיכוֹן
verses.ar_en: A man who marries a woman and her mother; it is lewdness [a sinful plan]. They shall be burned in fire, he and [one of] them, and there will no longer be such lewdness [a sinful plan] among you.

verses.ar_he: וּגְבַר דִי יִתֵּן שְׁכָבְתֵּהּ בִּבְעִירָא אִתְקְטָלָא יִתְקְטֵל וְיָת בְּעִירָא תִּקְטְלוּן
verses.ar_en: A man who lies [conjugally] with an animal shall surely be put to death, and you shall also kill the animal.

verses.ar_he: וְאִתְּתָא דִי תִקְרַב לְכָל בְּעִירָא לְמִשְׁלַט בַּהּ וְתִקְטוֹל יָת אִתְּתָא וְיָת בְּעִירָא אִתְקְטָלָא יִתְקַטְלוּן קְטָלָא חַיָבִין
verses.ar_en: A woman who presents herself to an animal causing it to copulate with her [control her]; you shall kill the woman and the animal. They shall surely be killed, their blood is on them [they are liable to the death penalty].

verses.ar_he: וּגְבַר דִי יִסַב יָת אֲחָתֵהּ בַּת אֲבוּהִי אוֹ בַת אִמֵהּ וְיֶחֱזֵי יָת עֶרְיְתַהּ וְהִיא תֶחֱזֵי יָת עֶרְיְתֵהּ קְלָנָא הוּא וְיִשְׁתֵּיצוּן לְעֵינֵי בְּנֵי עַמְהוֹן עֶרְיַת אֲחָתֵהּ גַלִי חוֹבֵהּ יְקַבֵּל
verses.ar_en: A man who marries his sister, either his fathers daughter or his mothers daughter, and he sees her nakedness and she sees his nakedness; it is a shameful perversion. They shall be cut off before their people he has uncovered the nakedness of his sister, he shall bear [the burden of] his iniquity.

verses.ar_he: וּגְבַר דִי יִשְׁכּוּב יָת אִתְּתָא סוֹאֲבָתָא וִיגַלֵי יָת עֶרְיְתַהּ יָת קְלָנַהּ גַלִי וְהִיא תְגַלֵי יָת סוֹאֲבַת דְמָהָא וְיִשְׁתֵּיצוּן תַּרְוֵיהוֹן מִגוֹ עַמְהוֹן
verses.ar_en: A man who will lie [conjugally] with a menstruating [an impure] woman and uncover her nakedness and uncover her source [womb] [shameful perversion] and she has uncovered the source [impurity] of her blood; they shall both be cut off from among their people.

verses.ar_he: וְעֶרְיַת אֲחַת אִמָךְ וַאֲחַת אָבוּךְ לָא תְגַלֵי אֲרֵי יָת קָרִיבֵהּ גַלִי חוֹבְהֶן יְקַבְּלוּן
verses.ar_en: The nakedness of your mothers sister and of your fathers sister, you shall not uncover, for the nakedness of his close kin he will have bared they shall bear [the burden of] their iniquity.

verses.ar_he: וּגְבַר דִי יִשְׁכּוּב יָת אִתַּת אַח אֲבוּהִי עֶרְיַת אַח אֲבוּהִי גַלִי חוֹבְהֶן יְקַבְּלּוּן בְּלָּא וְלָד יְמוּתוּן
verses.ar_en: A man who will lie [conjugally] with his aunt [father’s brother’s wife] has uncovered the nakedness of his uncle [father’s brother] they will bear [the burden of] their sin and they will die without children.

verses.ar_he: וּגְבַר דִי יִסַב יָת אִתַּת אֲחוּהִי מְרָחָקָא הִיא עֶרְיְתָא דַאֲחוּהִי גַלִי בְּלָא וְלָד יְהוֹן
verses.ar_en: A man who will marry his brothers wife who must be [conjugally] avoided [by him]; he has uncovered his brothers nakedness, they shall die without children.

verses.ar_he: וְתִטְרוּן יָת כָּל קְיָמַי וְיָת כָּל דִינַי וְתַעְבְּדוּן יָתְהוֹן וְלָא תְרוֹקֵן יָתְכוֹן אַרְעָא דִי אֲנָא מָעֵיל יָתְכוֹן תַּמָן לְמִתַּב בַּהּ
verses.ar_en: You shall keep all of My statutes and all of My laws and do (observe) them [so that] you will not be expelled by the land to which I am bringing you there to reside therein.

verses.ar_he: וְלָא תְהָכוּן בְּנִימוֹסֵי עַמְמַיָא דִי אֲנָא מַגְלֵי מִן קֳדָמֵיכוֹן אֲרֵי יָת כָּל אִלֵין עֲבָדוּ וְרָחִיק מֵימְרִי יָתְהוֹן
verses.ar_en: You shall not follow the customs of the nation which I am expelling before you. For they have done all these above mentioned sins and I became disgusted with [my Word distanced] them.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמָרִית לְכוֹן אַתּוּן תִּירְתוּן יָת אַרְעֲהוֹן וַאֲנָא אֶתְּנִנַהּ לְכוֹן לְמֵירַת יָתַהּ אַרְעָא עַבְדָא חַלָב וּדְבָשׁ אֲנָא יְיָ אֱלָהָכוֹן דִי אַפְרֵשִׁית יָתְכוֹן מִן עַמְמַיָא
verses.ar_en: And I have said to you [that] you shall inherit their land, and I shall give it to you that you may inherit it, a land flowing with [producing] milk and honey, I am Adonoy, your God who separated you from the [other] peoples.

verses.ar_he: וְתַפְרְשׁוּן בֵּין בְּעִירָא דַכְיָא לִמְסָאָבָא וּבֵין עוֹפָא מְסָאָבָא לִדְכֵי וְלָא תְשַׁקְצוּן יָת נַפְשָׁתֵיכוֹן בִּבְעִירָא וּבְעוֹפָא וּבְכֹל דִי תַרְחֵשׁ אַרְעָא דִי אַפְרֵשִׁית לְכוֹן לְסָאָבָא
verses.ar_en: You shall distinguish between a [ritually] clean animal and a unclean one, between the unclean fowl and the clean one. Do not make yourselves disgusting through the animals, fowl or through any creature that creeps on the ground which I have distinguished for you as being unclean.

verses.ar_he: וּתְהוֹן קֳדָמַי קַדִישִׁין אֲרֵי קַדִישׁ אֲנָא יְיָ וְאַפְרֵשִׁית יָתְכוֹן מִן עַמְמַיָא לְמֶהֱוֵי פָלְחִין קֳדָמַי
verses.ar_en: You shall be holy to [before] Me, for I, Adonoy, am holy and I have distinguished you from the [other] peoples to be Mine [and to serve Me] [be worshippers before Me].

verses.ar_he: וּגְבַר אוֹ אִתְּתָא אֲרֵי יְהֵי בְהוֹן בִּדִין אוֹ דְכוּרוּ אִתְקְטָלָא יִתְקַטְלוּן בְּאַבְנָא יִרְגְמוּן יָתְהוֹן קְטָלָא חַיָבִין
verses.ar_en: If among the men or women there will be a medium or an oracle they shall surely be put to death. You shall stone them to death, their blood is on them [they are liable to the death penalty].

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר יְיָ לְמֹשֶׁה אֱמַר לְכַהֲנַיָא בְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן וְתֵימַר לְהוֹן עַל מִית לָא יִסְתָּאַב בְּעַמֵהּ
verses.ar_en: Adonoy said to Moshe; speak, to the kohanim, the sons of Aharon, and you shall say to them, let him not defile himself with the dead among his people.

verses.ar_he: אֱלָהֵן לְקָרִיבֵהּ דְקָרִיב לֵהּ לְאִמֵהּ וְלַאֲבוּהִי וְלִבְרֵהּ וְלִבְרַתֵּהּ וְלַאֲחוּהִי
verses.ar_en: Except to his kin to whom he is closely related, for his mother and his father, for his son, his daughter and for his brother.

verses.ar_he: וְלַאֲחָתֵהּ בְּתֻלְתָּא דְקָרִיבָא לֵהּ דִי לָא הֲוַת לִגְבַר לַהּ יִסְתָּאָב
verses.ar_en: For his virgin sister, to whom he is closely related, who has not yet been married, for her, he may be defiled.

verses.ar_he: לָא יִסְתָּאַב רַבָּא בְעַמֵהּ לְאַחֲלוּתֵהּ
verses.ar_en: A husband [An honored one among his people] may not defile himself among his people [for a wife through whom] he becomes profaned.

verses.ar_he: לָא יִמְרְטוּן מְרַט בְּרֵישְׁהוֹן וּפָאתָא דְדִקְנְהוֹן לָא יְגַלְחוּן וּבְבִשְׂרְהוֹן לָא יְחַבְּלוּן חִבּוּל
verses.ar_en: They shall not make baldness on their heads and the corners of their beards they shall not shave, and they shall not make gashes in their flesh.

verses.ar_he: קַדִישִׁין יְהוֹן קֳדָם אֱלָהֲהוֹן וְלָא יְחַלוּן שְׁמָא דֶאֱלָהֲהוֹן אֲרֵי יָת קֻרְבָּנַיָא דַיְיָ קֻרְבַּן אֱלָהֲהוֹן אִנוּן מַקְרִיבִין וִיהוֹן קַדִישִׁין
verses.ar_en: They shall be holy to [before] their God and they shall not profane the Name of their God, for [it is] the fire-offerings [offerings] of Adonoy, the bread [sacrifice] of their God [that] they bring [offer], and they must [therefore] be holy.

verses.ar_he: אִתְּתָא מַטְעֲיָא וּמְחַלְלָא לָא יִסְבוּן וְאִתְּתָא דִמְתָרְכָא מִבַּעְלַהּ לָא יִסְבוּן אֲרֵי קַדִישׁ הוּא קֳדָם אֱלָהֵהּ
verses.ar_en: A harlot [One who strays] or a profaned woman they shall not marry. A woman divorced from her husband they shall not marry, for he is holy to [before] his God.

verses.ar_he: וּתְקַדְשִׁנֵהּ אֲרֵי יָת קֻרְבַּן אֱלָהָךְ הוּא מְקָרֵב קַדִישׁ יְהֵא לָךְ אֲרֵי קַדִישׁ אֲנָא יְיָ מְקַדִשְׁכוֹן
verses.ar_en: You shall make him holy for he offers the bread [sacrifice] of your God; he shall be holy unto you for I, Adonoy, am holy, Who makes you holy.

verses.ar_he: וּבַת גְבַר כָּהֵן אֲרֵי תִתְחַל לְמִטְעֵי מִקְדֻשַׁת אֲבוּהָ הִיא מִתַּחֲלָא בְּנוּרָא תִּתּוֹקָד
verses.ar_en: The daughter of a kohein, who profanes herself by fornication [straying]—she profanes her father—[she becomes profane with respect to her father’s holiness] she shall be burned with fire.

verses.ar_he: וְכַהֲנָא דְאִתְרַבָּא מֵאֲחוֹהִי דְיִתָּרִיק עַל רֵישֵׁהּ מִשְׁחָא דִרְבוּתָא וְדִי קָרִיב יָת קֻרְבָּנֵהּ לְמִלְבָּשׁ יָת לְבוּשַׁיָא יָת רֵישֵׁהּ לָא יְרַבֵּי פֵרוּעַ וּלְבוּשׁוֹהִי לָא יִבְזַע
verses.ar_en: The kohein who is greatest among his brethren upon whose head was poured the anointing oil [which inaugurates to greatness]; whose hands [sacrifices] were consecrated [offered] to put on the special garments; shall not let his hair grow wild and he shall not tear his garments.

verses.ar_he: וְעַל כָּל נַפְשַׁת מֵתָא לָא יֵיעוֹל לַאֲבוּהִי וּלְאִמֵהּ לָא יִסְתָּאָב
verses.ar_en: And adjacent to any dead body he shall not enter. For his father and mother he shall not become [ritually] impure.

verses.ar_he: וּמִן מַקְדְשָׁא לָא יִפּוֹק וְלָא יַחֵל יָת מַקְדְשָׁא דֶאֱלָהֵהּ אֲרֵי כְּלִיל מְשַׁח רְבוּתָא דֶאֱלָהֵהּ עֲלוֹהִי אֲנָא יְיָ
verses.ar_en: He shall not depart from the Sanctuary and he shall not profane his Gods Sanctuary, for the crown of his Gods anointing oil [which inaugurates to greatness] is upon him, I am Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וְהוּא אִתְּתָא בִבְתֻלְתָּהָא יִסָב
verses.ar_en: He shall marry [only] a virgin.

verses.ar_he: אַרְמְלָא וּמְתָרְכָא וְחַלִילָא מַטְעֲיָא יָת אִלֵין לָא יִסָב אֱלָהֵין בְּתֻלְתָּא מֵעַמֵהּ יִסַב אִתְּתָא
verses.ar_en: A widow, divorcee, profaned woman or harlot [one who strays]; he may not marry [any] of these. But only a virgin from his own people may he marry.

verses.ar_he: וְלָא יַחֵל זַרְעֵהּ בְּעַמֵהּ אֲרֵי אֲנָא יְיָ מְקַדְשֵׁהּ
verses.ar_en: He shall not profane his offspring among his people, for I am Adonoy, who makes him holy.

verses.ar_he: וּמַלִיל יְיָ עִם מֹשֶׁה לְמֵימָר
verses.ar_en: Adonoy spoke to Moshe, saying;

verses.ar_he: מַלֵל עִם אַהֲרֹן לְמֵימָר גְבַר מִבְּנָיִךְ לְדָרֵיהוֹן דִי יְהֵּי בֵהּ מוּמָא לָא יִקְרַב לְקָרָבָא קֻרְבָּנָא קֳדָם אֱלָהֵהּ
verses.ar_en: Speak to Aharon saying; Anyone of your offspring, through [all] their generations who will have a blemish, shall not approach to offer the bread [sacrifice] of [before] his God.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי כָל גְבַר דִּי בֵהּ מוּמָא לָא יִקְרַב גְבַר עַוִיר אוֹ חֲגִיר אוֹ חָרִים אוֹ שָׂרִיע
verses.ar_en: For any man who has a blemish shall not approach; a blind man or a lame man, or a man with a sunken nose, or a man who has disproportionate limbs.

verses.ar_he: אוֹ גְבַר דִי יְהֵי בֵהּ תְּבַר רַגְלָא אוֹ תְּבַר יְדָא
verses.ar_en: or a man who has a broken (crippled) foot, or a broken (crippled) hand,

verses.ar_he: אוֹ גְבִין אוֹ דֻקָא אוֹ חִלִיז בְּעֵינֵהּ אוֹ גַרְבָן אוֹ חֲזָזָן אוֹ מְרִיס פַּחֲדִין
verses.ar_en: or one with overhanging eyebrows, or with a cataract, or a disarrangement [in the eye], or one with scurf or scabs, or one with crushed testicles.

verses.ar_he: כָּל גְבַר דִי בֵהּ מוּמָא מִזַרְעָא דְאַהֲרֹן כַּהֲנָא לָא יִקְרַב לְקָרָבָא יָת קֻרְבָּנַיָא דַיְיָ מוּמָא בֵהּ יָת קֻרְבַּן אֱלָהֵהּ לָא יִקְרַב לְקָרָבָא
verses.ar_en: Any man who has a blemish, who is a descendant of Aharon the kohein, shall not approach to offer the fire-offerings [offerings] of Adonoy. He has a blemish; the bread [sacrifice] of his God he may not approach to offer [as an offering].

verses.ar_he: קֻרְבַּן אֱלָהֵהּ מִקֹדֶשׁ קוּדְשַׁיָא וּמִן קוּדְשַׁיָא יֵיכוּל
verses.ar_en: The bread of his God which is of the most holy, and from the holy [offerings] he may eat.

verses.ar_he: בְּרַם לְפָרֻכְתָּא לָא יֵיעוֹל וּלְמַדְבְּחָא לָא יִקְרַב אֲרֵי מוּמָא בֵהּ וְלָא יַחֵל יָת מַקְדְשַׁי אֲרֵי אֲנָא יְיָ מְקַדִשְׁהוֹן
verses.ar_en: However, he may not enter beyond the Curtain and he shall not approach the Altar for he has a blemish and he shall not profane My holy things, for I am Adonoy, who sanctifies them.

verses.ar_he: וּמַלִיל מֹשֶׁה עִם אַהֲרֹן וְעִם בְּנוֹהִי וְעִם כָּל בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל
verses.ar_en: Moshe spoke [these words] to Aharon, and to his sons and to all of Bnei Yisroel.

verses.ar_he: וּמַלִיל יְיָ עִם מֹשֶׁה לְמֵימָר
verses.ar_en: Adonoy spoke to Moshe, saying;

verses.ar_he: מַלֵיל עִם אַהֲרֹן וְעִם בְּנוֹהִי וְיִפָּרְשׁוּן מִקוּדְשַׁיָא דִבְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וְלָא יְחַלוּן יָת שְׁמָא דְקוּדְשִׁי דִי אִנוּן מְקַדְשִׁין קֳדָמַי אֲנָא יְיָ
verses.ar_en: Speak to Aharon and to his sons and let them keep away from the holy offerings of Bnei Yisroel and they shall not profane My holy name which they sanctify for [before] Me, I am Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: אֱמַר לְהוֹן לְדָרֵיכוֹן כָּל גְבַר דִי יִקְרַב מִכָּל בְּנֵיכוֹן לְקוּדְשַׁיָא דִי יְקַדְשׁוּן בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל קֳדָם יְיָ וְסֹאבְתֵיהּ עֲלוֹהִי וְיִשְׁתֵּיצֵי אֲנָשָׁא הַהִיא מִן קֳדָמַי אֲנָא יְיָ
verses.ar_en: Say to them; throughout your generations; any person of your offspring who will draw near to the holy things which Bnei Yisroel will sanctify to [before] Adonoy [while] his impurity is on him that soul [person] shall be cut off from My Presence, I am Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: גְבַר גְבַר מִזַרְעָא דְאַהֲרֹן וְהוּא סְגִיר אוֹ דָאִיב בְּקוּדְשַׁיָא לָא יֵיכוּל עַד דִי יִדְכֵּי וּדְיִקְרַב בְּכָל טְמֵא נַפְשָׁא אוֹ גְבַר דִי תִפּוֹק מִנֵהּ שִׁכְבַת זַרְעָא
verses.ar_en: Any man of Aharons offspring; who has tzoraas [the plague of ’confinement’] or an impure flow, may not eat of the sacred things until he has purified himself. [The same is true] of anyone who touches anything defiled by the dead [soul], or anyone who has had a seminal emission,

verses.ar_he: אוֹ גְבַר דִי יִקְרַב בְּכָל רִחֲשָׁא דִי יִסְתָּאַב לֵהּ אוֹ בַאֲנָשָׁא דִי יִסְתָּאַב לֵהּ לְכָל סֹאבְתֵיהּ
verses.ar_en: or anyone who touches any creeping creature that causes impurity to him, or any person which causes impurity to him, [with] whatever impurity he has.

verses.ar_he: אֱנַשׁ דִי יִקְרַב בֵּהּ וִיהֵי מְסָאָב עַד רַמְשָׁא וְלָא יֵיכוּל מִן קוּדְשַׁיָא אֱלָהֵן אַסְחֵי בִשׂרֵהּ בְּמַיָא
verses.ar_en: Anyone touching [that person] will be impure until the evening. He shall not eat of the holy things unless he has washed his body in water.

verses.ar_he: וּבְמֵעַל שִׁמְשָׁא וְיִדְכֵּי וּבָתַר כֵּן יֵיכוּל מִן קוּדְשַׁיָא אֲרֵי לַחְמֵהּ הוּא
verses.ar_en: When the sun sets, he is pure, and afterwards, he may eat of the holy things, for it is his bread.

verses.ar_he: נְבִילָא וּתְבִירָא לָא יֵיכוּל לְאִסְתָּאָבָא בָהּ אֲנָא יְיָ
verses.ar_en: An animal which has died on its own, or an animal that was fatally maimed, he must not eat to defile himself with it, I am Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וְיִטְרוּן יָת מַטְּרַת מֵימְרִי וְלָא יְקַבְּלוּן עֲלוֹהִי חוֹבָא וִימוּתוּן בֵּהּ אֲרֵי יְחַלֻנֵהּ אֲנָא יְיָ מְקַדִשְׁהוֹן
verses.ar_en: They shall keep my charge [the charge of My Word] lest they bear [the burden] of sin and die because of it for having profaned [it]. I am Adonoy Who makes them holy.

verses.ar_he: וְכָל חִלוֹנַי לָא יֵיכוּל קוּדְשָׁא תּוֹתָבָא דְכַהֲנָא וַאֲגִירָא לָא יֵיכוּל קוּדְשָׁא
verses.ar_en: No stranger (non-kohein) may eat holy things. One indentured to a kohein and one hired [by a kohein] may not eat sacred-offerings.

verses.ar_he: וְכָהֵן אֲרֵי יִקְנֵי נְפַשׁ קִנְיַן כַּסְפֵּהּ הוּא יֵיכוּל בֵּהּ וִילִיד בֵּיתֵהּ אִנוּן יֵיכְלוּן בְּלַחְמֵהּ
verses.ar_en: If a kohein shall purchase a person [as a slave, that person is] his monetary possession. He may eat of it, and the [slave] born in his house, they may eat of his bread.

verses.ar_he: וּבַת כָּהֵן אֲרֵי תְהִי לִגְבַר חִלוֹנָי הִיא בְּאַפְרָשׁוּת קוּדְשַׁיָא לָא תֵיכוּל
verses.ar_en: When a koheins daughter marries a non-kohein, the sacred terumah [separated] portions may not be eaten by her.

verses.ar_he: וּבַת כָּהֵן אֲרֵי תְהֵי אַרְמְלָא וּמְתָרְכָא וּבַר לֵית לַהּ וּתְתוּב לְבֵית אֲבוּהָא כְּרַבְיוּתָהָא מִלַחְמָא דַאֲבוּהָא תֵּיכוּל וְכָל חִלוֹנַי לָא יֵיכוּל בֵּהּ
verses.ar_en: If a koheins daughter is either widowed or divorced, and she has no children, and she returns to her fathers home as in her youth, she may eat of her fathers bread. No non-kohein may eat of it.

verses.ar_he: וּגְבַר אֲרֵי יֵיכוּל קוּדְשָׁא בְּשָׁלוּ וְיוֹסֵף חוּמְשֵׁהּ עֲלוֹהִי וְיִתֵּן לְכַהֲנָא יָת קוּדְשָׁא
verses.ar_en: If a man inadvertently eats of sacred-offering, he shall add a fifth, to it[s worth] and give to the kohein the holy thing.

verses.ar_he: וְלָא יְחַלוּן יָת קוּדְשַׁיָא דִבְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל יָת דִי יַפְרְשׁוּן קֳדָם יְיָ
verses.ar_en: They shall not profane the holy things of Bnei Yisroel that which they designated for [before] Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וִיקַבְּלוּן עֲלֵיהוֹן עֲוָיָן וְחוֹבִין בְּמֵיכָלְהוֹן בְּסוֹאֲבָא יָת קוּדְשֵׁיהוֹן אֲרֵי אֲנָא יְיָ מְקַדִשְׁהוֹן
verses.ar_en: They burden them[selves] with the sin of their guilt when they eat their holy things [in impurity], for I am Adonoy, Who makes them holy.

verses.ar_he: וּמַלִיל יְיָ עִם מֹשֶׁה לְמֵימָר
verses.ar_en: Adonoy spoke to Moshe, saying;

verses.ar_he: מַלֵל עִם אַהֲרֹן וְעִם בְּנוֹהִי וְעִם כָּל בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וְתֵימַר לְהוֹן גְבַר גְבַר מִבֵּית יִשְׂרָאֵל וּמִן גִיוֹרָא בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל דִי יְקָרֵב קֻרְבָּנֵהּ לְכָל נִדְרֵיהוֹן וּלְכָל נִדְבָתְהוֹן דִי יְקָרְבוּן קֳדָם יְיָ לַעֲלָתָא
verses.ar_en: Speak to Aharon and to his sons and to all of Bnei Yisroel and say to them; any man of the House of Israel, and from the proselytes of Israel who will bring his offering for any of their vows or for any of their free-will-offerings that they will bring to [before] Adonoy, for a burnt-offering.

verses.ar_he: לְרַעֲוָא לְכוֹן שְׁלִים דְכוּרָא בְּתוֹרֵי בְּאִמְרַיָא וּבְעִזַיָא
verses.ar_en: To gain acceptance [it must be] an unblemished male of cattle, sheep or goats.

verses.ar_he: כֹּל דִי בֵהּ מוּמָא לָא תְקָרְבוּן אֲרֵי לָא לְרַעֲוָא יְהֵי לְכוֹן
verses.ar_en: Anything that has a blemish on it you shall not bring, for it will not be accepted favorably for you.

verses.ar_he: וּגְבַר אֲרֵי יְקָרֵב נִכְסַת קוּדְשַׁיָא קֳדָם יְיָ לְפָרָשָׁא נִדְרָא אוֹ לִנְדַבְתָּא בְּתוֹרֵי אוֹ בְעָנָא שְׁלִים יְהֵי לְרַעֲוָא כָּל מוּמָא לָא יְהֵי בֵהּ
verses.ar_en: If a man will bring a peace[sacred]-offering to [before] Adonoy, to fulfill an articulated vow or free-will-offering of cattle or of sheep, it shall be unblemished, that it be favorably accepted. No blemish shall be in it.

verses.ar_he: עַוִיר אוֹ תְבִיר אוֹ פְסִיק אוֹ יַבְּלָן אוֹ גַרְבָן אוֹ חֲזָזָן לָא תְקָרְבוּן אִלֵין קֳדָם יְיָ וְקֻרְבָּנָא לָא תִתְּנוּן מִנְהוֹן עַל מַדְבְּחָא קֳדָם יְיָ
verses.ar_en: A blind, broken-limbed, cracked or wart[ed animal]; or [an animal] with scurf or scabs you shall not bring these to [before] Adonoy; and as a fire-offering [an offering] you shall not place of them on the altar of [before] Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וְתוֹר וְאִמַר יַתִּיר וְחַסִיר נְדַבְתָּא תַּעְבֵּד יָתֵהּ וּלְנִדְרָא לָא יְהֵי לְרַעֲוָא
verses.ar_en: An ox or lamb with one limb larger [or smaller] than the other or with uncleft hooves [one limb smaller than the other], you shall make (offer) it as a free-will-offering [to the temple treasury] [but] for [the fulfillment of] a vow it will not be favorably accepted.

verses.ar_he: וְדִי מְרִיס וְדִי רְסִיס וְדִי שְׁלִיף וְדִי גְזִיר לָא תְקָרְבוּן קֳדָם יְיָ וּבְאַרְעֲכוֹן לָא תַעְבְּדוּן
verses.ar_en: [An animal that has its testicles] crushed, mangled, torn or cut off you shall not bring to [before] Adonoy and in your land you shall not inflict these injuries.

verses.ar_he: וּמִן בַּר עַמְמִין לָא תְקַרְבוּן יָת קֻרְבַּן אֱלָהֲכוֹן מִכָּל אִלֵין אֲרֵי חִבּוּלְהוֹן בְּהוֹן מוּמָא בְהוֹן לָא לְרַעֲוָא יְהוֹן לְכוֹן
verses.ar_en: And from a strangers [gentiles] hand you shall not bring (offer) the bread [offering] of your God from any of these for they have inflicted wounds in them; they will not be favorably accepted for you.

verses.ar_he: וּמַלִיל יְיָ עִם מֹשֶׁה לְמֵימָר
verses.ar_en: Adonoy spoke to Moshe, saying;

verses.ar_he: תּוֹר אוֹ אִמָר אוֹ עִזָא אֲרֵי יִתְיְלִיד וִיהֵי שִׁבְעָא יוֹמִין בָּתַר אִמֵהּ וּמִיוֹמָא תְמִינָאָה וּלְהַלָא יִתִּרְעִי לְקָרָבָא קֻרְבָּנָא קֳדָם יְיָ
verses.ar_en: An ox, lamb or goat, when it is born, shall be with its mother for seven days. From the eighth day and thereafter it may be favorably accepted as a sacrifice as a fire-offering to [an offering before] Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וְתוֹרְתָּא אוֹ שֵׂיתָא לֵהּ וְלִבְרֵהּ לָא תִכְּסוּן בְּיוֹמָא חָד
verses.ar_en: An ox [cow] or a [female] lamb, it and its [her and her] offspring, you shall not slaughter in one day.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲרֵי תִּכְּסוּן נִכְסַת תּוֹדְתָא קֳדָם יְיָ לְרַעֲוָא לְכוֹן תִּכְּסֻנֵהּ
verses.ar_en: When you sacrifice a thanks-giving-offering to [before] Adonoy, that it be favorably accepted for you you shall sacrifice it.

verses.ar_he: בְּיוֹמָא הַהוּא יִתְאֲכֵל לָא תַשְׁאֲרוּן מִנֵהּ עַד צַפְרָא אֲנָא יְיָ
verses.ar_en: On that day [that it is sacrificed] you should eat it; you shall leave none of it until the next morning, I am Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וְתִטְרוּן פִּקוּדַי וְתַעֲבְּדוּן יָתְהוֹן אֲנָא יְיָ
verses.ar_en: You shall preserve My commandments and fulfill them, I am Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וְלָא תְחַלְלוּן יָת שְׁמָא דְקוּדְשַׁי וְאִתְקַדַשׁ בְּגוֹ בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל אֲנָא יְיָ מְקַדִשְּׁכוֹן
verses.ar_en: You shall not profane My holy Name; but I will be sanctified among Bnei Yisroel. I am Adonoy Who makes you holy.

verses.ar_he: דְאַפִּיק יָתְכוֹן מֵאַרְעָא דְמִצְרַיִם לְמֶהֱוֵי לְכוֹן לֵאלָהָא אֲנָא יְיָ
verses.ar_en: Who brought you out of the land of Egypt to be your God, I am Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וּמַלִיל יְיָ עִם מֹשֶׁה לְמֵימָר
verses.ar_en: Adonoy spoke to Moshe, saying;

verses.ar_he: מַלֵיל עִם בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וְתֵימַר לְהוֹן מוֹעֲדַיָא דַיְיָ דִי תְעָרְעוּן יָתְהוֹן מְעָרְעֵי קַדִישׁ אִלֵין אִנוּן מוֹעֲדָי
verses.ar_en: Speak to Bnei Yisroel and say to them; the appointed times of Adonoy, which you shall proclaim [cause] them [to occur] as holy assemblies [occurrences]; these are My appointed times.

verses.ar_he: שִׁתָּא יוֹמִין תִּתְעֲבֵד עִבִידָא וּבְיוֹמָא שְׁבִיעָאָה שְׁבַת שְׁבָתָא מְעָרַע קַדִישׁ כָּל עִבִידָא לָא תַעֲבְּדוּן שַׁבְּתָא הִיא קֳדָם יְיָ בְּכֹל מוֹתְבָנֵיכוֹן
verses.ar_en: Six days shall work be performed; and on the seventh day is a Shabbos of resting, a holy assembly [occurrence]. You shall not do any work, it is a Shabbos for [before] Adonoy in all your dwelling places.

verses.ar_he: אִלֵין מוֹעֲדַיָא דַיְיָ מְעָרְעֵי קַדִישׁ דִי תְעָרְעוּן יָתְהוֹן בְּזִמְנֵיהוֹן
verses.ar_en: These are the appointed times of Adonoy, the holy assemblies [occurrences] that you shall proclaim [cause] them [to occur] in their appointed times.

verses.ar_he: בְּיַרְחָא קַדְמָאָה בְּאַרְבְּעַת עַשְׂרָא לְיַרְחָא בֵּין שִׁמְשַׁיָא פִּסְחָא קֳדָם יְיָ
verses.ar_en: In the first month (Nisan), on the fourteenth day of the month in the afternoon, is a Pesach (offering) for [before] Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וּבְחַמְשַׁת עַשְׂרָא יוֹמָא לְיַרְחָא הָדֵין חַגָא דְפַטִירַיָא קֳדָם יְיָ שִׁבְעָא יוֹמִין פַּטִיר תֵּיכְלוּן
verses.ar_en: On the fifteenth day of this month is the festival of matzos, for [before] Adonoy; for seven days you shall eat matzos [matzoh].

verses.ar_he: בְּיוֹמָא קַדְמָאָה מְעָרַע קַדִישׁ יְהֵי לְכוֹן כָּל עִבִידַת פָּלְחַן לָא תַעֲבְּדוּן
verses.ar_en: On the first day [there] shall be a day of holy assembly [occurrence] for you; you shall not do any work of labor.

verses.ar_he: וּתְקָרְבוּן קֻרְבָּנָא קֳדָם יְיָ שִׁבְעָא יוֹמִין בְּיוֹמָא שְׁבִיעָאָה מְעָרַע קַדִישׁ כָּל עִבִידַת פָּלְחָן לָא תַעֲבְּדוּן
verses.ar_en: You shall bring a fire-offering to [an offering before] Adonoy [on each of] seven days. On the seventh day it is [a day] of holy assembly [occurrence]; you shall not do any work of labor.

verses.ar_he: וּמַלִיל יְיָ עִם מֹשֶׁה לְמֵימָר
verses.ar_en: Adonoy spoke to Moshe, saying,

verses.ar_he: מַלֵיל עִם בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וְתֵימַר לְהוֹן אֲרֵי תֵעֲלוּן לְאַרְעָא דִי אֲנָא יָהֵב לְכוֹן וְתַחְצְדוּן יָת חֲצָדַהּ וְתַיְתוּן יָת עוּמְרָא רֵישׁ חֲצָדְכוֹן לְוָת כַּהֲנָא
verses.ar_en: Speak to Bnei Yisroel and say to them; when you come into the land that I give to you and you reap its harvest, you shall bring an omer of the first fruits of your harvest to the kohein.

verses.ar_he: וִירִים יָת עוּמְרָא קֳדָם יְיָ לְרַעֲוָא לְכוֹן מִבָּתַר יוֹמָא טָבָא יְרִימִנֵהּ כַּהֲנָא
verses.ar_en: He shall wave [lift up] the omer before Adonoy that it be favorably accepted for you. On the day after the day of rest (Pesach), the kohein shall wave [lift] it [up].

verses.ar_he: וְתַעֲבְּדוּן בְּיוֹמָא דַאֲרָמוּתְכוֹן יָת עוּמְרָא אִמַר שְׁלִים בַּר שַׁתֵּהּ לַעֲלָתָא קֳדָם יְיָ
verses.ar_en: You shall prepare, on the day when you wave [lift] the omer, an unblemished, male, yearling lamb as a burnt-offering, to [before] Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וּמִנְחָתֵהּ תְּרֵין עֶשְׂרוֹנִין סֻלְתָּא דְפִילָא בִמְשַׁח קֻרְבָּנָא קֳדָם יְיָ לְאִתְקַבָּלָא בְרַעֲוָא וְנִסְכֵּהּ חַמְרָא רַבְעוּת הִינָא
verses.ar_en: Its meal-offering is two tenths of flour mixed with [olive] oil as a fire-offering to [an offering before] Adonoy of pleasing fragrance [to be accepted with favor]. Its wine-offering is one fourth of a hin.

verses.ar_he: וּלְחֵם וּקְלִי וּפֵרוּכָן לָא תֵיכְלוּן עַד כְּרַן יוֹמָא הָדֵין עַד אַיְתוֹאֵיכוֹן יָת קֻרְבָּן אֱלָהָכוֹן קְיַם עָלָם לְדָרֵיכוֹן בְּכֹל מוֹתְבָנֵיכוֹן
verses.ar_en: Bread, parched grain or tender [ground] grain you shall not eat until this very day, until you bring the offering of your God; it is an everlasting statute for all your generations in all your dwelling places.

verses.ar_he: וְתִמְנוּן לְכוֹן מִבָּתַר יוֹמָא טָּבָא מִיוֹם אַיְתוֹאֵיכוֹן יָת עוּמְרָא דַאֲרָמוּתָא שִׁבְעָא שָׁבוּעִין שַּׁלְמִין יְהֶוְיָן (נ''א תְּהֶוְיָן)
verses.ar_en: You shall count for yourselves, from the day after the day of rest (Pesach) from the day on which you will bring the omer waveuplifted-offering, seven complete weeks they shall be,

verses.ar_he: עַד מִבָּתַר שְׁבוּעֲתָא שְׁבִיעֵתָא תִּמְנוּן חַמְשִׁין יוֹמִין וּתְקַרְבוּן מִנְחָתָא חֲדַתָּא קֳדָם יְיָ
verses.ar_en: Until the day after the seventh week, you shall count fifty days, and you shall bring a new meal-offering to [before] Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: מִמוֹתְבָנֵיכוֹן תַּיְתוּן לְחֵם אֲרָמוּתָא תַּרְתֵּין (גְרִיצַן) תְּרֵין עֶשְׂרוֹנִין סֻלְתָּא יְהֶוְיָן חֲמִיעַ יִתְאַפְיָן בִּכּוּרִין קֳדָם יְיָ
verses.ar_en: From [the land of] your dwelling places you shall bring two bread wave[uplifted]-offerings; of two tenths of flour they shall be. You shall bake them leavened, as first-fruit-offering to [before] Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וּתְקָרְבוּן עַל לַחְמָא שִׁבְעָא אִמְרִין שַׁלְמִין בְּנֵי שְׁנָא וְתוֹר בַּר תּוֹרֵי חַד וְדִכְרִין תְּרֵין יְהוֹן עֲלָתָא קֳדָם יְיָ וּמִנְחָתְהוֹן וְנִסְכֵּיהוֹן קֻרְבַּן דְמִתְקַבֵּל בְּרַעֲוָא קֳדָם יְיָ
verses.ar_en: You shall bring, along with the bread, seven unblemished, yearling lambs, one young bullock and two rams; they shall be a burnt-offering to [before] Adonoy with their meal-offerings and wine-offerings, a fire-offering of pleasing fragrance to [an offering which is accepted with favor before] Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וְתַעְבְּדוּן צְפִיר בַּר עִזֵי חַד לְחַטָאתָא וּתְרֵין אִמְרִין בְּנֵי שְׁנָא לְנִכְסַת קוּדְשַׁיָא
verses.ar_en: You shall prepare one he-goat as a sin-offering and two yearling lambs as peace[sacred]-offerings.

verses.ar_he: וִירִים כַּהֲנָא יָתְהוֹן עַל לְחֵם בִּכּוּרַיָא אֲרָמוּתָא קֳדָם יְיָ עַל תְּרֵין אִמְרִין קוּדְשָׁא יְהוֹן קֳדָם יְיָ לְכַהֲנָא
verses.ar_en: The kohein shall wave [lift] them [up] along with the bread of the first-fruit-offering as a wave-offering [an uplifted-offering] before Adonoy with the two lambs; they shall be holy for [before] Adonoy, for the kohein.

verses.ar_he: וּתְעָרְעוּן בִּכְרַן יוֹמָא הָדֵין מְעָרַע קַדִישׁ יְהֵי לְכוֹן כָּל עִבִידַת פָּלְחָן לָא תַעֲבְּדוּן קְיַם עָלָם בְּכָל מוֹתְבָנֵיכוֹן לְדָרֵיכוֹן
verses.ar_en: You shall proclaim [cause to occur] on this very day; it shall be a [day of] holy assembly [occurrence] for you you shall not do any work of labor. It is an everlasting statute in all your dwelling places throughout your generations.

verses.ar_he: וּבְמֶחֱצָדְכוֹן יָת חֲצָדָא דְאַרְעֲכוֹן לָא תְשֵׁיצֵי פָּאתָא דְחַקְלָךְ בְּמֶחֱצָדָךְ וּלְקָטָא דַחֲצָדָךְ לָא תְלַקֵט לְעַנְיֵי וּלְגִיוֹרֵי תִּשְׁבּוֹק יָתְהוֹן אֲנָא יְיָ אֱלָהֲכוֹן
verses.ar_en: When you reap the harvest of your land, you shall not cut completely the corner of your field when you reap. You shall not gather the gleaning of your harvest. You shall leave them for the poor and the proselyte, I am Adonoy, your God.

verses.ar_he: וּמַלִיל יְיָ עִם מֹשֶׁה לְמֵימָר
verses.ar_en: Adonoy spoke to Moshe, saying;

verses.ar_he: מַלֵיל עִם בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל לְמֵימָר בְּיַרְחָא שְׁבִיעָאָה בְּחַד לְיַרְחָא יְהֵי לְכוֹן נְיָחָא דוּכְרָן יַבָּבָא מְעָרַע קַדִישׁ
verses.ar_en: Speak to Bnei Yisroel, saying; in the seventh month, on the first of the month, shall be for you a [day of] rest. A remembrance of the sounding [crying] [of the shofor], a holy assembly [occurrence].

verses.ar_he: כָּל עִבִידַת פָלְחָנָא לָא תַעֲבְּדוּן וּתְקָרְבוּן קֻרְבָּנָא קֳדָם יְיָ
verses.ar_en: You shall not do any work of labor and you shall bring a fire-offering to [an offering before] Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וּמַלִיל יְיָ עִם מֹשֶׁה לְמֵימָר
verses.ar_en: Adonoy spoke to Moshe, saying;

verses.ar_he: בְּרַם בְּעַשְׂרָא לְיַרְחָא שְׁבִיעָאָה הָדֵין יוֹמָא דְכִפּוּרַיָא הוּא מְעָרַע קַדִישׁ יְהֵי לְכוֹן וּתְעַנוּן יָת נַפְשָׁתֵיכוֹן וּתְקָרְבוּן קֻרְבָּנָא קֳדָם יְיָ
verses.ar_en: Indeed, on the tenth day of this seventh month is a day of atonement. It shall be for you a [day of] holy assembly [occurrence] and you shall afflict yourselves and you shall bring a fire-offering to [an offering before] Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וְכָל עִבִידָא לָא תַעֲבְּדוּן בִּכְרַן יוֹמָא הָדֵין אֲרֵי יוֹמָא דְכִפּוּרַיָא הוּא לְכַפָּרָא עֲלֵיכוֹן קֳדָם יְיָ אֱלָהֲכוֹן
verses.ar_en: You shall not do any work on this very day, for it is a day of atonements, to atone for you before Adonoy, your God.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי כָל אֲנָשָׁא דִי לָא מִתְעַנֵי בִּכְרַן יוֹמָא הָדֵין וְיִשְׁתֵּיצֵי מֵעַמָהָא
verses.ar_en: For any person who will not be afflicted on this very day shall be cut off from his people.

verses.ar_he: וְכָל אֱנַשׁ דִי תַעְבֵּד כָּל עִבִידָא בִּכְרַן יוֹמָא הָדֵין וְאוֹבֵד יָת אֲנָשָׁא הַהִיא מִגוֹ עַמָהּ
verses.ar_en: Any person who does any work on this very day, I will cause that person to perish from among his people.

verses.ar_he: כָּל עִבִידָא לָא תַעֲבְּדוּן קְיַם עָלָם לְדָרֵיכוֹן בְּכֹל מוֹתְבָנֵיכוֹן
verses.ar_en: You shall not do any work; it is an everlasting statute for all your generations in all your dwelling places.

verses.ar_he: שְׁבַת שְׁבָתָא הוּא לְכוֹן וּתְעַנוּן יָת נַפְשָׁתֵיכוֹן בְּתִשְׁעָה לְיַרְחָא בְּרַמְשָׁא מֵרַמְשָׁא עַד רַמְשָׁא תְּנוּחוּן נְיַחֲכוֹן
verses.ar_en: It is a Shabbos of complete rest for you and you shall afflict yourselves on the ninth day of the month at evening; from evening to evening you shall rest, on your day of rest.

verses.ar_he: וּמַלִיל יְיָ עִם מֹשֶׁה לְמֵימָר
verses.ar_en: Adonoy spoke to Moshe, saying;

verses.ar_he: מַלֵיל עִם בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל לְמֵימָר בְּחַמְשָׁא עַשְׂרָא יוֹמָא לְיַרְחָא שְׁבִיעָאָה הָדֵין חַגָא דִמְטַלַיָא שִׁבְעַת יוֹמִין קֳדָם יְיָ
verses.ar_en: Speak to Bnei Yisroel saying; on the fifteenth day of this seventh month is the festival of [shelters] Sukkos for seven days, for [before] Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: בְּיּוֹמָא קַדְמָאָה מְעָרַע קַדִישׁ כָּל עִבִידַת פָּלְחָן לָא תַעֲבְּדוּן
verses.ar_en: On the first day [there shall be] a holy assembly [occurrence]; you shall not do any work of labor.

verses.ar_he: שִׁבְעָא יוֹמִין תְּקָרְבוּן קֻרְבָּנָא קֳדָם יְיָ בְּיוֹמָא תְמִינָאָה מְעָרַע קַדִישׁ יְהֵי לְכוֹן וּתְקָרְבוּן קֻרְבָּנָא קֳדָם יְיָ כְּנֵשׁ תְּהוֹן כָּל עִבִידַת פָּלְחַן לָא תַעֲבְּדוּן
verses.ar_en: For seven days, you shall bring a fire-offering to [an offering before] Adonoy; the eighth day shall be for you a holy assembly [occurrence], and you shall bring a fire-offering to [an offering before] Adonoy. It is [a day] of convocation. you shall not do any work of labor.

verses.ar_he: אִלֵין מוֹעֲדַיָא דַיְיָ דִי תְעָרְעוּן יָתְהוֹן מְעָרְעֵי קַדִישׁ לְקָרָבָא קֻרְבָּנָא קֳדָם יְיָ עֲלָתָא וּמִנְחָתָא נִכְסַת קוּדְשִׁין וְנִסוּכִין פִּתְגַם יוֹם בְּיוֹמֵהּ
verses.ar_en: These are the appointed times of Adonoy which you shall proclaim [cause] them [to occur] [as] holy assemblies [occurrences], on which to bring a fire-offering to [an offering before] Adonoy; a burnt-offering and a meal-offering, a [sacred-]sacrifice and wine-offerings, each on its assigned day,

verses.ar_he: בַּר שַׁבַּיָא דַיְיָ וּבַר מַתְּנָתֵיכוֹן וּבַר כָּל נִדְרֵיכוֹן וּבַר כָּל נִדְבָתֵיכוֹן דִי תִתְּנוּן קֳדָם יְיָ
verses.ar_en: Besides the [offerings of the] Shabbasos of Adonoy and besides your gifts and besides all your vow-offerings and besides all your free-will-offerings that you will give to [before] Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: בְּרַם בְּחַמְשָׁא עֲשַׂר יוֹמָא לְיַרְחָא שְׁבִיעָאָה בְּמִכְנְשֵׁיכוֹן יָת עֲלַלַת אַרְעָא תְּחַגוּן יָת חַגָא קֳדָם יְיָ שִׁבְעָא יוֹמִין בְּיוֹמָא קַדְמָאָה נְיָחָא וּבְיוֹמָא תְמִינָאָה נְיָחָא
verses.ar_en: Indeed, on the fifteenth day of the seventh month, when you gather the produce of the land you shall celebrate the festival of [before] Adonoy for seven days. The first day is a day of rest and the eighth day is a day of rest.

verses.ar_he: וְתִסְבוּן לְכוֹן בְּיוֹמָא קַדְמָאָה פֵּרֵי אִילָנָא אֶתְרוֹגִין וְלֻלָבִין וַהֲדַסִין וְעַרְבִין דִנְחָל וְתֶחֱדוּן קֳדָם יְיָ אֱלָהֲכוֹן שַׁבְעַת יוֹמִין
verses.ar_en: You shall take for yourselves, on the first day, the fruit of the beautiful tree (esrog) [esrogim], a branch of palm trees (lulav) [lulavim], boughs of thick-leaved trees (hadasim), and willows of the brook (aravos), and you shall rejoice before Adonoy, your God, for seven days.

verses.ar_he: וּתְחַגוּן יָתֵהּ חַגָא קֳדָם יְיָ שַׁבְעַת יוֹמִין בְּשַׁתָּא קְיַם עָלָם לְדָרֵיכוֹן בְּיַרְחָא שְׁבִיעָאָה תְּחַגוּן יָתֵהּ
verses.ar_en: You shall celebrate it as a festival to [before] Adonoy seven days in the year; it is an everlasting statute throughout your generations in the seventh month, you shall celebrate it.

verses.ar_he: בִּמְטַלַיָא תֵיתְבוּן שַׁבְעַת יוֹמִין כָּל יַצִיבָא בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל יֵתְבוּן בִּמְטַלַיָא
verses.ar_en: You shall dwell in the [shelters] sukkos seven days, every native born [settled] Israelite shall dwell in the [shelters] sukkos.

verses.ar_he: בְּדִיל דְיִדְעוּן דָרֵיכוֹן אֲרֵי בִמְטַלָיוּת עֲנָנֵי אוֹתֵבִית יָת בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל בְּאַפָּקוּתִי יָתְהוֹן מֵאַרְעָא דְמִצְרַיִם אֲנָא יְיָ אֱלָהֲכוֹן
verses.ar_en: So that your generations will know that in the [clouds of shelter] sukkos I caused Bnei Yisroel to dwell when I took them out from the land of Egypt, I am Adonoy, your God.

verses.ar_he: וּמַלִיל מֹשֶׁה יָת סְדַר מוֹעֲדַיָא דַיְיָ וְאַלֵפִנוּן לִבְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל
verses.ar_en: And thus Moshe declared the [order of the] appointed times of Adonoy [and taught them] to Bnei Yisroel.

verses.ar_he: וּמַלִיל יְיָ עִם מֹשֶׁה לְמֵימָר
verses.ar_en: Adonoy spoke to Moshe, saying;

verses.ar_he: פַּקֵד יָת בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וְיִסְבוּן לָךְ מְשַׁח זֵיתָא דַכְיָא כָּתִישָׁא לְאַנְהָרָא לְאַדְלָקָא בוֹצִינַיָא תְּדִירָא
verses.ar_en: Command Bnei Yisroel to take (bring) to you pure, pressed, olive oil for illumination to keep the lamp [lamps] burning constantly.

verses.ar_he: מִבָּרָא לְפָרֻכְתָּא דְסַהֲדוּתָא בְּמַשְׁכַּן זִמְנָא יַסְדַר יָתֵהּ אַהֲרֹן מֵרַמְשָׁא עַד צַפְרָא קֳדָם יְיָ תְּדִירָא קְיָם עָלָם לְדָרֵיכוֹן
verses.ar_en: Outside of the Curtain of the Testimony, which is inside the Tent of Meeting, Aharon shall arrange it [so that it burns] from evening until morning before Adonoy, continually; as an everlasting statute throughout your generations.

verses.ar_he: עַל מְנַרְתָּא דָכִיתָא יַסְדַר יָת בּוֹצִינַיָא קֳדָם יְיָ תְּדִירָא
verses.ar_en: Atop the pure menorah he shall arrange the lights before Adonoy, constantly.

verses.ar_he: וְתִסַב סֻלְתָּא וְתֵיפֵי יָתַהּ תַּרְתָּא עַשְׂרֵי גְרִיצָן תְּרֵין עֶשְׂרוֹנִין תְּהֵי גְרִצְתָּא חֲדָא
verses.ar_en: You shall take fine flour and bake twelve loaves, each individual loaf shall be two tenths [of an ephah].

verses.ar_he: וּתְשַׁוִי יָתְהוֹן תַּרְתֵּי סִדְרִין שִׁית סִדְרָא עַל פָּתוֹרָא דַכְיָא קֳדָם יְיָ
verses.ar_en: You shall place them in two stacks, six in each stack on the Pure Table, before Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וְתִתֵּן עַל סִדְרָא לְבֹנְתָּא דָכִיתָא וּתְהֵי לִלְחֵם לְאִדְכַּרְתָּא קֻרְבָּנָא קָדָם יְיָ
verses.ar_en: You shall put pure frankincense on [each] stack and it shall be as a memorial portion for the bread, as a fire-offering, to [an offering before] Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: בְּיוֹמָא דְשַׁבְּתָא בְּיוֹמָא דְשַׁבְּתָא יַסְדְרִנֵהּ קֳדָם יְיָ תְּדִירָא מִן קֳדָם בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל קְיַם עָלָם
verses.ar_en: On each and every Shabbos he shall arrange them before Adonoy, continually, from [before] Bnei Yisroel as an eternal covenant.

verses.ar_he: וּתְהֵי לְאַהֲרֹן וְלִבְנוֹהִי וְיֵכְלֻנֵהּ בַּאֲתַר קַדִישׁ אֲרֵי קֹדֶשׁ קוּדְשִׁין הוּא לֵהּ מִקֻרְבָּנַיָא דַיְיָ קְיַם עָלָם
verses.ar_en: It shall belong to Aharon and to his sons and they shall eat it in a sacred place, for it is most holy for him from among the fire-offerings [offerings] of Adonoy, as an everlasting statute.

verses.ar_he: וּנְפַק בַּר אִתְּתָא בַת יִשְׂרָאֵל וְהוּא בַּר גְבַר מִצְרָאָה בְּגוֹ בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וּנְצוֹ בְּמַשְׁרִיתָא בַּר אִתְּתָא בַת יִשְׂרָאֵל וְגַבְרָא בַּר יִשְׂרָאֵל
verses.ar_en: The son of an Israelite woman went out, and he was the son of an Egyptian man, among Bnei Yisroel. They argued in the encampment—the son of the Israelite woman, and the Israelite man.

verses.ar_he: וּפָרֵשׁ בַּר אִתְּתָא בַת יִשְׂרָאֵל יָת שְׁמָא וְאַרְגֵז וְאַיְתִיאוּ יָתֵהּ לְוָת מֹשֶׁה וְשׁוּם אִמֵהּ שְׁלֹמִית בַּת דִבְרִי לְשִׁבְטָא דְדָן
verses.ar_en: The Israelite womans son clearly pronounced the Name [of God] and blasphemed [caused anger] and they brought him to Moshe. The name of his mother was Shlomis, daughter of Divri of the tribe of Dan.

verses.ar_he: וְאַסְרוֹהִי בְּבֵית מַטְרָא עַד דְיִתְפָּרַשׁ לְהוֹן עַל גְזֵרַת מֵימְרָא דַיְיָ
verses.ar_en: They placed [bound] him in the guardhouse until [his penalty] would be explained to them through the [law of the] word of Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וּמַלִיל יְיָ עִם מֹשֶׁה לְמֵימָר
verses.ar_en: Adonoy spoke to Moshe, saying;

verses.ar_he: אַפֵּק יָת דְאַרְגֵז לְמִבָּרָא לְמַשְּׁרִיתָא וְיִסְמְכוּן כָּל דִי שְׁמָעוּ יָת יְדֵיהוֹן עַל רֵישֵׁהּ וְיִרְגְמוּן יָתֵהּ כָּל כְּנִשְּׁתָּא
verses.ar_en: Take the blasphemer [one who has caused anger] beyond the encampment, and all those who heard him shall lay their hands on his head and the entire congregation shall stone him.

verses.ar_he: וְעִם בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל תְּמַלֵל לְמֵימָר גְבַר גְבַר דִי יַרְגֵז קֳדָם אֱלָהֵהּ וִיקַבֵּל חוֹבֵהּ
verses.ar_en: And to Bnei Yisroel you shall speak, saying; Any person who shall blaspheme [cause anger before] his God shall bear [the burden of] his sin.

verses.ar_he: וְדִי פָרֵשׁ שְׁמָא דַיְיָ אִתְקְטָּלָא יִתְקְטֵל מִרְגַם יִרְגְמוּן בֵּהּ כָּל כְּנִשְׁתָּא כְּגִיוֹרָא כְּיַצִיבָא בְּפָרָשׁוּתֵהּ שְׁמָא יִתְקְטֵל
verses.ar_en: Whoever pronounces clearly the Name of Adonoy [and blasphemes] he will surely be put to death. The entire congregation shall surely stone him. The proselyte and native born [settled one] alike when he clearly articulates the Name, shall be put to death.

verses.ar_he: וּגְבַר אֲרֵי יִקְטוֹל כָּל נַפְשָׁא דַאֲנָשָׁא אִתְקְטָלָא יִתְקְטֵל
verses.ar_en: Any man who kills any human being must surely be put to death.

verses.ar_he: וּדְיִקְטוֹל נְפַשׁ בְּעִירָא יְשַׁלְמִנַהּ נַפְשָׁא חֳלַף נַפְשָׁא
verses.ar_en: Whoever kills an animal shall pay for it, [the compensation of] an animal for an animal.

verses.ar_he: וּגְבַר אֲרֵי יִתֵּן מוּמָא בְּחַבְרֵהּ כְּמָא דִי עֲבַד כֵּן יִתְעֲבֵד לֵיהּ
verses.ar_en: A man who maims his neighbor just as he did, so shall be done to him.

verses.ar_he: תַּבְרָא חֳלַף תַּבְרָא עֵינָא חֳלַף עֵינָא שִׁנָא חֳלַף שִׁנָא כְּמָא דִי יִתֵּן מוּמָא בַּאֲנָשָׁא כֵּן יִתְיְהֵב בֵּהּ
verses.ar_en: [Compensation for] a broken bone [in exchange] for a broken bone, [compen-sation for] the loss of an eye [in exchange] for the loss of an eye, [compensation for] the loss to a tooth [in exchange] for the loss of a tooth; just as he maimed the man, so shall it be done to him [monetarily].

verses.ar_he: וּדְיִקְטוֹל בְּעִירָא יְשַׁלְמִנַהּ וּדְיִקְטוֹל אֲנָשָׁא יִתְקְטֵל
verses.ar_en: Whoever smites [kills] an animal shall pay for it. Whoever smites [kills] a person shall be put to death.

verses.ar_he: דִינָא חֲדָא יְהֵי לְכוֹן כְּגִיוֹרָא כְּיַצִיבָא יְהֵי אֲרֵי אֲנָא יְיָ אֱלָהֲכוֹן
verses.ar_en: One rule shall apply for all of you just as it is for the proselyte, so it shall be for the native born [settled one], for I am Adonoy, your God.

verses.ar_he: וּמַלִיל מֹשֶׁה עִם בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וְאַפִּיקוּ יָת דְאַרְגֵז לְמִבָּרָא לְמַשְׁרִיתָא וּרְגָמוּ יָתֵהּ אַבְנָא וּבְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל עֲבָדוּ כְּמָא דִי פַּקֵיד יְיָ יָת מֹשֶׁה
verses.ar_en: Moshe spoke to Bnei Yisroel and they took the blasphemer [one who caused anger], beyond the encampment and they stoned him with a stone. And Bnei Yisroel did just as Adonoy commanded Moshe.

verses.ar_he: וּמַלִיל יְיָ עִם מֹשֶׁה בְּטּוּרָא דְסִינַי לְמֵימָר
verses.ar_en: Adonoy spoke to Moshe on Mount Sinai, saying;

verses.ar_he: מַלֵל עִם בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וְתֵימַר לְהוֹן אֲרֵי תֵעַלוּן לְאַרְעָא דִי אֲנָא יָהֵב לְכוֹן וְתַשְּׁמֵט אַרְעָא שְׁמִטְתָא קֳדָם יְיָ
verses.ar_en: Speak to Bnei Yisroel and say to them, when you come to the land which I give to you the land shall be at rest—a Shabbos for [rest before] Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: שִׁית שְׁנִין תִּזְרַע חַקְלָךְ וְשִׁית שְׁנִין תִכְסַח כַּרְמָךְ וְתִכְנוֹשׁ יָת עֲלַלְתָּהּ
verses.ar_en: For six years you shall plant your field and for six years you shall prune your vineyard and you shall harvest its produce.

verses.ar_he: וּבְשַׁתָּא שְׁבִיעֲתָא נְיַח שְׁמִטְתָא יְהֵי לְאַרְעָא דְתַשְׁמֵט קֳדָם יְיָ חַקְלָךְ לָא תִזְרַע וְכַרְמָךְ לָא תִכְסָח
verses.ar_en: But the seventh year shall be a Shabbos of [complete] rest for the land, a Shabbos for [rest before] Adonoy, you shall not plant your field and you shall not prune your vineyard.

verses.ar_he: יָת כַּתֵּי דַחֲצָדָךְ לָא תֶחֱצַד וְיָת עִנְבֵי שִׁבְקָךְ לָא תִקְטוֹף שְׁנַת שְׁמִטְתָא יְהֵי לְאַרְעָא
verses.ar_en: [Even] crops that grew on their own [from the seeds of your previous] harvest you shall not reap, and the grapes of your untended vines you shall not gather; it shall be a year of complete rest for the land.

verses.ar_he: וּתְהֵי שְׁמִטַת אַרְעָא לְכוֹן לְמֵיכַל לָךְ וּלְעַבְדָךְ וּלְאַמְתָךְ וְלַאֲגִירָךְ וּלְתוֹתָבָךְ דְדָיְרִין עִמָךְ
verses.ar_en: The [produce] [rest] of the lands Shabbos[-year] [land] shall be for yourselves, for food, for you, your servant and your maidservant, for your hired hand and your resident sojourner who reside with you.

verses.ar_he: וְלִבְעִירָךְ וּלְחַיְתָא דִי בְאַרְעָךְ תְּהֵי כָל עֲלַלְתַּהּ לְמֵיכָל
verses.ar_en: [Also] for your domesticated animals and for the [wild] beasts that are in your land shall all of its produce be for food.

verses.ar_he: וְתִמְנֵי לָךְ שְׁבַע שְׁמִיטִין דִשְׁנִין שְׁבַע שְׁנִין שְׁבַע זִמְנִין וִיהוֹן לָךְ יוֹמֵי שְּׁבַע שְׁמִטִין דִשְׁנִין אַרְבְּעִין וְתֵשַׁע שְׁנִין
verses.ar_en: You shall count for yourself seven sabbatical years [of rest], seven years, seven times and it shall be for you, the days (period) of the seven sabbatical years [of rest], forty-nine years.

verses.ar_he: וְתַעֲבַר שׁוֹפָר יַבָּבָא בְּיַרְחָא שְׁבִיעָאָה בְּעַשְׂרָא לְיַרְחָא בְּיוֹמָא דְכִפּוּרַיָא תַּעַבְרוּן שׁוֹפָרָא בְּכָל אַרְעֲכוֹן
verses.ar_en: You shall make a proclamation [crying] with the shofor on the tenth day of the seventh month. On Yom Kippur shall this shofor-proclamation be made. throughout all your land.

verses.ar_he: וּתְקַדְשׁוּן יָת שְׁנַת חַמְשִׁין שְׁנִין וְתַקְרוּן חֵרוּתָא בְּאַרְעָא לְכָל יָתְבָהָא יוֹבֵלָא הִיא תְּהֵי לְכוֹן וּתְתוּבוּן גְבַר לְאַחֲסַנְתֵּהּ וּגְבַר לְזַרְעִיתֵהּ תְּתוּבוּן
verses.ar_en: You shall sanctify the year of the fiftieth year and proclaim freedom in the land for all of its inhabitants; it shall be for you a jubilee and each man shall return to his ancestral land and each man shall return to his family.

verses.ar_he: יוֹבֵלָא הִיא שְׁנַת חַמְשִׁין שְׁנִין תְּהֵי לְכוֹן לָא תִזְרְעוּן וְלָא תַחְצְדוּן יַת כַּתָּהָא וְלָא תִקְטְפוּן יַת שִׁבְקָהָא
verses.ar_en: It is a jubilee, [that] the year of the fiftieth year shall be for you. You shall not plant and you shall not reap [even] crops that grew on their own; and you shall not gather the [grapes of] its untended vineyard,

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי יוֹבֵלָא הִיא קוּדְשָׁא תְּהֵי לְכוֹן מִן חַקְלָא תֵּיכְלוּן יָת עֲלַלְתָּהּ
verses.ar_en: For it is a jubilee, it shall be holy to you. Whatever is in the field, you may eat of its produce.

verses.ar_he: בְּשַׁתָּא דְיוֹבֵלָא הָדָא תְּתוּבוּן גְבַר לְאַחֲסַנְתֵּהּ
verses.ar_en: On this jubilee year, each man shall return to his ancestral land.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲרֵי תְזַבֵּן זְבִינִין לְחַבְרָךְ אוֹ תִזְבֵּן מִידָא דְחַבְרָךְ לָא תוֹנוּן גְבַר יָת אֲחוֹהִי
verses.ar_en: If you sell anything to your neighbor, or purchase [something] from your neighbor, do not cheat one another.

verses.ar_he: בְּמִנְיַן שְׁנַיָא בָּתַר יוֹבֵלָא תִּזְבֵּן מִן חַבְרָךְ בְּמִנְיַן שְׁנֵי עֲלַלְתָּא יְזַבֶּן לָךְ
verses.ar_en: According to the number of years after the jubilee you shall purchase [land] from your neighbor; according to the number of produce years he shall sell it to you.

verses.ar_he: לְפוּם סְגִיאוּת שְׁנַיָא תַּסְגֵי זְבִינוֹהִי וּלְפוּם זְעֵרוּת שְׁנַיָא תַּזְעֵר זְבִינוֹהִי אֲרֵי מִנְיַן עֲלַלְתָּא הוּא מְזַבֵּן לָךְ
verses.ar_en: Based on the abundance of years, you shall increase its purchase price and based on the lack of years you shall decrease its purchase price, since it is the number of produce-seasons that he is selling to you.

verses.ar_he: וְלָא תוֹנוּן גְבַר יָת חַבְרֵהּ וְתִדְחַל מֵאֱלָהָךְ אֲרֵי אֲנָא יְיָ אֱלָהֲכוֹן
verses.ar_en: You shall not cheat one another, and you shall fear your God for I am Adonoy, your God.

verses.ar_he: וְתַעְבְּדוּן יָת קְיָמַי וְיָת דִינַי תִּטְּרוּן וְתַעֲבְּדוּן יָתְהוֹן וְתֵיתְבוּן עַל אַרְעָא לְרָחֲצָן
verses.ar_en: You shall fulfill My statutes and keep My laws and fulfill them, and you will then live in the land in security.

verses.ar_he: וְתִתֵּן אַרְעָא אִבַּהּ וְתֵיכְלוּן לְמִשְׂבָּע וְתֵיתְבוּן לְרָחֲצָן עֲלַהּ
verses.ar_en: The land will give forth its fruit and you will eat your fill, and you will live securely on it.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲרֵי תֵימְרוּן מָא נֵיכוּל בְּשַׁתָּא שְׁבִיעֵתָא הָא לָא נִזְרָע וְלָא נִכְנוֹשׁ יָת עֲלַלְתָּנָא
verses.ar_en: If you shall say (ask) What will we eat in the seventh year, for lo! we have not planted nor gathered our produce?

verses.ar_he: וֶאֱפַקֵד יָת בִּרְכְּתִי לְכוֹן בְּשַׁתָּא שְׁתִיתֵתָא וְתַעְבֵּד יָת עֲלַלְתָּא לִתְלַת שְׁנִין
verses.ar_en: I shall command (direct) My blessing to you in the sixth year and it will produce [enough] for three years.

verses.ar_he: וְתִזְרְעוּן יָת שַׁתָּא תְמִינֵתָא וְתֵיכְלוּן מִן עֲלַלְתָּא עַתִּיקָא עַד שַׁתָּא תְשִׁיעֵתָא עַד מֵעַל עֲלַלְתַּהּ תֵּיכְלוּן עַתִּיקָא
verses.ar_en: You shall plant in the eighth year but you will still be eating from the old produce until the ninth year; until the [new] produce arrives (ripens) you shall eat [from] the old.

verses.ar_he: וְאַרְעָא לָא תִזְדַבַּן לַחֲלוּטִין אֲרֵי דִילִי אַרְעָא אֲרֵי דַיָרִין וְתוֹתָבִין אַתּוּן קֳדָמַי
verses.ar_en: The land shall not be sold in perpetuity, for the land is Mine, for, you are [merely as] foreigners [foreign resident] and resident aliens [residents] before Me.

verses.ar_he: וּבְכֹל אַרְעָא אַחֲסַנְתְּכוֹן פֻּרְקָנָא תִּתְּנוּן לְאַרְעָא
verses.ar_en: In all of your ancestral lands you shall grant redemption to the land.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי יִתְמַסְכַּן אָחוּךְ וִיזַבֵּן מֵאַחֲסַנְתֵּהּ וְיֵיתֵי פָרִיקֵהּ דְקָרִיב לֵהּ וְיִפְרוֹק יָת זְבִינֵי אֲחוּהִי
verses.ar_en: If your brother becomes impoverished and sells some of his ancestral land, and a close relative comes and redeems that which his brother sold.

verses.ar_he: וּגְבַר אֲרֵי לָא יְהֵי לֵהּ פָּרִיק וְתַדְבֵּק יְדֵהּ וְיַשְׁכַּח כְּמִסַת פֻּרְקָנֵהּ
verses.ar_en: [Or] if the man has no redeemer (close relative) but has acquired sufficient means and finds [it] enough to redeem it [himself],

verses.ar_he: וִיחַשֵׁב יָת שְׁנֵי זְבִינוֹהִי וְיָתֵב יָת מוֹתָרָא לִגְבַר דִי זַבֶּן לֵהּ וִיתוּב לְאַחֲסַנְתֵּהּ
verses.ar_en: He shall calculate the number of years for which he sold the land and return the remainder (excess) to the man to whom he had sold it, and he shall return to his ancestral land.

verses.ar_he: וְאִם לָא תַשְׁכַּח יְדֵהּ כְּמִסַת אֲתֵב לֵהּ וִיהֵי זְבִינוֹהִי בִּידָא דִזְבַן יָתֵהּ עַד שַׁתָּא דְיוֹבֵלָא וְיִפּוֹק בְּיוֹבֵלָא וִיתוּב לְאַחֲסַנְתֵּהּ
verses.ar_en: Or if he does not have within his means enough to retrieve the land to himself, then that which he sold remains in the possession of the buyer until the jubilee year. It is then released by the jubilee and he [the seller] returns to his ancestral land.

verses.ar_he: וּגְבַר אֲרֵי יְזַבֵּן בֵּית מוֹתַב קַרְתָּא מַקְפָא שׁוּר וּתְהֵי פוּרְקָנֵהּ עַד מִשְׁלַם שַׁתָּא דִזְבִינוֹהִי עִדָן בְּעִדָן תְּהֵי פוּרְקָנֵהּ
verses.ar_en: If a man shall sell a residential home [that is] within [surrounded by] a walled city, the time allotted for its redemption shall be until the end of one year after he sold it. He has the days [of a full year] in which to redeem it.

verses.ar_he: וְאִם לָא יִתְפָּרַק עַד מִשְׁלַם לֵהּ שַׁתָּא שְׁלֶמְתָּא וִיקוּם בֵּיתָא דִי בְקַרְתָּא דִי לֵהּ שׁוּרָא לַחֲלוּטִין לְדִי זְבַן יָתֵהּ לְדָרוֹהִי לָא יִפּוֹק בְּיוֹבֵלָא
verses.ar_en: If he does not redeem it by the end of a full year, the house within the city that is surrounded by a wall shall then remain in perpetuity to its purchaser for his generations (descendants.) It is not released by the jubilee.

verses.ar_he: וּבָתֵּי פַצְחַיָא דִי לֵית לְהוֹן שׁוּר מַקַף סְחוֹר סְחוֹר עַל חֲקַל אַרְעָא יִתְחַשָׁב פֻּרְקָנָא תְּהֵי לֵהּ וּבְיוֹבֵלָא יִפּוֹק
verses.ar_en: The houses of open cities which are not surrounded by a [an encircling] wall shall be considered as a field of the land. It shall have a redemption and it is released by the jubilee.

verses.ar_he: וְקִרְוֵי לֵיוָאֵי בָּתֵּי קִרְוֵי אַחֲסַנְתְּהוֹן פּוּרְקַן עָלָם תְּהֵי לְלֵיוָאֵי
verses.ar_en: The cities of the Levites the houses in the cities of their ancestral land, the Levites shall have an eternal right of redemption.

verses.ar_he: וְדִי יִפְרוֹק מִן לֵיוָאֵי וְיִפּוֹק זְבִין בֵּיתָא וְקַרְתָּא אַחֲסַנְתֵּהּ בְּיוֹבֵלָא אֲרֵי בָתֵּי קִרְוֵי לֵיוָאֵי הִיא אַחְסַנְתְּהוֹן בְּגוֹ בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל
verses.ar_en: If anyone redeems [a house or field] from the Levites, then the house or his ancestral city shall be released by the jubilee, for the houses of the Levitic cities are [considered] their ancestral lands among Bnei Yisroel.

verses.ar_he: וַחֲקַל רְוַח קִרְוֵיהוֹן לָא יִזְדַבָּן אֲרֵי אַחֲסָנַת עָלָם הוּא לְהוֹן
verses.ar_en: The field on the outskirts of their cities may not be sold for it is their perpetual ancestral land.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲרֵי יִתְמַסְכַּן אָחוּךְ וּתְמוּט יְדֵהּ עִמָךְ וְתַתְקַף בֵּהּ דַיַר וְתוֹתָב וִיחֵי עִמָךְ
verses.ar_en: If your brother becomes impoverished and his hand (assets) become shaky among you, you must support him, [so too] the proselyte [foreign resident] and the sojourner, [so] that he shall live with you.

verses.ar_he: לָא תִסַב מִנֵהּ חִבּוּלְיָא וְרִבִּיתָא וְתִדְחַל מֵאֱלָהָךְ וִיחֵי אָחוּךְ עִמָךְ
verses.ar_en: You shall not take from him interest or usury and you shall fear your God, and your brother shall live with you.

verses.ar_he: יָת כַּסְפָּךְ לָא תִתֵּן לֵהּ בְּחִבּוּלְיָא וּבְרִבִּיתָא לָא תִתֵּן מֵיכְלָךְ
verses.ar_en: You must not give (lend) him your money with interest, and usuriously you must not advance him your food.

verses.ar_he: אֲנָא יְיָ אֱלָהֲכוֹן דִי אַפֵּקִית יָתְכוֹן מֵאַרְעָא דְמִצְרָיִם לְמִתַּן לְכוֹן יָת אַרְעָא דִכְנַעַן לְמֶהֱוֵי לְכוֹן לֶאֱלָהּ
verses.ar_en: I am Adonoy your God who brought you out from the land of Egypt to give you the land of Canaan, to be a God for you.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲרֵי יִתְמַסְכַּן אָחוּךְ עִמָךְ וְיִזְדַבַּן לָךְ לָא תִפְלַח בֵּהּ פָּלְחַן עַבְדִין
verses.ar_en: If your brother becomes impoverished and is sold to you, you must not work him like a slave [slaves].

verses.ar_he: כַּאֲגִירָא כְתוֹתָבָא יְהֵי עִמָךְ עַד שַׁתָּא דְיוֹבֵלָא יִפְלַח עִמָךְ
verses.ar_en: Like a hired hand or resident [worker] shall he be with you He shall serve you until the jubilee year.

verses.ar_he: וְיִפּוֹק מֵעִמָךְ הוּא וּבְנוֹהִי עִמֵהּ וִיתוּב לְזַרְעִיתֵהּ וּלְאַחֲסָנַת אֲבָהָתוֹהִי יְתוּב
verses.ar_en: Then he and his children shall depart from you and return to his own family. He shall return to his ancestral estate.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי עַבְדַי אִנוּן דִי אַפֵּקִית יָתְהוֹן מֵאַרְעָא דְמִצְרָיִם לָא יִזְדַבְּנוּן זְבוּן עַבְדִין
verses.ar_en: For they are My servants, whom I brought out from the land of Egypt, they shall not be sold [in the market] as slaves.

verses.ar_he: לָא תִפְלָח בֵּהּ בְּקַשְׁיוּ וְתִדְחַל מֵאֱלָהָךְ
verses.ar_en: You must not rule over him [make him work] to crush him and you shall fear your God.

verses.ar_he: וְעַבְדָךְ וְאַמְתָךְ דִי יְהוֹן לָךְ מִן עַמְמַיָא דִי בְסַחֲרָנֵיכוֹן מִנְהוֹן תִּקְנוּן עַבְדִין וְאַמְהָן
verses.ar_en: Your slaves and maidservants that you shall possess from the nations that surround you, from them you may purchase slaves and maidservants.

verses.ar_he: וְאַף מִבְּנֵי תוֹתָבַיָא עָרְלַיָא דְדָיְרִין עִמְכוֹן מִנְהוֹן תִּקְנוּן וּמִזַרְעִיתְהוֹן דְעִמְכוֹן דִי אִתְיְלִידוּ בְּאַרְעֲכוֹן וִיהוֹן לְכוֹן לְאַחֲסָנָא
verses.ar_en: Also, from the children of the [uncircumcised] sojourners who reside with you from them you may purchase [slaves], and from their families that live among you that were born in your land. [All these] shall be your permanent possession.

verses.ar_he: וְתַחֲסוּן יָתְהוֹן לִבְנֵיכוֹן בַּתְרֵיכוֹן לִירוּתַת אַחֲסָנָא לְעָלָם בְּהוֹן תִּפְלְחוּן וּבְאֲחֵיכוֹן בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל גְבַר בַּאֲחוּהִי לָא תִפְלַח בֵּהּ בְּקַשְׁיוּ
verses.ar_en: You shall will them as inheritance to your children after you as hereditary property; you shall keep them in servitude permanently. However regarding your bretheren, Bnei Yisroel, man over his brother, you must not rule over him [make him work] to crush him.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲרֵי תַדְבֵּק יַד עָרֵל וְתוֹתָב עִמָךְ וְיִתְמַסְכַּן אָחוּךְ עִמֵהּ וְיִזְדַבַּן לְעָרֵל תּוֹתָב עִמָךְ אוֹ לְאַרְמַי זַרְעִית גִיוֹרָא
verses.ar_en: If a foreigner [an uncircumcised one] or resident acquires means while your brother becomes impoverished by him, and is sold to a [an uncircumcised] resident foreigner who resides with you or to the offspring [a non-Jew] of a foreign [proselyte] family.

verses.ar_he: בָּתַר דְיִזְדַבַּן פֻּרְקָנָא תְּהֵי לֵהּ חַד מֵאֲחוֹהִי יִפְרְקִנֵהּ
verses.ar_en: After he is sold redemption shall be his, one of his bretheren shall redeem him.

verses.ar_he: אוֹ אַח אֲבוּהִּי אוֹ בַר אַח אֲבוּהִי יִפְרְקִנֵהּ אוֹ מִקָרִיב בִּשְׂרֵהּ מִזַרְעִיתֵהּ יִפְרְקִנֵהּ אוֹ דְתַדְבֵּק יְדֵהּ וְיִתְפָּרָק
verses.ar_en: Either his uncle [father’s brother] or his uncles son [the son of his father’s brother] (cousin) shall redeem him or the closest (other) family relative shall redeem him. If he obtains sufficient means of his own he may be redeemed [on his own.]

verses.ar_he: וִיחַשֵׁב עִם זָבְנֵהּ מִשַׁתָּא דְאִזְדַבַּן לֵהּ עַד שַׁתָּא דְיוֹבֵלָא וִיהֵי כְּסַף זְבִינוֹהִי בְּמִנְיַן שְׁנַיָא כְּיוֹמֵי אֲגִירָא יְהֵי עִמֵהּ
verses.ar_en: He shall reckon with the one who bought him. [According to the number of years] from the year which he was sold to him until the jubilee year. His purchase price shall be [proportional] to the number of years; at the rate of the days of a hired hand it shall be [considered as he worked] with him.

verses.ar_he: אִם עוֹד סְגִיוּת בִּשְׁנַיָא לְפוּמְהֵן יָתֵב פֻּרְקָנֵהּ מִכְּסַף זְבִינוֹהִי
verses.ar_en: If there are yet many years [until the jubilee] accordingly shall he return his redemption money from his purchase price.

verses.ar_he: וְאִם זְעֵר יִשְׁתָּאַר בִּשְׁנַיָא עַד שַׁתָּא דְיוֹבֵלָא וִיחַשֶׁב לֵהּ כְּפוּם שְׁנוֹהִי יָתֵב יָת פּוּרְקָנֵהּ
verses.ar_en: If there remain but a few years until the jubilee year, he shall make a [similar] calculation, based on the number of years he shall return his redemption money [to the purchaser.]

verses.ar_he: כַּאֲגִיר שְׁנָא בִּשְׁנָא יְהֵי עִמֵהּ לָא יִפְלַח בֵּהּ בְּקַשְׁיוּ לְעֵינָיךְ
verses.ar_en: As a hired hand [working] on a yearly basis shall he be considered with him; he shall not rule over him [make him work] to crush him before your eyes.

verses.ar_he: וְאִם לָא יִתְפָּרַק בְּאִלֵין וְיִפּוֹק בְּשַׁתָּא דְיוֹבֵלָא הוּא וּבְנוֹהִי עִמֵהּ
verses.ar_en: If he is not redeemed through these means he then goes out in the jubilee year, he, along with his children.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי דִילִי בְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל עַבְדִין עַבְדַי אִנוּן דִי אַפֵּקִית יָתְהוֹן מֵאַרְעָא דְמִצְרָיִם אֲנָא יְיָ אֱלָהֲכוֹן
verses.ar_en: For, Bnei Yisroel are My servants. They are My servants whom I have brought out of the land of Egypt, I am Adonoy, your God.

verses.ar_he: לָא תַעְבְּדוּן לְכוֹן טַעֲוָן וְצֶלֶם וְקָמָא לָא תְקִימוּן לְכוֹן וְאֶבֶן סָגְדָא לָא תִתְּנוּן בְּאַרְעֲכוֹן לְמִסְגֻד עֲלַהּ אֲרֵי אֲנָא יְיָ אֱלָהֲכוֹן
verses.ar_en: You shall not make [false] idols for yourselves and graven images and memorial stones you shall not raise up for youselves, and a prostration stone you shall not set in your land upon which to prostrate oneself, for I am Adonoy, your God.

verses.ar_he: יָת יוֹמֵי שַׁבַּיָא דִילִי תִטְרוּן וּלְבֵית מַקְדְשִׁי תְּהוֹן דָחֲלִין אֲנָא יְיָ
verses.ar_en: You shall keep [the days of] My Shabbosos and you shall fear (revere) [the House of] My Sanctuary, I am Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: אִם בִּקְיָמַי תְּהָכוּן וְיָת פִּקוֹדַי תִּטְרוּן וְתַעֲבְּדוּן יָתְהוֹן
verses.ar_en: If you follow My statutes and keep My commandments and you will fulfill them,

verses.ar_he: וְאֶתֵּן מַטְּרְכוֹן בְּעִדָנְהוֹן וְתִתֵּן אַרְעָא עֲלַלְתָּהּ וְאִילַן חַקְלָא יִתֵּן אִבֵּהּ
verses.ar_en: I will provide your rains in their proper time. The earth shall give forth its produce and the tree of the field shall give forth its produce.

verses.ar_he: וִיעָרַע לְכוֹן דְיָשָׁא יָת קְטָפָא וּקְטָפָא יְעָרַע לְאַפּוֹקֵי בַר זַרְעָא וְתֵיכְלוּן לַחְמְכוֹן לְמִשְׂבַּע וְתֵיתְבוּן לְרָחְצָן בְּאַרְעַכוֹן
verses.ar_en: [Because of the abundant produce] threshing will overtake the grape harvest and the grape harvest overtake the [time to] plant, and you will eat your bread to satiation and you will live securely in your land.

verses.ar_he: וְאֶתֵּן שְׁלָמָא בְּאַרְעָא וְתִשְׁרוּן וְלֵית דְמָנִיד וֶאֱבַטֵל חַיְתָא בִשְׁתָּא מִן אַרְעָא וּדְקַטְלִין בְּחַרְבָּא לָא יְעִדוּן בְּאַרְעֲכוֹן
verses.ar_en: I will grant peace in the land; you will lie down (sleep) [rest] without disturbance (fear). I will banish [nullify] evil beasts from the land, and no [people who kill with a] sword shall pass through your land.

verses.ar_he: וְתִרְדְפוּן יָת בַּעֲלֵי דְבָבֵיכוֹן וְיִפְּלוּן קֳדָמֵיכוֹן לְחַרְבָּא
verses.ar_en: You will pursue your enemies and they will fall before you by the sword.

verses.ar_he: וְיִרְדְפוּן מִנְכוֹן חַמְשָׁא מְאָה וּמְאָה מִנְכוֹן לְרִבּוֹתָא יֵיעִירְקוּן וְיִפְּלוּן בַּעֲלֵי דְבָבֵיכוֹן קֳדָמֵיכוֹן לְחַרְבָּא
verses.ar_en: Five of you will pursue one hundred and one hundred of you will pursue ten thousand, and your enemies will fall before you by the sword.

verses.ar_he: וְאֶתְפְּנֵי בְּמֵימְרִי לְאוֹטָבָא לְכוֹן וְאַפֵּשׁ יָתְכוֹן וְאַסְגֵי יָתְכוֹן וַאֲקֵם יָת קְיָמִי עִמְכוֹן
verses.ar_en: I will turn [with My Word to do good] to you and make you fruitful and multiply you, and establish My covenant with you.

verses.ar_he: וְתֵיכְלוּן עַתִּיקָא דְעַתִּיק וְעַתִּיקָא מִן קֳדָם חֲדַתָּא תְּפַנוּן
verses.ar_en: You will eat the old [store] long kept and the old [store] you will have to clear out because of the new.

verses.ar_he: וְאֶתֵּן מַשְׁכְּנִי בֵּינֵיכוֹן וְלָא יְרַחֵק מֵימְרִי יָתְכוֹן
verses.ar_en: I will set My Sanctuary among you and My spirit [Word] will not loathe (reject) you.

verses.ar_he: וְאַשְׁרֵי שְׁכִינְתִּי בֵּינֵיכוֹן וְאֶהֱוֵי לְכוֹן לֶאֱלָהּ וְאַתּוּן תְּהוֹן קֳדָמַי לְעָם
verses.ar_en: I will walk [rest My Shechina] among you and I will be a God for you, and you will be My [before Me for a] people.

verses.ar_he: אֲנָא יְיָ אֱלָהֲכוֹן דִי אַפֵּקִית יָתְכוֹן מֵאַרְעָא דְמִצְרַיִם מִלְמֶהֱוֵי לְהוֹן עַבְדִין וְתַבָּרִית נִיר עַמְמַיָא מִנְכוֹן וְדַבָּרִית יָתְכוֹן לְחֵרוּתָא
verses.ar_en: I am Adonoy your God who brought you out of the land of Egypt from where you were slaves, and I broke the bars of your yoke [of the peoples from you] and led you forth standing upright [to freedom].

verses.ar_he: וְאִם לָא תְקַבְּלוּן לְמֵימְרִי וְלָא תַעְבְּדוּן יָת כָּל פִּקוּדַיָא הָאִלֵין
verses.ar_en: And if you will not listen to Me [accept My Word] and you will not fulfill all of these commandments.

verses.ar_he: וְאִם בִּקְיָמַי תְּקוֹצוּן וְאִם יָת דִינַי תְּרַחֵק נַפְשְׁכוֹן בְּדִיל דְלָא לְמֶעְבַּד יָת כָּל פִּקוֹדַי לְאַשְׁנָיוּתְכוֹן יָת קְיָמִי
verses.ar_en: If you despise My statutes and your souls loathe [reject] My laws so as not to fulfill all My commandments, thereby breaking [changing] My convenant.

verses.ar_he: אַף אֲנָא אֶעְבֶּד דָא לְכוֹן וְאַסְעַר עֲלֵיכוֹן בַּהֶלְתָּא יָת שַׁחֶפְתָּא וְיָת קַדַחְתָּא מְחַשְׁכָן עַיְנִין וּמַפְּחַן נְפָשׁ וְתִזְרְעוּן לְרֵקָנוּן זַרְעֲכוֹן וְיֵיכְלֻנֵהּ בַּעֲלֵי דְבָבֵיכוֹן
