verses.ar_en: Then I will do the same with you. I will impose terror upon you, [which causes] swelling and fever that consume [darken] the eyes and fill the soul with grief. You will plant [your seeds] in vain because your enemies will consume [your crops.]

verses.ar_he: וְאֶתֵּן רוּגְזִי בְּכוֹן וְתִתַּבְּרוּן קֳדָם בַּעֲלֵי דְבָבֵיכוֹן וְיִרְדוּן בְּכוֹן סַנְאֵכוֹן וְתֵעִירְקוּן וְלֵית דְרָדִיף יָתְכוֹן
verses.ar_en: I will set my face [anger] against you and you will be defeated [smitten] before your enemies; your foes will rule over you and you will flee [even] when no one is pursuing you.

verses.ar_he: וְאִם עַד אִלֵין לָא תְקַבְּלוּן לְמֵימְרִי וְאוֹסֵף לְמִרְדֵי יָתְכוֹן שְׁבַע עַל חוֹבֵיכוֹן
verses.ar_en: If after these [catastrophes] you still do not listen to Me [accept My Word], then I will increase your punishment sevenfold, as your sins.

verses.ar_he: וְאֶתְבַּר יָת יְקַר תָּקְפְּכוֹן וְאֶתֵּן יָת שְׁמַיָא דִי עִלָוֵיכוֹן תַּקִיפִין כְּפַרְזְלָא מִלַאֲחָתָא מִטְרָא וְאַרְעָא דִתְחוֹתֵיכוֹן חֲסִינָא כִּנְחָשָׁא מִלְמֶעְבַּד פֵּירִין
verses.ar_en: I will break the pride [glory] of your power. I will make your [the] heavens [which are above you] like [as strong as] iron [to bring no rain down] and your [the] land [which is beneath you] like [as powerful as] copper [producing no fruit].

verses.ar_he: וִיסוּפוּן לְרֵיקָנוּ חֵילֵיכוֹן וְלָא תִתֵּן אַרְעֲכוֹן יָת עֲלַלְתָּהּ וְאִילַן אַרְעָא לָא יִתֵּן אִבֵּהּ
verses.ar_en: Your strength will be exhausted in vain. Your land will not yield its produce and the tree[s] of the land will not give forth its produce.

verses.ar_he: וְאִם תְּהָכוּן קֳדָמַי בְּקַשְׁיוּ וְלָא תֵיבוּן לְקַבָּלָא לְמֵימְרִי וְאוֹסֵף לֶאֱתָאָה עֲלֵיכוֹן מָחָא שְׁבַע כְּחוֹבֵיכוֹן
verses.ar_en: If you walk contrary to [before] Me and have no desire to listen to Me [accept My Word], I will increase [to bring] the blows upon you sevenfold, as your sins.

verses.ar_he: וֶאֶגָרֵי בְכוֹן יָת חֵוַת בָּרָא וּתְתַכֵּל יָתְכוֹן וּתְשֵׁיצֵי יָת בְּעִירְכוֹן וְתַזְעֵר יָתְכוֹן וִיצַדְיָן אוֹרְחָתְכוֹן
verses.ar_en: I will send [incite] among you wild animals of the field and they will make you bereft of children, destroy your cattle, reduce your [population] and make your roads into wasteland.

verses.ar_he: וְאִם בְּאִלֵין לָא תִתְרְדוּן לְמֵימְרִי וּתְהָכוּן קֳדָמַי בְּקַשְׁיוּ
verses.ar_en: If after these [catastrophes] you have not been disciplined [to listen] to Me [My Word], and walk contrary to [before] Me,

verses.ar_he: וְאֵהַךְ אַף אֲנָא עִמְכוֹן בְּקַשְׁיוּ וְאַלְקֵי יָתְכוֹן אַף אֲנָא שְׁבַע עַל חוֹבֵיכוֹן
verses.ar_en: [Then] I, too, will walk contrary to you; and I shall also smite you seven fold, for your sins.

verses.ar_he: וְאַיְתִי עֲלֵיכוֹן דְקָטְלִין בְּחַרְבָּא וְיִתְפָּרְעוּן מִנְכוֹן פּוּרְעֲנוּתָא עַל דַעֲבַרְתּוּן עַל פִתְגָמֵי אוֹרַיְתָא וְתִתְכַּנְשׁוּן לְקִרְוֵיכוֹן וֶאֱגָרֵי מוֹתָנָא בֵּינֵיכוֹן וְתִתְמַסְרוּן בִּידָא דְסָנְאָה
verses.ar_en: I will bring [people who kill with a sword] an avenging sword upon you avenging the covenant [and they will avenge from you a vengeance for transgressing the words of the Torah] You will be huddled [in your cities]. I will send [incite] pestilence among you and you will be given into the hand of the enemy.

verses.ar_he: בִּדְאִתְּבַר לְכוֹן סָעִיד מֵיכְלָא וְיָפְיָן עֲסַר נְשִׁין לַחְמְכוֹן בְּתַנוּרָא חַד וִיתִיבוּן לַחְמְכוֹן בְּמַתְקְלָא וְתוֹכְלוּן וְלָא תִשְׂבְּעוּ ן
verses.ar_en: When I break the staff of your bread [food], ten women will bake your bread in one oven and they will return your bread by weight. You will eat but you will not be satiated.

verses.ar_he: וְאִם בְּדָא לָא תְקַבְּלוּן לְמֵימְרִי וּתְהָכוּן קֳדָמַי בְּקַשְׁיוּ
verses.ar_en: If [in spite] of this you [still] will not listen to Me [accept My Word], and you will walk contrary to [before] Me,

verses.ar_he: וְאֵהַךְ עִמְכוֹן בִּתְקוֹף רְגַז וְאִרְדֵי יָתְכוֹן אַף אֲנָא שְׁבַע עַל חוֹבֵיכוֹן
verses.ar_en: I will walk contrary to you in fury, and indeed I too shall punish you sevenfold, for your sins.

verses.ar_he: וְתֵיכְלוּן בְּשַׂר בְּנֵיכוֹן וּבְשַׂר בְּנָתֵיכוֹן תֵּיכְלוּן
verses.ar_en: You will eat the flesh of your sons and you will eat the flesh of your daughters.

verses.ar_he: וֶאֱשֵׁיצֵי יָת בָּמָתֵיכוֹן וֶאֱקַצֵץ יָת חֲנִיסְנְסֵיכוֹן וְאֶתֵּן יָת פִּגְרֵיכוֹן עַל פִּגוּר טַעֲוָתְכוֹן וִירַחֵק מֵימְרִי יָתְכוֹן
verses.ar_en: I will destroy your high places and I will smash your sun images. I will set your corpses upon the carcasses (remains) of your [false] idols, and My soul [word] will loathe [reject] you.

verses.ar_he: וְאֶתֵּן יָת קִרְוֵיכוֹן צָדָא וְאֶצְדֵי יָת מַקְדְשֵׁיכוֹן וְלָא אֲקַבֵּל בְּרַעֲוָא קֻרְבַּן כְּנִשָׁתְכוֹן
verses.ar_en: I will turn your cities into ruins and bring your Sanctuaries into desolation. I will no longer scent (accept favorably) the fragrance of your offerings [the offering of your gatherings].

verses.ar_he: וְאֶצְדֵי אֲנָא יָת אַרְעָא וִיצָרְיוּן עֲלַהּ בַּעֲלֵי דְבָבֵיכוֹן דְיָתְבוּן בַּהּ
verses.ar_en: I will make the land [so] desolate that your enemies who live on it will be astonished.

verses.ar_he: וְיָתְכוֹן אֲבַדַר בֵּינֵי עַמְמַיָא וֶאֱגָרֵי בַתְרֵיכוֹן דְקַטְלִין בְּחַרְבָּא וּתְהֵי אַרְעֲכוֹן צָדְיָא וְקִרְוֵיכוֹן יְהוֹן חָרְבָּא
verses.ar_en: I will scatter you among the nations and unsheath [incite people who kill with] the sword after you. Your land will be desolate and your cities will be in ruins.

verses.ar_he: בְּכֵן תַּרְעֵי אַרְעָא יָת שְׁמִטָהָא כֹּל יוֹמִין דִי צְדִיאַת וְאַתּוּן בְּאַרַע בַּעֲלֵי דְבָבֵיכוֹן בְּכֵן תַּשְׁמֵט אַרְעָא וְתִרְעֵי יָת שְׁמִטָּהָא
verses.ar_en: The land will then be appeased for its Shabbosos [rests] [during] all the days of its desolation while you are in the land of your enemies. Then the land will rest and be appeased for its Shabbosos [rests].

verses.ar_he: כָּל יוֹמִין דִי צְדִיאַת תַּשְׁמֵט יָת דִי לָא שְׁמֵטַת בִּשְׁמִטֵיכוֹן כַּד הֲוֵיתוּן יָתְבִין עֲלַהּ
verses.ar_en: All the days that it lies desolate it shall have its rest—the rest it did not have on your Shabbosos [rests] when you were living upon it.

verses.ar_he: וּדְיִשְׁתַּאֲרוּן בְּכוֹן וְאָעֵל תַּבְרָא בְּלִבְּהוֹן בְּאַרְעֲתָא דְסַנְאֵיהוֹן וְיִרְדוֹף יָתְהוֹן קַל טַרְפָּא דְשַׁקִיף וְיֵעַרְקֻן כְּמֵעִירוֹק מִן קֳדָם דְקַטְלִין בְּחַרְבָּא וְיִפְּלוּן וְלֵית דְרָדִיף
verses.ar_en: To those who survive among you, I will send timidity [brokenness] into their hearts [as they live] in the lands of their enemies. The sound of a blown leaf [beating] will put them to flight and they will flee as though fleeing from [before people who kill with] a sword; and they will fall with no one chasing them.

verses.ar_he: וְיִתַּקְלוּן גְבַר בְּאָחוּהִי כְּמִקֳדָם דְקָטְלִין בְּחַרְבָּא וְרָדִיף לָיִת וְלָא תְהֵי לְכוֹן תְּקוּמָה קֳדָם בַּעֲלֵי דְבָבֵיכוֹן
verses.ar_en: They will stumble over one other as though before [people who kill with] a sword when there is no pursuer, and you will have no power to stand upright before your enemies.

verses.ar_he: וְתֵבְדוּן בֵּינֵי עַמְמַיָא וּתְגַמַר יָתְכוֹן אֲרַע בַּעֲלֵי דְבָבֵיכוֹן
verses.ar_en: You will be lost among the nations and the land of your enemies will consume you.

verses.ar_he: וּדְיִשְׁתַּאֲרוּן בְּכוֹן יִתִּמְסוּן בְּחוֹבֵיהוֹן בְּאַרְעֲתָא בַּעֲלֵי דְבָבֵיכוֹן וְאַף בְּחוֹבֵי אֲבָהַתְהוֹן בִּישַׁיָא דַאֲחִידִין בִּידֵיהוֹן יִתִּמְסוּן
verses.ar_en: Those of you who survive will rot away [melt] in their iniquity in the land of your enemies, and also due to the iniquities of their [evil] ancestors which are [still] with them [they hold in their hands], [they] will they rot away [melt].

verses.ar_he: וִיוַדוּן יָת חוֹבֵיהוֹן וְיָת חוֹבֵי אֲבָהַתְהוֹן בְּשִׁקְרְהוֹן דְשַׁקָרוּ קֳדָמַי וְאַף דִי הַלִיכוּ קֳדָמַי בְּקַשְׁיוּ
verses.ar_en: They will [then] confess their iniquities and the iniquities of their ancestors in the unfaithfulness [dishonesty] with which they were unfaithful [dishonest] to [before] Me, and also for walking contrary to [before] Me.

verses.ar_he: אַף אֲנָא אֱהַךְ עִמְהוֹן בְּקַשְׁיוּ וְאָעֵיל יָתְהוֹן בְּאַרַע בַּעֲלֵי דְבָבֵיהוֹן אוֹ בְּכֵן יִתָּבַר לִבְּהוֹן טַפְשָׁא וּבְכֵן יִרְעוּן יָת חוֹבֵיהוֹן
verses.ar_en: I, too, will go contrary to them and bring them into the land of their enemies. Or perhaps then will be humbled [broken] their uncircumcised (unyielding) [unwise] heart and then their iniquities will be appeased (forgiven).

verses.ar_he: וְדָכִירְנָא יָת קְיָמִי דְעִם יַעֲקוֹב וְאַף יָת קְיָמִי דְעִם יִצְחָק וְאַף יָת קְיָמִי דְעִם אַבְרָהָם אֲנָא דָכִיר וְאַרְעָא אֲנָא דָכִיר
verses.ar_en: I will [then] remember My covenant with Yaakov and also My covenant with Yitzchok and also My covenant with Avrohom, I will remember and I will remember the land.

verses.ar_he: וְאַרְעָא תִתְרְטֵשׁ מִנְהוֹן וְתַרְעֵי יָת שְׁמִיטָהָא בְּדִצְדִיאַת מִנְהוֹן וְאִנוּן יִרְעוּן יָת חוֹבֵיהוֹן לְוָטִין חֳלַף בִּרְכָן אַיְתִי עֲלֵיהוֹן בְּדִיל דִבְדִינַי קָצוּ וְיָת קְיָמַי רְחֵקַת נַפְשְׁהוֹן
verses.ar_en: The land, being bereft of them, will be appeased for its Shabbosos [rests], during the time of its desolation from them and their iniquities will then be appeased (forgiven) [I will bring upon them curses instead of blessings] since what certainly caused [this] is that they despised My laws and their soul loathed (rejected) My statutes.

verses.ar_he: וְאַף בְּרַם דָא בְּמֶהֱוֵיהוֹן בְּאַרַע בַּעֲלֵי דְבָבֵיהוֹן לָא אַרְטֵשִׁנוּן וְלָא אַרְחֵקִנוּן לְשֵׁיצָיוּתְהוֹן לְאַשְׁנָאָה קְיָמִי עִמְהוֹן אֲרֵי אֲנָא יְיָ אֱלָהֲהוֹן
verses.ar_en: All this not withstanding, even when they are in the land of their enemies I will not despise [abandon] them and I will not loathe [reject] them to annihilate them, to break [change] My covenant with them, for I am Adonoy, their God.

verses.ar_he: וְדָכִירְנָא לְהוֹן קְיַם קַדְמָאֵי דִי אַפֵּקִית יָתְהוֹן מֵאַרְעָא דְמִצְרַיִם לְעֵינֵי עַמְמַיָא לְמֶהֱוֵי לְהוֹן לֵאלָהָא אֲנָא יְיָ
verses.ar_en: I shall remember for them the covenant of their ancestors whom I brought out of the land of Egypt in sight of the nations to be a God for them, I am Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: אִלֵין קְיָמַיָא וְדִינַיָא וְאוֹרָיָתָא דִי יְהַב יְיָ בֵּין מֵימְרֵהּ וּבֵין בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל בְּטוּרָא דְסִינַי בִּידָא דְמֹשֶׁה
verses.ar_en: These are the statutes, the laws and the teachings that Adonoy set between Himself [His Word] and between Bnei Yisroel, on Mount Sinai, through the hand of Moshe.

verses.ar_he: וּמַלִיל יְיָ עִם מֹשֶׁה לְמֵימָר
verses.ar_en: Adonoy spoke to Moshe, saying;

verses.ar_he: מַלֵל עִם בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וְתֵימַר לְהוֹן גְבַר אֲרֵי יַפְרֵשׁ נְדַר בְּפֻרְסַן נַפְשָׁתָא קֳדָם יְיָ
verses.ar_en: Speak to Bnei Yisroel and say to them; when a person [orally] expresses a vow pledging valuation of souls, to [before] Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וִיהֵי פֻרְסָנֵהּ דְכוּרָא מִבַּר עֶסְרִין שְׁנִין וְעַד בַּר שִׁתִּין שְׁנִין וִיהֵי פֻרְסָנֵהּ חַמְשִׁין סִלְעִין דִכְסַף בְּסִלְעֵי קוּדְשָׁא
verses.ar_en: The valuation for a male shall be, from twenty years of age to sixty years of age your valuation shall be fifty holy silver shekalim [selaim].

verses.ar_he: וְאִם נְקוּבְתָא הִיא וִיהֵי פֻרְסָנֵהּ תְּלָתִין סִלְעִין
verses.ar_en: If it be a female, the valuation shall be thirty shekalim [selaim].

verses.ar_he: וְאִם מִבַּר חֲמֵשׁ שְׁנִין וְעַד בַּר עֶסְרִין שְׁנִין וִיהֵי פֻרְסָנֵהּ דְכוּרָא עֶסְרִין סִלְעִין וְלִנְקוּבְתָא עֲסַר סִלְעִין
verses.ar_en: If from five years of age to twenty years of age the valuation for a male shall be twenty shekalim [selaim], and for a female, ten shekalim [selaim].

verses.ar_he: וְאִם מִבַּר יַרְחָא וְעַד בַּר חֲמֵשׁ שְׁנִין וִיהֵי פֻרְסָנֵהּ דְכוּרָא חֲמֵשׁ סִלְעִין דִכְסָף וְלִנְקוּבְתָא פֻרְסָנֵהּ תְּלַת סִלְעִין דִכְסָף
verses.ar_en: If from one month of age to five years of age the valuation of a male shall be five silver shekalim [selaim] and the valuation for a female is three silver shekalim [selaim].

verses.ar_he: וְאִם מִבַּר שִׁתִּין שְׁנִין וּלְעֵלָא אִם דְכוּרָא וִיהֵי פֻרְסָנֵהּ חֲמֵשׁ עֶסְרֵי סִלְעִין וְלִנְקוּבְתָא עֲסַר סִלְעִין
verses.ar_en: If from sixty and above, if he is a male the valuation shall be fifteen shekalim [selaim] and for a female, ten shekalim [selaim].

verses.ar_he: וְאִם מִסְכֵּן הוּא מִפֻּרְסָנֵהּ וִיקִימִנֵהּ קֳדָם כַּהֲנָא וְיִפְרוֹס יָתֵהּ כַּהֲנָא עַל מֵימַר דִי תַדְבֵּק יְדָא דְנוֹדֵרָא יִפְרְסִנֵהּ כַּהֲנָא
verses.ar_en: If he is [too] poor to pay the valuation he shall set him[self] [=he shall be presented] before the kohein, and the kohein will determine his valuation. According to the means of the one who vowed the kohein will determine his valuation.

verses.ar_he: וְאִם בְּעִירָא דִי יְקָרְבוּן מִנַהּ קֻרְבָּנָא קֳדָם יְיָ כָּל דִי יִתֵּן מִנֵהּ קֳדָם יְיָ יְהֵי קוּדְשָׁא
verses.ar_en: If [it is] an animal which can be brought as an offering to [before] Adonoy, any of it that he will give to [before] Adonoy shall become sacred.

verses.ar_he: לָא יְחַלְפִנֵהּ וְלָא יְעִבַּר יָתֵהּ טַּב בְּבִישׁ אוֹ בִישׁ בְּטָב וְאִם חַלָפָא יְחַלֵף בְּעִירָא בִּבְעִירָא וִיהֵי הוּא וְחִלוּפֵי יְהֵי קַדִישׁ
verses.ar_en: He shall not exchange it [with anothers animal] and he shall not change it [with his own animal] whether it be a good one for a worse one [or] a bad one for a better one. If he did exchange one animal for another animal, then both it and its replacement shall be sacred.

verses.ar_he: וְאִם כָּל בְּעִירָא מְסָאָבָא דִי לָא יְקָרְבוּן מִנַהּ קֻרְבָּנָא קֳדָם יְיָ וִיקִים יָת בְּעִירָא קֳדָם כַּהֲנָא
verses.ar_en: If it is any unclean (blemished) animal which cannot be offered to [before] Adonoy, he shall present the animal to the kohein.

verses.ar_he: וְיִפְרוֹס כַּהֲנָא יָתַהּ בֵּין טַב וּבֵין בִּישׁ כְּפֻרְסָנָא דְכַהֲנָא כֵּן יְהֵי
verses.ar_en: The kohein shall determine its value whether it is good or bad as the kohein determines its value for you, so shall it be.

verses.ar_he: וְאִם מִפְרַק יִפְרְקֻנֵהּ וְיוֹסֵף חֻמְשֵׁה עַל פֻּרְסָנֵהּ
verses.ar_en: If he will indeed redeem it he shall add on one fifth to its valuation.

verses.ar_he: וּגְבַר אֲרֵי יַקְדֵשׁ יָת בֵּיתֵהּ קוּדְשָׁא קֳדָם יְיָ וְיִפְרְסִנֵהּ כַּהֲנָא בֵּין טַב וּבֵין בִּישׁ כְּמָא דִי יִפְרוֹס יָתֵהּ כַּהֲנָא כֵּן יְקוּם
verses.ar_en: If a man will consecrate his house as being sacred to [before] Adonoy, the kohein shall determine its value, whether it is good or bad; as the kohein determines its value, so shall it be established.

verses.ar_he: וְאִם דְאַקְדֵשׁ יִפְרוֹק יָת בֵּיתֵהּ וְיוֹסֵף חוֹמֶשׁ כְּסַף פֻּרְסָנֵהּ עֲלוֹהִי וִיהֵי לֵהּ
verses.ar_en: If he who consecrated [his house] wishes to redeem his house, he shall add one fifth to its valuation money in addition to [the valuation], and [then] it belongs to him.

verses.ar_he: וְאִם מֵחֲקַל אַחֲסַנְתֵּהּ יַקְדִישׁ גְבַר קֳדָם יְיָ וִיהֵי פֻרְסָנֵהּ לְפוּם זַרְעֵהּ בַּר זְרַע כּוֹר שְׂעוֹרִין בְּחַמְשִׁין סִלְעִין דִכְסָף
verses.ar_en: If from his ancestral field a man will consecrate to [before] Adonoy its valuation shall be according to the measure of its seed; [at the rate of] one chomer [kor] of barley seed per fifty silver shekalim [selaim].

verses.ar_he: אִם מִשַּׁתָּא דְיוֹבֵלָא יַקְדֵשׁ חַקְלֵהּ כְּפֻרְסָנֵהּ יְקוּם
verses.ar_en: If immediately after the jubilee year he consecrates his field it shall be established according to its vaulation.

verses.ar_he: וְאִם בָּתַר יוֹבֵלָא יַקְדֵשׁ חַקְלֵהּ וִיחַשֵׁב לֵהּ כַּהֲנָא יָת כַּסְפָּא עַל מֵימַר שְׁנַיָא דְאִשְׁתָּאָרָן עַד שַׁתָּא דְיוֹבֵלָא וְיִתִּמְנַע מִפֻּרְסָנֵהּ
verses.ar_en: If after the jubilee he consecrates his field, then the kohein shall calculate the money [due] according to the remaining years until the jubilee year, and its valuation should be reduced accordingly.

verses.ar_he: וְאִם מִפְרַק יִפְרוֹק יָת חַקְלָא דְאַקְדֵשׁ יָתֵהּ וְיוֹסֵף חוֹמֶשׁ כְּסַף פֻּרְסָנֵהּ עֲלוֹהִי וִיקוּם לֵהּ
verses.ar_en: If he will [indeed] redeem the field, he who consecrated it, shall add one fifth to its monetary valuation, and it is then established as his.

verses.ar_he: וְאִם לָא יִפְרוֹק יָת חַקְלָא וְאִם זַבִּין יָת חַקְלָא לִגְבַר אָחֳרָן לָּא יִתְפָּרַק עוֹד
verses.ar_en: If he does not redeem the field and if he sells the field to another person, it shall not longer be redeemable.

verses.ar_he: וִיהֵי חַקְלָא בְּמִפְּקֵהּ בְּיוֹבֵלָא קוּדְשָׁא קֳדָם יְיָ כַּחֲקַל חֶרְמָא לְכַהֲנָא תְּהֵי אַחֲסַנְתֵּהּ
verses.ar_en: When the field is then released by the jubilee it becomes sacred to [before] Adonoy, just as a field that was consecrated, it shall belong to the kohein, [as] his possession.

verses.ar_he: וְאִם יָת חֲקַל זְבִינוֹהִי דִי לָא מֵחֲקַל אַחֲסַנְתֵּהּ יַקְדֵשׁ קֳדָם יְיָ
verses.ar_en: If it is a field that he purchased, that is not his ancestral field, [that] he consecrates to [before] Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וִיחַשֶׁב לֵהּ כַּהֲנָא יָת מִנְיַן פֻּרְסָנֵהּ עַד שַׁתָּא דְיוֹבֵלָא וְיִתֵּן יָת פֻרְסָנֵהּ בְּיוֹמָא הַהוּא קוּדְשָׁא קֳדָם יְיָ
verses.ar_en: The kohein will calculate for him the amount of its valuation until the jubilee year, and on that day he shall give its valuation as something sacred to [before] Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: בְּשַׁתָּא דְיוֹבֵלָא יְתוּב חַקְלָא לִדְזַבְנֵהּ מִנֵהּ לִדְדִילֵהּ אַחֲסָנַת אַרְעָא
verses.ar_en: In the jubilee year the field shall revert to him from whom it was purchased; to him whose ancestral land it is.

verses.ar_he: וְכָל פֻּרְסָנֵּה יְהֵי בְּסִלְעֵי קוּדְשָׁא עֶסְרִין מָעִין יְהֵי סִלְעָא
verses.ar_en: All of your valuations shall be in holy shekalim [selaim]; the shekel [sela] shall be twenty geirah [ma’in].

verses.ar_he: בְּרַם בּוּכְרָא דִי יִתְבַּכַּר קֳדָם יְיָ בִּבְעִירָא לָא יַקְדֵשׁ גְבַר יָתֵהּ אִם תּוֹר אִם אִמַר דַיְיָ הוּא
verses.ar_en: However, a firstling [animal] that is born first shall belong to [before] Adonoy [as a sacrifice] from among the domestic animals; a man shall not consecrate it [for any other purpose] whether it is an ox or a lamb, it belongs to Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וְאִם בִּבְעִירָא מְסָאָבָא וְיִפְרוֹק בְּפֻרְסָנֵהּ וְיוֹסֵף חֻמְשֵׁהּ עֲלוֹהִי וְאִם לָא יִתְפָּרַק וְיִזְדַבַּן בְּפֻרְסָנֵהּ
verses.ar_en: If it is of an unclean animal, he shall redeem it based on the valuation, and add a fifth to [that amount]. If it is not redeemed, it shall be sold according to the valuation.

verses.ar_he: בְּרַם כָּל חֶרְמָא דִי יַחְרֵם גְבַר קֳדָם יְיָ מִכָּל דִי לֵהּ מֵאֲנָשָׁא וּבְעִירָא וּמֵחֲקַל אַחֲסַנְתֵּהּ לָא יִזְדַבַּן וְלָא יִתְפָּרָק כָּל חֶרְמָא קֹדֶשׁ קוּדְשִׁין הוּא קֳדָם יְיָ
verses.ar_en: However, any dedication that a man will dedicate to [before] Adonoy from any of his belongings be it people (slave), or animal, or of the field of his ancestral land, [none of these] can be sold or redeemed. Everything that is dedicated is most holy, unto [before] Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: כָּל חֶרְמָא דִי יִתַּחְרַם מִן אֱנָשָׁא לָא יִתְפָּרָק אִתְקְטָלָא יִתְקְטֵל
verses.ar_en: Any dedication that a man will dedcate, regarding a man [due to be put to death] cannot be redeemed, he shall surely be put to death.

verses.ar_he: וְכָל מַעְשְׂרָא דְאַרְעָא מִזַרְעָא דְאַרְעָא מִפֵּירֵי אִילָנָא דַיְיָ הוּא קוּדְשָׁא קֳדָם יְיָ
verses.ar_en: All tithings of the land; whether of the seeds [crops] of the land or of the fruit of the tree, belongs to Adonoy, it is sacred to [before] Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וְאִם מִפְרַק יִפְרוֹק גְבַר מִמַעַשְׂרֵהּ חֻמְשֵׁהּ יוֹסֵף עֲלוֹהִי
verses.ar_en: If a man wishes to redeem of his tithe, he shall add a fifth to [the amount].

verses.ar_he: וְכָל מַעֲשַׂר תּוֹרִין וְעָן כֹּל דְיֵעִבַּר תְּחוֹת חֻטְרָא עֲשִׂירָאָה יְהֵי קַדִישׁ קֳדָם יְיָ
verses.ar_en: All tithes of cattle and sheep, anything that passes under the rod, the tenth one shall be sacred to [before] Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: לָא יְבַקַר בֵּין טַב לְבִישׁ וְלָא יְחַלְפִנֵהּ וְאִם חַלָפָא יְחַלְפִנֵהּ וִיהֵי הוּא וְחִלוּפֵהּ יְהֵי קוּדְשָׁא לָא יִתְפָּרָק
verses.ar_en: He shall not make a distinction between better or worse [animals] and he shall not exchange it. If he exchanges one for another, then [both] it and its replacement shall be sacred and it cannot be redeemed.

verses.ar_he: אִלֵין פִּקוֹדַיָא דִי פַקִיד יְיָ יָת מֹשֶׁה לְוָת בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל בְּטוּרָא דְסִינָי
verses.ar_en: These are the commandments which Adonoy commanded Moshe for Bnei Yisroel on Mount Sinai. Chazak
